                            <XMApp xml:id="S2.Ex2.m1.4.1">
                              <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMRef idref="S2.Ex2.m1.1"/>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex2.m1.1">g</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE">||</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex2.m1.2">ε</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S2.Ex2.m1.3"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN">||</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex2.m1.3">x</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE">||</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
          </equation>
          <p class="ltx_emph"><text font="italic">A <Math mode="inline" tex="(Q,\varepsilon)" text="open-interval@(Q, varepsilon)" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem1.p1.m10">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmtheorem1.p1.m10.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmtheorem1.p1.m10.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem1.p1.m10.1">Q</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem1.p1.m10.2">ε</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math>-invariant vector for <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem1.p1.m11">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is in particular non-zero.
A <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem1.p1.m12">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math></text>-invariant vector<text font="italic"> for <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem1.p1.m13">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is a vector <Math mode="inline" tex="x\in H" text="x element-of H" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem1.p1.m14">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi(g)x=x" text="pi * g * x = x" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem1.p1.m15">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.Thmtheorem1.p1.m15.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem1.p1.m15.1">g</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> for all <Math mode="inline" tex="g\in G" text="g element-of G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem1.p1.m16">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <para xml:id="S2.SS1.p2">
        <p>The notions of Kazhdan sets and Kazhdan pairs will be fundamental in our work.</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_definition" inlist="thm theorem:definition" labels="LABEL:Definition_2" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem2">
        <tags>
          <tag>Definition 2.2</tag>
          <tag role="autoref">2.2</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">2.2</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Definition 2.2</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Definition 2.2</text></tag></title>
        <para xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem2.p1">
          <p class="ltx_emph"><text font="italic">A subset <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem2.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> of a topological group <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem2.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is a </text>Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem2.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math><text font="italic"> if
there exists <Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon&gt;0" text="varepsilon &gt; 0" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem2.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> such that the following property holds true:
any unitary representation <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem2.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem2.p1.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> on a complex Hilbert space <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem2.p1.m7">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>
with a
<Math mode="inline" tex="({Q},\varepsilon)" text="open-interval@(Q, varepsilon)" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem2.p1.m8">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmtheorem2.p1.m8.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmtheorem2.p1.m8.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem2.p1.m8.1">Q</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem2.p1.m8.2">ε</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math>-invariant vector has a non-zero <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem2.p1.m9">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>-invariant vector.
<!--  %**** String Line 275 **** -->In this case, the pair <Math mode="inline" tex="({Q},\varepsilon)" text="open-interval@(Q, varepsilon)" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem2.p1.m10">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmtheorem2.p1.m10.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmtheorem2.p1.m10.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem2.p1.m10.1">Q</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem2.p1.m10.2">ε</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is </text>Kazhdan pair<text font="italic">, and
<Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon" text="varepsilon" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem2.p1.m11">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is a </text>Kazhdan constant for <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem2.p1.m12">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math><text font="italic">. A group <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem2.p1.m13">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> has </text>Property<text font="italic"> (T), or is a </text>Kazhdan group<text font="italic">, if it
admits a compact Kazhdan set.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <para xml:id="S2.SS1.p3">
        <p>Lastly, we introduce a generating property of a subset of a group, which is weaker that the notion of generating set as used for instance in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BdHV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>.</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_definition" inlist="thm theorem:definition" labels="LABEL:Definition_3" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem3">
        <tags>
          <tag>Definition 2.3</tag>
          <tag role="autoref">2.3</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">2.3</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Definition 2.3</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Definition 2.3</text></tag></title>
        <para xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem3.p1">
          <p class="ltx_emph"><text font="italic">If <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem3.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is any subset of a group <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem3.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, we denote by
<Math mode="inline" tex="\langle{Q}\rangle" text="delimited-⟨⟩@(Q)" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem3.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="delimited-⟨⟩"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmtheorem3.p1.m3.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem3.p1.m3.1">Q</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math> the smallest subgroup of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem3.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> containing <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem3.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, i. e. the set of all elements of the form <Math mode="inline" tex="g_{1}^{\,\pm 1}\dots g_{n}^{\,\pm 1}" text="(g _ 1) ^ (plus-or-minus 1) * dots * (g _ n) ^ (plus-or-minus 1)" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem3.p1.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" lpadding="1.7pt" meaning="plus-or-minus" name="pm" role="ADDOP">±</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" name="dots" role="ID">…</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" lpadding="1.7pt" meaning="plus-or-minus" name="pm" role="ADDOP">±</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="{n\geq 1}" text="n &gt;= 1" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem3.p1.m7">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="g_{1},\dots,g_{n}" text="list@(g _ 1, dots, g _ n)" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem3.p1.m8">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmtheorem3.p1.m8.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmtheorem3.p1.m8.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmtheorem3.p1.m8.3"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem3.p1.m8.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem3.p1.m8.1">…</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem3.p1.m8.3">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math> belong to <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem3.p1.m9">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>. We say that
<Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem3.p1.m10">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math></text> generates <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem3.p1.m11">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math><text font="italic"> if <Math mode="inline" tex="\langle{Q}\rangle=G" text="delimited-⟨⟩@(Q) = G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem3.p1.m12">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="delimited-⟨⟩"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.Thmtheorem3.p1.m12.1"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem3.p1.m12.1">Q</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>. It is equivalent to requiring that <Math mode="inline" tex="\widetilde{Q}={Q}\cup{Q}^{-1}" text="widetilde@(Q) = Q union Q ^ (- 1)" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem3.p1.m13">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="widetilde" role="OVERACCENT">~</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="union" name="cup" role="ADDOP">∪</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a generating set in the sense of <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BdHV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Sec. 7.1]</cite>.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
    </subsection>
    <subsection inlist="toc" xml:id="S2.SS2">
      <tags>
        <tag>2.2</tag>
        <tag role="autoref">subsection 2.2</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">2.2</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§2.2</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=" ">2.2</tag>Equidistributed sets in Moore groups</title>
      <para xml:id="S2.SS2.p1">
        <p>Our first main result provides a complete answer to Question
<ref labelref="LABEL:Question_1.3"/> when the group <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.SS2.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a second countable Moore group, i. e. when all irreducible representations of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.SS2.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> are finite dimensional. Locally compact Moore groups are completely described in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Mo" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>: a Lie group is a Moore group if and only
if it has a closed subgroup <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S2.SS2.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S2.SS2.p1.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> modulo its center is compact,
and a locally compact group is a Moore group if and only if it is a projective
limit of Lie groups which are Moore groups. See also the survey <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Pal" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>
for more information concerning the links between various properties of topological
groups, among them the property of being a Moore group. Of course
all locally compact abelian groups are Moore groups.</p>
      </para>
<!--  %**** String Line 300 **** -->      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_theorem" inlist="thm theorem:theorem" labels="LABEL:Theorem_3" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem4">
        <tags>
          <tag>Theorem 2.4</tag>
          <tag role="autoref">Theorem 2.4</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">2.4</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Theorem 2.4</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Theorem 2.4</text></tag></title>
        <para xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem4.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem4.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>

                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is a sequence of elements of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem4.p1.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>. Suppose that <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem4.p1.m7">

                <XMath>

                                                <XMRef idref="S2.Ex3.m1.2"/>
                                              </XMApp>
                                              <XMWrap>
                                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>

                                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                                              </XMWrap>
                                            </XMDual>
                                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                                          </XMApp>
                                          <ERROR class="undefined">\xymatrix</ERROR>
                                          <XMText>@C=13pt<text fontsize="70%">N<ERROR class="undefined">\ar</ERROR>[r]&amp;+</text></XMText>
                                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">&amp;</XMTok>
                                          <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                                        </XMApp>
                                      </XMApp>
                                    </XMApp>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" name="quad" role="PUNCT"> </XMTok>
                                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.Ex3.m1.3.1.2">
                                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                      <XMText rpadding="5.0pt"><text font="italic">for every</text></XMText>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                                    </XMApp>
                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S2.Ex3.m1.3.2">
                                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>

                            </XMWrap>

                          <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math>
                </equation>
              </para>
            </inline-para>
          </equation>
          <p><text font="italic">Then <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem4.p1.m10">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem4.p1.m11">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <para xml:id="S2.SS2.p2">
        <p>As explained in the introduction, property (<ref labelref="LABEL:Pro3"/>) above is an equidistribution property of the sequence
<Math mode="inline" tex="(g_{k})_{k\geq 1}" text="g _ k _ (k &gt;= 1)" xml:id="S2.SS2.p2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.SS2.p2.m1.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.SS2.p2.m1.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
It takes a more
familiar form when the group <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.SS2.p2.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is supposed to be abelian: it is equivalent to requiring that condition (<ref labelref="LABEL:(o)"/>) below holds true
for all characters <Math mode="inline" tex="\chi" text="chi" xml:id="S2.SS2.p2.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="chi" role="UNKNOWN">χ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of the group except possibly countably many.</p>
      </para>

      <para xml:id="S2.SS2.p3">
        <p>Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_1"/> can thus be seen as a particular case of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_3"/>, except for the fact that there is no need to suppose that the group is
second countable when it is known to be abelian.
Specializing Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_1"/> to the case where <Math mode="inline" tex="G={\mathbb{Z}}" text="G = Z" xml:id="S2.SS2.p3.m1">
            <XMath>

                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>

          </Math>, we obtain
the
following complete answer to Question <ref labelref="LABEL:Question_1"/> above:</p>

    <subsection inlist="toc" xml:id="S2.SS3">
      <tags>
        <tag>2.3</tag>
        <tag role="autoref">subsection 2.3</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">2.3</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§2.3</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=" ">2.3</tag>Kazhdan sets and finite dimensional subrepresentations</title>
      <para xml:id="S2.SS3.p1">
        <p>The proof of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_1"/> relies on Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/> below, which gives a new
condition for a “small perturbation” of a subset <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S2.SS3.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of a
group <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.SS3.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> to be a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.SS3.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/> constitutes the core of the paper, and has, besides the proofs of Theorems <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_3"/>, <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_1"/>, and <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_4"/>, several interesting applications
which we will present in Sections <ref labelref="LABEL:Section_7"/> and <ref labelref="LABEL:Section_8"/>.</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_theorem" inlist="thm theorem:theorem" labels="LABEL:Theorem_0" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem7">
        <tags>
          <tag>Theorem 2.7</tag>

        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Theorem 2.7</text></tag></title>
        <para xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem7.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem7.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a topological group, and let <Math mode="inline" tex="(W_{n})_{n\geq 1}" text="W _ n _ (n &gt;= 1)" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem7.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmtheorem7.p1.m2.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem7.p1.m2.1">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be an increasing sequence of
subsets of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem7.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="W_{1}" text="W _ 1" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem7.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is a
neighborhood of the unit element <Math mode="inline" tex="e" text="e" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem7.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem7.p1.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\bigcup_{\gnW}{}_{n}=G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem7.p1.m7">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="union" name="bigcup" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⋃</XMTok>
                    <ERROR class="undefined">\gnW</ERROR>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="pre3"/>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.
Let <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem7.p1.m8">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a subset of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem7.p1.m9">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> satisfying the following assumption:</text></p>
          <equation labels="LABEL:Pro1" xml:id="S2.Ex4">
            <tags>
              <tag>(*)</tag>
              <tag role="autoref"><text font="italic">Equation *</text></tag>
              <tag role="refnum">*</tag>
            </tags>
            <Math mode="display" tex="\quad\begin{minipage}{341.433071pt}&#10;there exists a positive constant $\varepsilon$ such that every unitary&#10;representation $\pi$ of $G$ on a Hilbert space $H$ admitting a&#10;$({Q},\varepsilon)$-invariant vector has a finite dimensional&#10;subrepresentation.&#10;\end{minipage}" text="[there exists a positive constant ε such that every unitary&#10;representation π of G on a Hilbert space H admitting a&#10;(Q,ε)-invariant vector has a finite dimensional&#10;subrepresentation.]" xml:id="S2.Ex4.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMText lpadding="10.0pt"><inline-para class="ltx_minipage" vattach="middle" width="341.4pt">
                    <para xml:id="S2.Ex4.m1.p1">
                      <p><text font="italic">there exists a positive constant </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon" text="varepsilon" xml:id="S2.Ex4.m1.p1.m1">
                          <XMath>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                          </XMath>
                        </Math><text font="italic"> such that every unitary
representation </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S2.Ex4.m1.p1.m2">
                          <XMath>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                          </XMath>
                        </Math><text font="italic"> of </text><Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Ex4.m1.p1.m3">
                          <XMath>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                          </XMath>
                        </Math><text font="italic"> on a Hilbert space </text><Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S2.Ex4.m1.p1.m4">
                          <XMath>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                          </XMath>
                        </Math><text font="italic"> admitting a
</text><Math mode="inline" tex="({Q},\varepsilon)" text="open-interval@(Q, varepsilon)" xml:id="S2.Ex4.m1.p1.m5">
                          <XMath>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                                <XMRef idref="S2.Ex4.m1.p1.m5.1"/>
                                <XMRef idref="S2.Ex4.m1.p1.m5.2"/>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex4.m1.p1.m5.1">Q</XMTok>
                                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex4.m1.p1.m5.2">ε</XMTok>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMath>
                        </Math><text font="italic">-invariant vector has a finite dimensional
subrepresentation.</text></p>
                    </para>
                  </inline-para></XMText>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
          </equation>
<!--  %**** String Line 375 **** -->        </para>
        <para class="ltx_noindent" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem7.p2">
          <p><text font="italic">Then there exists an integer <Math mode="inline" tex="{n\geq 1}" text="n &gt;= 1" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem7.p2.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}_{n}=W_{n}\cup{Q}" text="Q _ n = W _ n union Q" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem7.p2.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="union" name="cup" role="ADDOP">∪</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem7.p2.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.</text></p>
        </para>
        <para xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem7.p3">
          <p><text font="italic">If the group <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem7.p3.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is locally compact, the same statement holds true for any increasing
sequence <Math mode="inline" tex="(W_{n})_{n\geq 1}" text="W _ n _ (n &gt;= 1)" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem7.p3.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmtheorem7.p3.m2.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem7.p3.m2.1">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> of subsets of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem7.p3.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> such that
<Math mode="inline" tex="\bigcup_{\gnW}{}_{n}=G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem7.p3.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="union" name="bigcup" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⋃</XMTok>
                    <ERROR class="undefined">\gnW</ERROR>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="pre3"/>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> (we no longer need to request that <Math mode="inline" tex="W_{1}" text="W _ 1" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem7.p3.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a
neighborhood of <Math mode="inline" tex="e" text="e" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem7.p3.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>).</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <para xml:id="S2.SS3.p2">
        <p>If the group <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.SS3.p2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is locally compact and <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma" text="sigma" xml:id="S2.SS3.p2.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-compact, we can choose
for <Math mode="inline" tex="(W_{n})_{n\geq 1}" text="W _ n _ (n &gt;= 1)" xml:id="S2.SS3.p2.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.SS3.p2.m3.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.SS3.p2.m3.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> an increasing sequence of compact sets whose union is equal to
<Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.SS3.p2.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. If <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S2.SS3.p2.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a subset of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.SS3.p2.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> satisfying (<ref labelref="LABEL:Pro1"/>), there exists then by
Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/> a compact subset <Math mode="inline" tex="L" text="L" xml:id="S2.SS3.p2.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.SS3.p2.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="L\cup{Q}" text="L union Q" xml:id="S2.SS3.p2.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="union" name="cup" role="ADDOP">∪</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
is a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.SS3.p2.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. We thus retrieve a characterization of Property (T)
for <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma" text="sigma" xml:id="S2.SS3.p2.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-compact locally compact groups due to Bekka and Valette
<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, see also <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BdHV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Th. 2.12.9]</cite>. The original proof of this result relies on
the Delorme-Guichardet theorem that such a group has Property (T) if and
only if it has property (FH), that is every affine isometric action of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.SS3.p2.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on a real Hilbert space has a
fixed point. See Section <ref labelref="LABEL:Section_6"/> for more details.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S2.SS3.p3">
        <p>Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/> admits a simpler formulation if we build the
sequence <Math mode="inline" tex="(W_{n})_{n\geq 1}" text="W _ n _ (n &gt;= 1)" xml:id="S2.SS3.p3.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.SS3.p3.m1.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.SS3.p3.m1.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> starting from a set which generates the group in the sense of Definition <ref labelref="LABEL:Definition_3"/>:</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_corollary" inlist="thm theorem:corollary" labels="LABEL:Corollary_1" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem8">
        <tags>
          <tag>Corollary 2.8</tag>
          <tag role="autoref">2.8</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">2.8</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Corollary 2.8</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Corollary 2.8</text></tag></title>
        <para xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem8.p1">
          <p class="ltx_emph"><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem8.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a topological group.
<!--  %**** String Line 400 **** -->Let <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}_{0}" text="Q _ 0" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem8.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a subset of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem8.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> which generates <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem8.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and has non-empty
interior,
and
<Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem8.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> a subset of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem8.p1.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>. If <Math mode="inline" tex="Q" text="Q" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem8.p1.m7">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> satisfies assumption </text>(<ref labelref="LABEL:Pro1"/>)<text font="italic"> of Theorem
<ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/>, <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}_{0}\cup{Q}" text="Q _ 0 union Q" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem8.p1.m8">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="union" name="cup" role="ADDOP">∪</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem8.p1.m9">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.</text></p>
        </para>
        <para xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem8.p2">
          <p><text font="italic">If <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem8.p2.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is a locally compact group, it suffices to assume that
<Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}_{0}" text="Q _ 0" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem8.p2.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> generates <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem8.p2.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> in order to obtain the same conclusion.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <para xml:id="S2.SS3.p4">
        <p>One of the main consequences of Corollary <ref labelref="LABEL:Corollary_1"/> is Theorem
<ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_2"/> below, which shows in particular that property (<ref labelref="LABEL:Pro1"/>) of Theorem
<ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/> characterizes Kazhdan sets among sets which generate the
group (and have non-empty interior – this assumption has to be added if the group is not supposed to be locally compact).</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_theorem" inlist="thm theorem:theorem" labels="LABEL:Theorem_2" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem9">
        <tags>
          <tag>Theorem 2.9</tag>
          <tag role="autoref">Theorem 2.9</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">2.9</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Theorem 2.9</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Theorem 2.9</text></tag></title>
        <para xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem9.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem9.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a topological group and let <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem9.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a subset of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem9.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> which
generates <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem9.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and has non-empty interior. Then the following assertions are equivalent:</text></p>
          <enumerate xml:id="S2.I2">
            <item labels="LABEL:aa" xml:id="S2.I2.i1">
              <tags>
                <tag>(a)</tag>
                <tag role="autoref"><text font="italic">item a</text></tag>
                <tag role="refnum">a</tag>
                <tag role="typerefnum">item a</tag>
              </tags>
              <para xml:id="S2.I2.i1.p1">
                <p><Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S2.I2.i1.p1.m1">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> is a Kazhdan set in </text><Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.I2.i1.p1.m2">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic">;</text></p>
              </para>
            </item>
            <item labels="LABEL:bb" xml:id="S2.I2.i2">
              <tags>
                <tag>(b)</tag>
                <tag role="autoref"><text font="italic">item b</text></tag>
                <tag role="refnum">b</tag>
                <tag role="typerefnum">item b</tag>
              </tags>
              <para xml:id="S2.I2.i2.p1">
                <p><text font="italic">there exists a constant </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\delta\in(0,1)" text="delta element-of open-interval@(0, 1)" xml:id="S2.I2.i2.p1.m1">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
