                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S2.I2.i2.p1.m1.1"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S2.I2.i2.p1.m1.2"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.I2.i2.p1.m1.1">0</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                            <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.I2.i2.p1.m1.2">1</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> such that every unitary representation </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S2.I2.i2.p1.m2">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> of </text><Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.I2.i2.p1.m3">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> on a Hilbert space </text><Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S2.I2.i2.p1.m4">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> admitting a vector </text><Math mode="inline" tex="x\in H" text="x element-of H" xml:id="S2.I2.i2.p1.m5">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> such that </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\inf_{g\in{Q}}\left|{{\langle{\pi(g)x},{x}\rangle}}\right|&gt;\delta\|x\|^{2}" text="(infimum _ (g element-of Q))@(absolute-value@(list@(pi * g * x, x))) &gt; delta * (norm@(x)) ^ 2" xml:id="S2.I2.i2.p1.m6">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                            <XMTok meaning="infimum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="post">inf</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S2.I2.i2.p1.m6.4"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                              <XMDual xml:id="S2.I2.i2.p1.m6.4">
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                                  <XMRef idref="S2.I2.i2.p1.m6.4.1"/>
                                  <XMRef idref="S2.I2.i2.p1.m6.2"/>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMWrap>
                                  <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.I2.i2.p1.m6.4.1">
                                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                                    <XMDual>
                                      <XMRef idref="S2.I2.i2.p1.m6.1"/>
                                      <XMWrap>
                                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.I2.i2.p1.m6.1">g</XMTok>
                                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                      </XMWrap>
                                    </XMDual>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.I2.i2.p1.m6.2">x</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>
                              <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                                <XMRef idref="S2.I2.i2.p1.m6.3"/>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.I2.i2.p1.m6.3">x</XMTok>
                                <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> has a finite dimensional subrepresentation;</text></p>
              </para>
            </item>
            <item labels="LABEL:cc" xml:id="S2.I2.i3">
              <tags>
                <tag>(c)</tag>
                <tag role="autoref"><text font="italic">item c</text></tag>
                <tag role="refnum">c</tag>
                <tag role="typerefnum">item c</tag>
              </tags>
              <para xml:id="S2.I2.i3.p1">
                <p><text font="italic">there exists a positive constant </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon" text="varepsilon" xml:id="S2.I2.i3.p1.m1">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> such that every unitary
representation </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S2.I2.i3.p1.m2">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> of </text><Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.I2.i3.p1.m3">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> on a Hilbert space </text><Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S2.I2.i3.p1.m4">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> admitting a
</text><!--  %**** String Line 425 **** --><Math mode="inline" tex="({Q},\varepsilon)" text="open-interval@(Q, varepsilon)" xml:id="S2.I2.i3.p1.m5">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S2.I2.i3.p1.m5.1"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S2.I2.i3.p1.m5.2"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.I2.i3.p1.m5.1">Q</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.I2.i3.p1.m5.2">ε</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic">-invariant vector has a finite dimensional
subrepresentation.</text></p>
              </para>
            </item>
          </enumerate>
          <p><text font="italic">If the group <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem9.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is locally compact and <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem9.p1.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> generates <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem9.p1.m7">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, assertions (a), (b) and (c) above are equivalent.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <para xml:id="S2.SS3.p5">
        <p>Condition (b) in Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_2"/> is easily seen to be equivalent to condition (c), which is nothing else than assumption (<ref labelref="LABEL:Pro1"/>) of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/>. Its interest will become clearer in Section <ref labelref="LABEL:Section_7"/> below, where it will be used to obtain a characterization of Kazhdan sets in second countable locally compact abelian groups.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S2.SS3.p6">
        <p>The assumption that <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S2.SS3.p6.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> generates <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.SS3.p6.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> cannot be dispensed with in
Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_2"/>: <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}=2{\mathbb{Z}}" text="Q = 2 * Z" xml:id="S2.SS3.p6.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a subset of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{Z}}" text="Z" xml:id="S2.SS3.p6.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> which
satisfies property (<ref labelref="LABEL:cc"/>), but <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S2.SS3.p6.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is clearly not a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{Z}}" text="Z" xml:id="S2.SS3.p6.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, while <Math mode="inline" tex="\{1\}\cup{Q}" text="set@(1) union Q" xml:id="S2.SS3.p6.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="union" name="cup" role="ADDOP">∪</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.SS3.p6.m7.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.SS3.p6.m7.1">1</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is one. Indeed, if <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.SS3.p6.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a discrete
group, a Kazhdan subset <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S2.SS3.p6.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.SS3.p6.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> must necessarily generate <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.SS3.p6.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> (see <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BdHV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Prop. 1.3.2]</cite>). Hence
Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_2"/> can be reformulated in the case of discrete groups so as to give a complete
characterization of Kazhdan sets in <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.SS3.p6.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> in terms of assumption (<ref labelref="LABEL:Pro1"/>)
of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/>:</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_theorem" inlist="thm theorem:theorem" labels="LABEL:Corollary_100" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem10">
        <tags>
          <tag>Theorem 2.10</tag>
          <tag role="autoref">Theorem 2.10</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">2.10</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Theorem 2.10</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Theorem 2.10</text></tag></title>
        <para xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem10.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem10.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a discrete group, and let <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem10.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a subset of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.Thmtheorem10.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>. The
following assertions are equivalent:</text></p>
          <enumerate xml:id="S2.I3">
            <item labels="LABEL:aaa" xml:id="S2.I3.i1">
              <tags>
                <tag>(a)</tag>
                <tag role="autoref"><text font="italic">item a</text></tag>
                <tag role="refnum">a</tag>
                <tag role="typerefnum">item a</tag>
              </tags>
              <para xml:id="S2.I3.i1.p1">
                <p><Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S2.I3.i1.p1.m1">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> is a Kazhdan set in </text><Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.I3.i1.p1.m2">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic">;</text></p>
              </para>
            </item>
            <item labels="LABEL:bbb" xml:id="S2.I3.i2">
              <tags>
                <tag>(b)</tag>
                <tag role="autoref"><text font="italic">item b</text></tag>
                <tag role="refnum">b</tag>
                <tag role="typerefnum">item b</tag>
              </tags>
              <para xml:id="S2.I3.i2.p1">
                <p><Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S2.I3.i2.p1.m1">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> generates </text><Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.I3.i2.p1.m2">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic">, and there exists a constant </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\delta\in(0,1)" text="delta element-of open-interval@(0, 1)" xml:id="S2.I3.i2.p1.m3">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S2.I3.i2.p1.m3.1"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S2.I3.i2.p1.m3.2"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.I3.i2.p1.m3.1">0</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                            <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.I3.i2.p1.m3.2">1</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> such that every unitary representation </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S2.I3.i2.p1.m4">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> of </text><Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.I3.i2.p1.m5">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> on a Hilbert space </text><Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S2.I3.i2.p1.m6">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> for which there exists a vector </text><Math mode="inline" tex="x\in H" text="x element-of H" xml:id="S2.I3.i2.p1.m7">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> such that </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\inf_{g\in{Q}}\left|{{\langle{\pi(g)x},{x}\rangle}}\right|&gt;\delta\|x\|^{2}" text="(infimum _ (g element-of Q))@(absolute-value@(list@(pi * g * x, x))) &gt; delta * (norm@(x)) ^ 2" xml:id="S2.I3.i2.p1.m8">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                            <XMTok meaning="infimum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="post">inf</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S2.I3.i2.p1.m8.4"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                              <XMDual xml:id="S2.I3.i2.p1.m8.4">
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                                  <XMRef idref="S2.I3.i2.p1.m8.4.1"/>
                                  <XMRef idref="S2.I3.i2.p1.m8.2"/>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMWrap>
                                  <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.I3.i2.p1.m8.4.1">
                                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                                    <XMDual>
                                      <XMRef idref="S2.I3.i2.p1.m8.1"/>
                                      <XMWrap>
                                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.I3.i2.p1.m8.1">g</XMTok>
                                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                      </XMWrap>
                                    </XMDual>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.I3.i2.p1.m8.2">x</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>
                              <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                                <XMRef idref="S2.I3.i2.p1.m8.3"/>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.I3.i2.p1.m8.3">x</XMTok>
                                <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> has a finite dimensional subrepresentation;</text></p>
              </para>
            </item>
            <item labels="LABEL:ccc" xml:id="S2.I3.i3">
              <tags>
                <tag>(c)</tag>
                <tag role="autoref"><text font="italic">item c</text></tag>
                <tag role="refnum">c</tag>
                <tag role="typerefnum">item c</tag>
              </tags>
              <para xml:id="S2.I3.i3.p1">
                <p><Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S2.I3.i3.p1.m1">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> generates </text><Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.I3.i3.p1.m2">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic">, and there exists a positive constant </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon" text="varepsilon" xml:id="S2.I3.i3.p1.m3">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> such that every unitary
</text><!--  %**** String Line 450 **** --><text font="italic">representation </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S2.I3.i3.p1.m4">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> of </text><Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.I3.i3.p1.m5">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> on a Hilbert space </text><Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S2.I3.i3.p1.m6">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> admitting a
</text><Math mode="inline" tex="({Q},\varepsilon)" text="open-interval@(Q, varepsilon)" xml:id="S2.I3.i3.p1.m7">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S2.I3.i3.p1.m7.1"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S2.I3.i3.p1.m7.2"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.I3.i3.p1.m7.1">Q</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.I3.i3.p1.m7.2">ε</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic">-invariant vector has a finite dimensional
subrepresentation.</text></p>
              </para>
            </item>
          </enumerate>
        </para>
      </theorem>
    </subsection>
    <subsection inlist="toc" xml:id="S2.SS4">
      <tags>
        <tag>2.4</tag>
        <tag role="autoref">subsection 2.4</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">2.4</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§2.4</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=" ">2.4</tag>Examples and applications</title>
      <para xml:id="S2.SS4.p1">
        <p>We characterize Kazhdan sets in various groups in which irreducible unitary representations are completely described. Using the new criterion provided by Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_2"/>, we first provide such a characterization of Kazhdan sets in second countable locally compact abelian groups (Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:nimporte"/>). In the case of the group <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{Z}}" text="Z" xml:id="S2.SS4.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, the characterization we obtain (Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:nimportebis"/>) involves a classic class of sets in hamonic analysis, called Kaufman sets. We also present some examples of Kazhdan sets in this setting. We then describe Kazhdan sets in the Heisenberg groups <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{n}" text="H _ n" xml:id="S2.SS4.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="n\geq 1" text="n &gt;= 1" xml:id="S2.SS4.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> (Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_F"/>) and in the <Math mode="inline" tex="ax+b" text="a * x + b" xml:id="S2.SS4.p1.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> group (Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_N"/>). We finally study Kazhdan sets in groups with the Howe-Moore property, and obtain a complete characterization of Kazhdan sets in groups with the Howe-Moore property but without Property (T) (Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_I"/>), which yields a
description of Kazhdan sets in <Math mode="inline" tex="SL_{2}({\mathbb{R}})" text="S * L _ 2 * R" xml:id="S2.SS4.p1.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.SS4.p1.m5.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.SS4.p1.m5.1">R</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. See Section <ref labelref="LABEL:Section_7"/> for detailed statements of these results, which provide an answer to Question <ref labelref="LABEL:Question_00"/>.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S2.SS4.p2">
        <p>We also obtain two further applications of Kazhdan sets. The first one (Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:thm:rapinchuk"/>) is a generalization of a result of Rapinchuk <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="rapin" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> concerning the local rigidity of finite dimensional unitary representations in discrete groups with Property (T).
The second application (Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_AA"/>) consists in a version for Kazhdan sets of a characterization of Property (T) due to Connes and Weiss <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="CW" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>. Namely, we prove that if <Math mode="inline" tex="Q" text="Q" xml:id="S2.SS4.p2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
is a subset of a topological group <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.SS4.p2.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> which generates <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.SS4.p2.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, it is a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.SS4.p2.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> if and only if every weakly mixing action of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.SS4.p2.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on a probability space is <Math mode="inline" tex="Q" text="Q" xml:id="S2.SS4.p2.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-strongly ergodic (see Section <ref labelref="LABEL:Section_8.2"/>
for definitions). These applications highlight one more time the importance of determining Kazhdan sets in general groups.</p>
      </para>
    </subsection>
    <subsection inlist="toc" xml:id="S2.SS5">
      <tags>
        <tag>2.5</tag>
        <tag role="autoref">subsection 2.5</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">2.5</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§2.5</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=" ">2.5</tag>Organization of the paper</title>
      <para xml:id="S2.SS5.p1">
        <p>The first half of the paper is devoted to the proof of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_2"/>. Section <ref labelref="LABEL:Section_3"/> is mostly expository, and presents some essential results and tools concerning ergodic theory for unitary
representations of arbitrary topological groups. Section <ref labelref="LABEL:Section_4"/>
is devoted to the proof of an abstract version of the Wiener Theorem
(Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_5.6"/>): if
<Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S2.SS5.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is any unitary representation of a topological group <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.SS5.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on a
Hilbert space
<Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S2.SS5.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_5.6"/> provides an explicit expression for the
quantities <Math mode="inline" tex="m_{G}(\,|{{\langle{\pi(\,\centerdot\,)x},{y}\rangle}}|^{2})" text="m _ G * (absolute-value@(list@(pi * centerdot * x, y))) ^ 2" xml:id="S2.SS5.p1.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.SS5.p1.m4.3"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" rpadding="1.7pt" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.SS5.p1.m4.3">
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S2.SS5.p1.m4.3.1"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                          <XMDual xml:id="S2.SS5.p1.m4.3.1">
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S2.SS5.p1.m4.3.1.1"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S2.SS5.p1.m4.2"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S2.SS5.p1.m4.3.1.1">
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMRef idref="S2.SS5.p1.m4.1"/>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok role="OPEN" rpadding="1.7pt" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok name="centerdot" role="MULOP" rpadding="1.7pt" xml:id="S2.SS5.p1.m4.1">∙</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.SS5.p1.m4.2">y</XMTok>
                              <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="x,y\in H" text="list@(x, y) element-of H" xml:id="S2.SS5.p1.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.SS5.p1.m5.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.SS5.p1.m5.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.SS5.p1.m5.1">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.SS5.p1.m5.2">y</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>,
where <Math mode="inline" tex="m_{G}" text="m _ G" xml:id="S2.SS5.p1.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is the unique invariant mean on <text class="ltx_markedasmath">WAP(G)</text>.
This theorem is crucial for the proof of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/>, which
<!--  %**** String Line 475 **** -->proceeds by contradiction: we use Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_5.6"/> to show that
certain infinite tensor products
of finite dimensional representations are weakly mixing.
The proof of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/> is given in Section <ref labelref="LABEL:Section_5"/>. The equidistribution criteria for Kazhdan sets (Theorems <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_3"/>, <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_1"/> and <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_4"/>) are proved in Section <ref labelref="LABEL:Section_6"/>, as well as
Corollary
<ref labelref="LABEL:Corollary_1"/>, Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_2"/> and Corollary <ref labelref="LABEL:Corollary_100"/>. Section <ref labelref="LABEL:Section_7"/> is devoted to examples; the characterizations of Kazhdan sets in second countable locally compact abelian groups, and in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{Z}}" text="Z" xml:id="S2.SS5.p1.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> in particular, in the Heisenberg groups, the
<Math mode="inline" tex="ax+b" text="a * x + b" xml:id="S2.SS5.p1.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> group, and groups with the Howe-Moore property are proved in Theorems <ref labelref="LABEL:nimporte"/>, <ref labelref="LABEL:nimportebis"/>, <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_F"/>, <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_N"/> and <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_I"/> respectively. The extensions of the Rapinchuk rigidity result <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="rapin" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> and of the Connes-Weiss characterization of Property (T) <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="CW" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> are proved in Section <ref labelref="LABEL:Section_8"/>. The paper also contains an appendix which reviews some constructions of infinite tensor products of Hilbert spaces and of unitary representations, which are used in the proof of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/>.</p>
      </para>
    </subsection>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:Section_3" xml:id="S3">
    <tags>
      <tag>3</tag>
      <tag role="autoref">section 3</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">3</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">§3</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=" ">3</tag>Ergodic theory and mixing properties for unitary representations
of topological groups</title>
    <para xml:id="S3.p1">
      <p>The proof of our main theorem will require a rather precise knowledge of
the structure of unitary representations of a topological group <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S3.p1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. We
first recall in this section some definitions and results that we will need. They can be found for instance in the forthcoming book <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Ke" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, the notes
<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Pet" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, and the paper <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BR" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> by Bergelson and
Rosenblatt.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S3.p2">
      <p>Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S3.p2.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> be a unitary representation
of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S3.p2.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> on a complex Hilbert space <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S3.p2.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. In the case where <Math mode="inline" tex="G={\mathbb{Z}}" text="G = Z" xml:id="S3.p2.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, the
well-known (weak) ergodic theorem of von Neumann states that if <Math mode="inline" tex="U" text="U" xml:id="S3.p2.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a
unitary operator on <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S3.p2.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>,</p>
      <equation xml:id="S3.Ex5">
        <Math mode="display" tex="\xymatrix{\dfrac{1}{N}{\displaystyle}\sum_{n=1}^{N}{{\langle{U^{n}x},{y}%&#10;\rangle}}\ar[r]&amp;{{\langle{Px},{y}\rangle}}}" text="[\xymatrix] * (1 / N) * ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ N)@(list@(U ^ n * x, y) * [\ar] * delimited-[]@(r) * &amp; * list@(P * x, y))" xml:id="S3.Ex5.m1">

      <equation xml:id="S3.Ex6">
        <Math mode="display" tex="{{\langle{\pi(\centerdot)x},{y}\rangle}},\quad\bigl{|}{{\langle{\pi(\centerdot%&#10;)x},{y}\rangle}}\bigr{|},\quad\textrm{and}\quad\bigl{|}{{\langle{\pi(%&#10;\centerdot)x},{y}\rangle}}\bigr{|}^{2}\!," text="list@(list@(pi * centerdot * x, y), absolute-value@(list@(pi * centerdot * x, y)), [and], (absolute-value@(list@(pi * centerdot * x, y))) ^ 2)" xml:id="S3.Ex6.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S3.Ex6.m1.8"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMDual xml:id="S3.Ex6.m1.8">
                  <XMApp>

      </equation>
      <p>where <Math mode="inline" tex="x" text="x" xml:id="S3.p2.m34">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="y" text="y" xml:id="S3.p2.m35">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are any vectors of <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S3.p2.m36">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, belong to
WAP<Math mode="inline" tex="(G)" text="G" xml:id="S3.p2.m37">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S3.p2.m37.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p2.m37.1">G</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
For more on weakly almost periodic functions on a group, see for instance <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Bur" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> or <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Gl" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Ch. 1, Sec. 9]</cite>.
The interest of the class of weakly almost periodic functions on <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S3.p2.m38">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in
our context is that there exists on WAP<Math mode="inline" tex="(G)" text="G" xml:id="S3.p2.m39">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S3.p2.m39.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p2.m39.1">G</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> a unique <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S3.p2.m40">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-invariant
<!--  %**** String Line 525 **** -->mean <Math mode="inline" tex="m" text="m" xml:id="S3.p2.m41">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. It satisfies</p>
      <equation xml:id="S3.Ex7">
        <Math mode="display" tex="m(f(s^{-1}\centerdot))=m(f(\,\centerdot\,\,s^{-1}))=m(f)" xml:id="S3.Ex7.m1">

      <p>for every <Math mode="inline" tex="f\in\mbox{WAP$(G)$}" text="f element-of [WAP(G)]" xml:id="S3.p2.m42">

The abstract ergodic theorem then states that if
<Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S3.p2.m44">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a unitary representation
of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S3.p2.m45">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S3.p2.m46">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>,</p>
      <equation xml:id="S3.Ex8">
        <Math mode="display" tex="m({{\langle{\pi(\centerdot)x},{y}\rangle}})={{\langle{P_{\pi}x},{y}\rangle}}" text="m * list@(pi * centerdot * x, y) = list@(P _ pi * x, y)" xml:id="S3.Ex8.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>

                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S3.Ex8.m1.1"/>

                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                        <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>

                  <XMRef idref="S3.Ex8.m1.5"/>

                </XMApp>

        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>for every vectors <Math mode="inline" tex="x,y\in H" text="list@(x, y) element-of H" xml:id="S3.p2.m47">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>

      <equation xml:id="S3.Ex9">
        <Math mode="display" tex="E_{\pi}=\{x\in H\,;\,\pi(g)x=x\ \ \textrm{for every}\ g\in G\}" xml:id="S3.Ex9.m1">

              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
