              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="quad" role="PUNCT"> </XMTok>
              <XMText rpadding="5.0pt">for every</XMText>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
            </XMWrap>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S3.p2.m50">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-invariant vectors for <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S3.p2.m51">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. The representation <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S3.p2.m52">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">ergodic</text>
(i. e. admits no non-zero <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S3.p2.m53">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-invariant vector) if and only if <Math mode="inline" tex="m({{\langle{\pi(\centerdot)x},{y}\rangle}})=0" text="m * list@(pi * centerdot * x, y) = 0" xml:id="S3.p2.m54">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p2.m54.3"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMDual xml:id="S3.p2.m54.3">
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.p2.m54.3.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.p2.m54.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S3.p2.m54.3.1">
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S3.p2.m54.1"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMTok name="centerdot" role="MULOP" xml:id="S3.p2.m54.1">∙</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p2.m54.2">y</XMTok>
                        <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> for every <Math mode="inline" tex="x,y\in H" text="list@(x, y) element-of H" xml:id="S3.p2.m55">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p2.m55.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p2.m55.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p2.m55.1">x</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p2.m55.2">y</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S3.p3">
      <p>Following <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BR" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, let us now recall that the representation
<Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S3.p3.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is said to be <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">weakly mixing</text>
if <Math mode="inline" tex="m(|{{\langle{\pi(\centerdot)x},{x}\rangle}}|)=0" text="m * absolute-value@(list@(pi * centerdot * x, x)) = 0" xml:id="S3.p3.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p3.m2.3"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMDual xml:id="S3.p3.m2.3">
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.p3.m2.3.1"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        <XMDual xml:id="S3.p3.m2.3.1">
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S3.p3.m2.3.1.1"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S3.p3.m2.2"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S3.p3.m2.3.1.1">
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                              <XMDual>
                                <XMRef idref="S3.p3.m2.1"/>
                                <XMWrap>
                                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok name="centerdot" role="MULOP" xml:id="S3.p3.m2.1">∙</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p3.m2.2">x</XMTok>
                            <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> for every <Math mode="inline" tex="x\in H" text="x element-of H" xml:id="S3.p3.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, or, equivalently,
<!--  %**** String Line 550 **** --><Math mode="inline" tex="m(|{{\langle{\pi(\centerdot)x},{x}\rangle}}|^{2})=0" text="m * (absolute-value@(list@(pi * centerdot * x, x))) ^ 2 = 0" xml:id="S3.p3.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p3.m4.3"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.p3.m4.3">
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S3.p3.m4.3.1"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                          <XMDual xml:id="S3.p3.m4.3.1">
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S3.p3.m4.3.1.1"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S3.p3.m4.2"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S3.p3.m4.3.1.1">
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMRef idref="S3.p3.m4.1"/>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok name="centerdot" role="MULOP" xml:id="S3.p3.m4.1">∙</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p3.m4.2">x</XMTok>
                              <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> for every <Math mode="inline" tex="x\in H" text="x element-of H" xml:id="S3.p3.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. Then
<Math mode="inline" tex="m(|{{\langle{\pi(\centerdot)x},{y}\rangle}}|)=m(|{{\langle{\pi(\centerdot)x},{%&#10;y}\rangle}}|^{2})=0" text="m * absolute-value@(list@(pi * centerdot * x, y)) = m * (absolute-value@(list@(pi * centerdot * x, y))) ^ 2 = 0" xml:id="S3.p3.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p3.m6.5"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMDual xml:id="S3.p3.m6.5">
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.p3.m6.5.1"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        <XMDual xml:id="S3.p3.m6.5.1">
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S3.p3.m6.5.1.1"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S3.p3.m6.2"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S3.p3.m6.5.1.1">
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                              <XMDual>
                                <XMRef idref="S3.p3.m6.1"/>
                                <XMWrap>
                                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok name="centerdot" role="MULOP" xml:id="S3.p3.m6.1">∙</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p3.m6.2">y</XMTok>
                            <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p3.m6.6"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.p3.m6.6">
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S3.p3.m6.6.1"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                          <XMDual xml:id="S3.p3.m6.6.1">
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S3.p3.m6.6.1.1"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S3.p3.m6.4"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S3.p3.m6.6.1.1">
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMRef idref="S3.p3.m6.3"/>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok name="centerdot" role="MULOP" xml:id="S3.p3.m6.3">∙</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p3.m6.4">y</XMTok>
                              <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> for every <Math mode="inline" tex="x,y\in H" text="list@(x, y) element-of H" xml:id="S3.p3.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p3.m7.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p3.m7.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p3.m7.1">x</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p3.m7.2">y</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S3.p4">
      <p>There are several important characterizations of weak mixing for unitary
representations, one of which involves the adjoint representation
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\overline{{\pi}}}" text="overline@(pi)" xml:id="S3.p4.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of a unitary representation
<Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S3.p4.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S3.p4.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S3.p4.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. It is a representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S3.p4.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> on
the adjoint Hilbert space <Math mode="inline" tex="{\overline{{H}}}" text="overline@(H)" xml:id="S3.p4.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>: <Math mode="inline" tex="{\overline{{H}}}" text="overline@(H)" xml:id="S3.p4.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
coincides with <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S3.p4.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> as a set, and its elements are denoted by
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\overline{{x}}}" text="overline@(x)" xml:id="S3.p4.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="x\in H" text="x element-of H" xml:id="S3.p4.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. The multiplication by a scalar
<Math mode="inline" tex="\lambda" text="lambda" xml:id="S3.p4.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="{\overline{{H}}}" text="overline@(H)" xml:id="S3.p4.m12">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is defined by <Math mode="inline" tex="\lambda{\overline{{x}}}={\overline{{{\overline{{\lambda}}}x}}}" text="lambda * overline@(x) = overline@(overline@(lambda) * x)" xml:id="S3.p4.m13">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> for every
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\overline{{x}}}\in{\overline{{H}}}" text="overline@(x) element-of overline@(H)" xml:id="S3.p4.m14">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, and the scalar product of
two elements <Math mode="inline" tex="{\overline{{x}}}" text="overline@(x)" xml:id="S3.p4.m15">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="{\overline{{y}}}" text="overline@(y)" xml:id="S3.p4.m16">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\overline{{H}}}" text="overline@(H)" xml:id="S3.p4.m17">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is given by <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\langle{{\overline{{x}}}},{{\overline{{y}}}}\rangle}}={\overline{{{{\langle{%&#10;x},{y}\rangle}}}}}" text="list@(overline@(x), overline@(y)) = overline@(list@(x, y))" xml:id="S3.p4.m18">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p4.m18.3"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p4.m18.4"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S3.p4.m18.3">
                    <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S3.p4.m18.4">
                    <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.p4.m18.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.p4.m18.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p4.m18.1">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p4.m18.2">y</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. Then the representation
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\overline{{\pi}}}" text="overline@(pi)" xml:id="S3.p4.m19">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S3.p4.m20">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="{\overline{{H}}}" text="overline@(H)" xml:id="S3.p4.m21">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
is defined by setting <Math mode="inline" tex="{\overline{{\pi}}}(g){\overline{{x}}}={\overline{{\pi(g)x}}}" text="overline@(pi) * g * overline@(x) = overline@(pi * g * x)" xml:id="S3.p4.m22">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p4.m22.2"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p4.m22.2">g</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.p4.m22.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p4.m22.1">g</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> for every <Math mode="inline" tex="g\in G" text="g element-of G" xml:id="S3.p4.m23">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and every <Math mode="inline" tex="{\overline{{x}}}\in{\overline{{H}}}" text="overline@(x) element-of overline@(H)" xml:id="S3.p4.m24">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S3.p5">
      <p>Weak mixing for unitary representations is characterized by the fact that
the tensor product representation <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi{\otimes}{\overline{{\pi}}}" text="pi tensor-product overline@(pi)" xml:id="S3.p5.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of
<Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S3.p5.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="H{\otimes}{\overline{{H}}}" text="H tensor-product overline@(H)" xml:id="S3.p5.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is ergodic, i. e. admits
no non-zero <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S3.p5.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-invariant vector. This relies on the observation
<!--  %**** String Line 575 **** -->that for any vectors <Math mode="inline" tex="x,y\in H" text="list@(x, y) element-of H" xml:id="S3.p5.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p5.m5.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p5.m5.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p5.m5.1">x</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p5.m5.2">y</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>,</p>
      <equation xml:id="S3.Ex10">
        <Math mode="display" tex="m({{\langle{\pi{\otimes}{\overline{{\pi}}}(\,\centerdot\,)x{\otimes}{\overline%&#10;{{x}}}},{y{\otimes}{\overline{{y}}}}\rangle}})=m(|{{\langle{\pi(\,\centerdot\,%&#10;)x},{y}\rangle}}|^{2})." text="m * list@(((pi tensor-product overline@(pi)) * centerdot * x) tensor-product overline@(x), y tensor-product overline@(y)) = m * (absolute-value@(list@(pi * centerdot * x, y))) ^ 2" xml:id="S3.Ex10.m1">

            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S3.p6">
      <p>The ergodic theorem applied to the representation <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi{\otimes}{\overline{{\pi}}}" text="pi tensor-product overline@(pi)" xml:id="S3.p6.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and
to the
vectors <Math mode="inline" tex="x{\otimes}{\overline{{x}}}" text="x tensor-product overline@(x)" xml:id="S3.p6.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="y{\otimes}{\overline{{y}}}" text="y tensor-product overline@(y)" xml:id="S3.p6.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> thus yields that</p>
      <equation labels="LABEL:Eq3" xml:id="S3.E5">
        <tags>
          <tag>(5)</tag>
          <tag role="autoref">Equation 5</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">5</tag>
        </tags>
        <Math mode="display" tex="m\bigl{(}|{{\langle{\pi(\,\centerdot\,)x},{y}\rangle}}|^{2}\bigr{)}={{\langle{%&#10;P_{\pi{\otimes}{\overline{{\pi}}}}\,x{\otimes}{\overline{{x}}}},{y{\otimes}{%&#10;\overline{{y}}}}\rangle}}." text="m * (absolute-value@(list@(pi * centerdot * x, y))) ^ 2 = list@((P _ (pi tensor-product overline@(pi)) * x) tensor-product overline@(x), y tensor-product overline@(y))" xml:id="S3.E5.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S3.E5.m1.3"/>

                        </XMApp>

                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.E5.m1.3.2"/>

                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.E5.m1.3.2">
                        <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>

                          <XMApp rpadding="1.7pt">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>

                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>

                          </XMApp>

                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>

                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.E5.m1.3.3">
                        <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>The representation <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi{\otimes}{\overline{{\pi}}}" text="pi tensor-product overline@(pi)" xml:id="S3.p6.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is equivalent to a
representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S3.p6.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> on the space <Math mode="inline" tex="HS(H)" text="H * S * H" xml:id="S3.p6.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S3.p6.m6.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p6.m6.1">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of Hilbert-Schmidt
operators on <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S3.p6.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, which is often more convenient to work with. Recall that
<Math mode="inline" tex="HS(H)" text="H * S * H" xml:id="S3.p6.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S3.p6.m8.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p6.m8.1">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a Hilbert space when endowed with the scalar product defined
by the formula <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\langle{A},{B}\rangle}}=\textrm{tr}(B^{*}\!A)" text="list@(A, B) = [tr] * B ^ * * A" xml:id="S3.p6.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p6.m9.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p6.m9.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p6.m9.1">A</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p6.m9.2">B</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMText>tr</XMText>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p6.m9.3"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.p6.m9.3">
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp rpadding="-1.7pt">
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> for every <Math mode="inline" tex="A,B\in HS(H)" text="list@(A, B) element-of H * S * H" xml:id="S3.p6.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p6.m10.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p6.m10.3"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p6.m10.2">A</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p6.m10.3">B</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p6.m10.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p6.m10.1">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. The space <Math mode="inline" tex="H{\otimes}{\overline{{H}}}" text="H tensor-product overline@(H)" xml:id="S3.p6.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMApp>

              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is identified to <Math mode="inline" tex="HS(H)" text="H * S * H" xml:id="S3.p6.m12">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S3.p6.m12.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> by
associating to each elementary tensor product <Math mode="inline" tex="x{\otimes}{\overline{{y}}}" text="x tensor-product overline@(y)" xml:id="S3.p6.m13">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>

              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of
<Math mode="inline" tex="H{\otimes}{\overline{{H}}}" text="H tensor-product overline@(H)" xml:id="S3.p6.m14">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>

                <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> the rank-one operator <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\langle{\,\centerdot\,},{y}\rangle}}\,{x}" text="list@(centerdot, y) * x" xml:id="S3.p6.m15">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMDual>

                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>

                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
            </XMApp>

        </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S3.p6.m16">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
This map <Math mode="inline" tex="\smash{{{\Theta}:\xymatrix{{H{\otimes}{\overline{{H}}}}\ar[r]&amp;{HS(H)}}}}" text="Theta colon (([\xymatrix] * H) tensor-product overline@(H)) * [\ar] * delimited-[]@(r) * &amp; * H * S * H" xml:id="S3.p6.m17">

                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> extends into a unitary

      <equation xml:id="S3.Ex11">
        <Math mode="display" tex="\Theta\,\pi{\otimes}{\overline{{\pi}}}(g)\,\Theta^{-1}(T)=\pi(g)\,T\,\pi(g^{-1%&#10;})." text="((Theta * pi) tensor-product overline@(pi)) * g * Theta ^ (- 1) * T = pi * g * T * pi * g ^ (- 1)" xml:id="S3.Ex11.m1">

      <p>We will, when needed, identify <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi{\otimes}{\overline{{\pi}}}" text="pi tensor-product overline@(pi)" xml:id="S3.p6.m20">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>

          </XMath>
        </Math> with this equivalent
representation, and use it in particular in Section <ref labelref="LABEL:Section_4"/> to obtain a
concrete description of the space <Math mode="inline" tex="E_{\pi{\otimes}{\overline{{\pi}}}}" text="E _ (pi tensor-product overline@(pi))" xml:id="S3.p6.m21">

              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>

                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>

        </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S3.p6.m22">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-invariant
vectors for <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi{\otimes}{\overline{{\pi}}}" text="pi tensor-product overline@(pi)" xml:id="S3.p6.m23">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>

            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, which is identified to the subspace of
<Math mode="inline" tex="HS(H)" text="H * S * H" xml:id="S3.p6.m24">

        </Math></p>
      <equation xml:id="S3.Ex12">
        <Math mode="display" tex="{\textbf{{E}}}_{\pi}=\{T\in HS(H)\,;\,\pi(g)\,T=T\,\pi(g)\ \textrm{for every}%&#10;\ g\in G\}\cdot" xml:id="S3.Ex12.m1">

        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>Seeing <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi{\otimes}{\overline{{\pi}}}" text="pi tensor-product overline@(pi)" xml:id="S3.p6.m25">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> as a representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S3.p6.m26">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="HS(H)" text="H * S * H" xml:id="S3.p6.m27">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S3.p6.m27.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p6.m27.1">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> also
allows one to prove that <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi{\otimes}{\overline{{\pi}}}" text="pi tensor-product overline@(pi)" xml:id="S3.p6.m28">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> has a non-zero <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S3.p6.m29">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-invariant
vector if and only if <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S3.p6.m30">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> admits a finite dimensional
subrepresentation. We summarize this in the following proposition:</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_proposition" inlist="thm theorem:proposition" labels="LABEL:Proposition_4.1" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem1">
      <tags>
        <tag>Proposition 3.1</tag>
        <tag role="autoref">3.1</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">3.1</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Proposition 3.1</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Proposition 3.1</text></tag></title>
      <para xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem1.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem1.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> be a unitary representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem1.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> on a Hilbert space <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem1.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.
The following assertions are equivalent:</text></p>
        <enumerate xml:id="S3.I1">
          <item xml:id="S3.I1.ix3">
            <tags>
              <tag>(1)</tag>
              <tag role="autoref"><text font="italic">item </text></tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">item (1)</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S3.I1.ix3.p1">
              <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S3.I1.ix3.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> is weakly mixing;</text></p>
            </para>
          </item>
          <item xml:id="S3.I1.ix4">
            <tags>
              <tag>(2)</tag>
              <tag role="autoref"><text font="italic">item </text></tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">item (2)</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S3.I1.ix4.p1">
              <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S3.I1.ix4.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> admits no finite dimensional subrepresentation;</text></p>
            </para>
          </item>
          <item xml:id="S3.I1.ix5">
            <tags>
              <tag>(3)</tag>
              <tag role="autoref"><text font="italic">item </text></tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">item (3)</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S3.I1.ix5.p1">
              <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\pi{\otimes}{\overline{{\pi}}}" text="pi tensor-product overline@(pi)" xml:id="S3.I1.ix5.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> has no non-zero </text><Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S3.I1.ix5.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic">-invariant vector.
</text><!--  %**** String Line 625 **** --></p>
            </para>
          </item>
        </enumerate>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <para xml:id="S3.p7">
      <p>A companion to the property of weak mixing for unitary representation is
that of compactness: given a unitary
representation <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S3.p7.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S3.p7.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S3.p7.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> a vector <Math mode="inline" tex="x\in H" text="x element-of H" xml:id="S3.p7.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">compact</text> for <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S3.p7.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> if the norm closure of the set <Math mode="inline" tex="\{\pi(g)x\,;\,g\in G\}" text="set@(list@(pi * g * x, g) element-of G)" xml:id="S3.p7.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                <XMRef idref="S3.p7.m6.3"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                <XMApp xml:id="S3.p7.m6.3">
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.p7.m6.3.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.p7.m6.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.p7.m6.3.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S3.p7.m6.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p7.m6.1">g</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" rpadding="1.7pt">x</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="1.7pt">;</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p7.m6.2">g</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is compact in <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S3.p7.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. The representation <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S3.p7.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> itself
is said to be <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">compact</text> if every vector of <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S3.p7.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is compact for <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S3.p7.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. Compact representations decompose as direct sums of irreducible
finite dimensional representations. A representation <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S3.p7.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is weakly
mixing if and only if the only compact vector for <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S3.p7.m12">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is the zero
vector. The general structural result for unitary representations is given
by Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_4.2"/>. It extends a well-known result
of Jacobs, de Leeuw and Glicksberg (see for instance <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Farkas" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> for an account of this result) which associates to any contraction <Math mode="inline" tex="T" text="T" xml:id="S3.p7.m13">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> on a Hilbert space <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S3.p7.m14">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> a decomposition of <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S3.p7.m15">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> into two <Math mode="inline" tex="T" text="T" xml:id="S3.p7.m16">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>- and <Math mode="inline" tex="T^{*}" text="T ^ *" xml:id="S3.p7.m17">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-invariant subspaces of <Math mode="inline" tex="T" text="T" xml:id="S3.p7.m18">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. This two spaces correspond respectively to the weakly mixing and compact parts in the statement below.</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_proposition" inlist="thm theorem:proposition" labels="LABEL:Proposition_4.2" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem2">
      <tags>
        <tag>Proposition 3.2</tag>
        <tag role="autoref">3.2</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">3.2</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Proposition 3.2</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Proposition 3.2</text></tag></title>
      <para xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">A unitary representation <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> on a Hilbert space <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
decomposes as a direct sum of a weakly mixing representation and a compact
representation:</text></p>
        <equation xml:id="S3.Ex13">
          <Math mode="display" tex="\smash[b]{H=H_{w}{\mathop{\oplus}}\limits^{\perp}H_{c}\,,}" text="H = H _ w * (direct-sum ^ perpendicular-to)@(H _ c)" xml:id="S3.Ex13.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S3.Ex13.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S3.Ex13.m1.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid3"/>
                          <XMTok meaning="direct-sum" name="oplus" role="BIGOP" scriptpos="mid">⊕</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="perpendicular-to" name="perp" role="RELOP">⟂</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp rpadding="1.7pt">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p><text font="italic">where
<Math mode="inline" tex="H_{w}" text="H _ w" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{c}" text="H _ c" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> are both <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-invariant closed subspaces of <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>,
<!--  %**** String Line 650 **** --><Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{w}=\pi|_{H_{w}}" text="pi _ w = evaluated-at@(pi, H _ w)" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m8">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="evaluated-at"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m8.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m8.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok name="pi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m8.1">π</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m8.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is weakly mixing and <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{c}=\pi|_{H_{c}}" text="pi _ c = evaluated-at@(pi, H _ c)" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m9">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="evaluated-at"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m9.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m9.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok name="pi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m9.1">π</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m9.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is compact. Hence <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m10">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> decomposes as a direct sum of a
weakly mixing representation and finite dimensional
irreducible subrepresentations.</text></p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <para xml:id="S3.p8">
      <p>See <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Pet" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Ch. 1]</cite>, <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BdHV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Appendix M]</cite>, <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BR" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> or <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Dye" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>
(in the amenable case) for detailed proofs of these results.</p>
    </para>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:Section_4" xml:id="S4">
    <tags>
      <tag>4</tag>
      <tag role="autoref">section 4</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">4</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">§4</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=" ">4</tag>An abstract version of the Wiener Theorem</title>
    <subsection inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:Section_4.1" xml:id="S4.SS1">
      <tags>
        <tag>4.1</tag>
        <tag role="autoref">subsection 4.1</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">4.1</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§4.1</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=" ">4.1</tag>Notation</title>
      <para xml:id="S4.SS1.p1">
        <p>Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S4.SS1.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be a compact representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S4.SS1.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on a Hilbert
space <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S4.SS1.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. We have seen in Section <ref labelref="LABEL:Section_3"/> that <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S4.SS1.p1.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> can be
decomposed as a direct sum of irreducible finite dimensional
representations of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S4.SS1.p1.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. We sort out these representations by equivalence
classes, and index the distinct equivalence classes by an index <Math mode="inline" tex="j" text="j" xml:id="S4.SS1.p1.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
belonging to a set <Math mode="inline" tex="J" text="J" xml:id="S4.SS1.p1.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">J</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, which may be finite or infinite (and which is
countable if <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S4.SS1.p1.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is separable). For every <Math mode="inline" tex="{j\,\in J}" text="j element-of J" xml:id="S4.SS1.p1.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" rpadding="1.7pt">j</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">J</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, we index
by <Math mode="inline" tex="{i\,\in I_{j}}" text="i element-of I _ j" xml:id="S4.SS1.p1.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" rpadding="1.7pt">i</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> all the
representations appearing in the decomposition of <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S4.SS1.p1.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> which are in the
<Math mode="inline" tex="j" text="j" xml:id="S4.SS1.p1.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-th equivalence class. More precisely, we can decompose <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S4.SS1.p1.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S4.SS1.p1.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> as</p>
        <equation xml:id="S4.Ex14">
          <Math mode="display" tex="H={\mathop{\oplus}}\limits_{j\,\in J}\bigl{(}{\mathop{\oplus}}\limits_{\iijH}{%&#10;{}_{i,\,j}}\bigr{)}\quad\textrm{and}\quad\pi={\mathop{\oplus}}\limits_{j\,\in J%&#10;}\bigl{(}{\mathop{\oplus}}\limits_{i\,\in I_{j}}\pi{{}_{i,\,j}}\bigr{)}" xml:id="S4.Ex14.m1">

            <para xml:id="S4.I1.ix8.p1">
              <p>if <Math mode="inline" tex="j" text="j" xml:id="S4.I1.ix8.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="j^{\prime}" text="j ^ prime" xml:id="S4.I1.ix8.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> belong to <Math mode="inline" tex="J" text="J" xml:id="S4.I1.ix8.p1.m3">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">J</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="j\neq j^{\prime}" text="j not-equals j ^ prime" xml:id="S4.I1.ix8.p1.m4">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{j}" text="pi _ j" xml:id="S4.I1.ix8.p1.m5">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> and
<Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{j^{\prime}}" text="pi _ (j ^ prime)" xml:id="S4.I1.ix8.p1.m6">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="50%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> are not equivalent.</p>
            </para>
          </item>
        </enumerate>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S4.SS1.p2">

                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.SS1.p4.m6.1">v</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT" rpadding="1.7pt">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.SS1.p4.m6.2">l</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> into <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{u,\,k}" text="H _ (list@(u, k))" xml:id="S4.SS1.p4.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p4.m7.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p4.m7.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.SS1.p4.m7.1">u</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT" rpadding="1.7pt">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.SS1.p4.m7.2">k</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> defined by
<Math mode="inline" tex="A_{{u,\,v}}=P_{u,\,k}\,A|_{H_{v,\,l}}" text="A _ (list@(u, v)) = evaluated-at@(P _ (list@(u, k)) * A, H _ (list@(v, l)))" xml:id="S4.SS1.p4.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p4.m8.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p4.m8.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.SS1.p4.m8.1">u</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT" rpadding="1.7pt">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.SS1.p4.m8.2">v</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>

                    <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p4.m8.8"/>

                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p4.m8.8">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp rpadding="1.7pt">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p4.m8.3"/>

                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
