        <p>It is not difficult to see that if the finite set <Math mode="inline" tex="F" text="F" xml:id="S5.SS3.p4.m30">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is sufficiently large,</p>
        <equation xml:id="S5.Ex66">
          <Math mode="display" tex="(\varepsilon^{\prime\,2}-\delta)\sum_{i\,\in\,I\setminus F}||x_{i}||^{2}&lt;%&#10;\delta\sum_{i\,\in\,F}||x_{i}||^{2}." text="(varepsilon ^ (list@(prime1, 2)) - delta) * (sum _ (i element-of I set-minus F))@((norm@(x _ i)) ^ 2) less delta * (sum _ (i element-of F))@((norm@(x _ i)) ^ 2)" xml:id="S5.Ex66.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S5.Ex66.m1.3"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex66.m1.3">

                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S5.Ex66.m1.3.1"/>

                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                            <XMApp>

                              </XMDual>

                            <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>

                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMApp scriptpos="mid">

                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>

            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>We then have</p>
        <equation xml:id="S5.Ex67">
          <Math mode="display" tex="\sup_{g\,\in\,{Q}}\Bigl{(}{\displaystyle}\sum_{i\,\in\,F}\,||\pi(g)x_{i}-x_{i}%&#10;||^{2}\Bigr{)}^{1/2}&lt;{\varepsilon^{\prime}}\,\Bigl{(}{\displaystyle}\sum_{i\,%&#10;\in\,F}||x_{i}||^{2}\Bigr{)}^{1/2}." text="(supremum _ (g element-of Q))@(((sum _ (i element-of F))@((norm@(pi * g * x _ i - x _ i)) ^ 2)) ^ (1 / 2)) less varepsilon ^ prime * ((sum _ (i element-of F))@((norm@(x _ i)) ^ 2)) ^ (1 / 2)" xml:id="S5.Ex67.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S5.Ex67.m1.2"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex67.m1.2">
                    <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                        <XMTok meaning="supremum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="mid">sup</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP" rpadding="1.7pt">∈</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" rpadding="1.7pt">g</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.Ex67.m1.2.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok fontsize="160%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex67.m1.2.1">
                              <XMApp rpadding="1.7pt" scriptpos="mid">
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                                <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">∑</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP" rpadding="1.7pt">∈</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" rpadding="1.7pt">i</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                                    <XMRef idref="S5.Ex67.m1.2.1.1"/>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok role="OPEN">||</XMTok>
                                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex67.m1.2.1.1">
                                      <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                                      <XMApp>
                                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                        <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                                        <XMDual>
                                          <XMRef idref="S5.Ex67.m1.1"/>
                                          <XMWrap>
                                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.Ex67.m1.1">g</XMTok>
                                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                          </XMWrap>
                                        </XMDual>
                                        <XMApp>
                                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                                        </XMApp>
                                      </XMApp>
                                      <XMApp>
                                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                                      </XMApp>
                                    </XMApp>
                                    <XMTok role="CLOSE">||</XMTok>
                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok fontsize="160%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp rpadding="1.7pt">
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.Ex67.m1.2.2"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok fontsize="160%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex67.m1.2.2">
                              <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                                <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">∑</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP" rpadding="1.7pt">∈</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" rpadding="1.7pt">i</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                                    <XMRef idref="S5.Ex67.m1.2.2.1"/>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok role="OPEN">||</XMTok>
                                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex67.m1.2.2.1">
                                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                                    </XMApp>
                                    <XMTok role="CLOSE">||</XMTok>
                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok fontsize="160%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>By property (<Math mode="inline" tex="\gamma" text="gamma" xml:id="S5.SS3.p4.m31">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="gamma" role="UNKNOWN">γ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>), <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi=\mathbbm{1}_{G}" text="pi = 1 _ G" xml:id="S5.SS3.p4.m32">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. This finishes the proof of Fact <ref labelref="LABEL:Fact_6.1.2"/>.

<!--  %**** String Line 1400 **** --></p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S5.SS3.p5">
        <p>Let us now go back to the different cases in the proof of Theorem
<ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/>.</p>
      </para>
    </subsection>
    <subsection inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:Section_6.5" xml:id="S5.SS4">
      <tags>
        <tag>5.4</tag>
        <tag role="autoref">subsection 5.4</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">5.4</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§5.4</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=" ">5.4</tag>Case 1</title>
      <para xml:id="S5.SS4.p1">
        <p>Suppose that there exists an integer <Math mode="inline" tex="n_{0}" text="n _ 0" xml:id="S5.SS4.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}_{n_{0}}" text="Q _ n _ 0" xml:id="S5.SS4.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is
a Kazhdan set for ampliations of finite dimensional irreducible
representations, with associated
constant <Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon^{\prime}_{0}" text="(varepsilon ^ prime) _ 0" xml:id="S5.SS4.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
Then, since <Math mode="inline" tex="({Q_{n}})_{n\geq 1}" text="Q _ n _ (n &gt;= 1)" xml:id="S5.SS4.p1.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.SS4.p1.m4.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS4.p1.m4.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is an increasing sequence of sets, <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q_{n}}" text="Q _ n" xml:id="S5.SS4.p1.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is for
every <Math mode="inline" tex="n\geq n_{0}" text="n &gt;= n _ 0" xml:id="S5.SS4.p1.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> a Kazhdan set for ampliations of finite dimensional
irreducible representations with a common associated constant <Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon^{\prime}_{0}" text="(varepsilon ^ prime) _ 0" xml:id="S5.SS4.p1.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S5.SS4.p2">
        <p>Let now <Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon&gt;0" text="varepsilon &gt; 0" xml:id="S5.SS4.p2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be an arbitrary positive number. We fix a
sequence <Math mode="inline" tex="({\varepsilon_{n}})_{n\geq 1}" text="varepsilon _ n _ (n &gt;= 1)" xml:id="S5.SS4.p2.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.SS4.p2.m2.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS4.p2.m2.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of positive numbers decreasing to zero so fast that
the following properties hold:</p>
        <enumerate xml:id="S5.I3">
          <item xml:id="S5.I3.ix13">
            <tags>
              <tag>(i)</tag>
              <tag role="autoref">item </tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">item (i)</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S5.I3.ix13.p1">
              <p><Math mode="inline" tex="0&lt;{\varepsilon_{n}}&lt;\varepsilon_{0}" text="0 less varepsilon _ n less varepsilon _ 0" xml:id="S5.I3.ix13.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                      <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> for every <Math mode="inline" tex="{n\geq 1}" text="n &gt;= 1" xml:id="S5.I3.ix13.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>, and
<Math mode="inline" tex="\sum_{n\geq 1}{\varepsilon_{n}}&lt;\varepsilon^{2}/2" text="(sum _ (n &gt;= 1))@(varepsilon _ n) less varepsilon ^ 2 / 2" xml:id="S5.I3.ix13.p1.m3">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∑</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>;</p>
            </para>
          </item>
          <item xml:id="S5.I3.ix14">
            <tags>
              <tag>(ii)</tag>
              <tag role="autoref">item </tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">item (ii)</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S5.I3.ix14.p1">
              <p>for every <Math mode="inline" tex="n\geq n_{0}" text="n &gt;= n _ 0" xml:id="S5.I3.ix14.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="{\varepsilon_{n}}&lt;2^{-n}\varepsilon^{\prime}_{0}" text="varepsilon _ n less 2 ^ (- n) * (varepsilon ^ prime) _ 0" xml:id="S5.I3.ix14.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>.</p>
            </para>
          </item>
        </enumerate>
        <p>This sequence <Math mode="inline" tex="(\varepsilon_{n})_{n\geq 1}" text="varepsilon _ n _ (n &gt;= 1)" xml:id="S5.SS4.p2.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.SS4.p2.m3.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS4.p2.m3.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> being fixed, we consider the representation
<Math mode="inline" tex="\boldsymbol{\pi}={\otimes}_{n\geq 1}\,\pi_{n}" xml:id="S5.SS4.p2.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="bold italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp rpadding="1.7pt">
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S5.SS4.p2.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on the infinite tensor product space
<Math mode="inline" tex="\boldsymbol{H}={\bigotimes_{n\geq 1}^{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{a}}{H_{n}}}" text="H = ((tensor-product _ (n &gt;= 1)) ^ a)@(H _ n)" xml:id="S5.SS4.p2.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="tensor-product" name="bigotimes" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⊗</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="bold italic" fontsize="70%" lpadding="0.8pt" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>,
where the spaces <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{n}" text="H _ n" xml:id="S5.SS4.p2.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, the
<!--  %**** String Line 1425 **** -->representations <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{n}" text="pi _ n" xml:id="S5.SS4.p2.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and the vectors <Math mode="inline" tex="{a_{n}}" text="a _ n" xml:id="S5.SS4.p2.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> are associated to
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\varepsilon_{n}}" text="varepsilon _ n" xml:id="S5.SS4.p2.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for each <Math mode="inline" tex="{n\geq 1}" text="n &gt;= 1" xml:id="S5.SS4.p2.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> by Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:Lemma_6.1"/>. Our aim is to prove the
following:</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_proposition" inlist="thm theorem:proposition" labels="LABEL:Proposition_6.2" xml:id="S5.Thmtheorem4">
        <tags>
          <tag>Proposition 5.4</tag>
          <tag role="autoref">5.4</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">5.4</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Proposition 5.4</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Proposition 5.4</text></tag></title>
        <para xml:id="S5.Thmtheorem4.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">Under the assumptions above, <Math mode="inline" tex="\boldsymbol{\pi}" text="pi" xml:id="S5.Thmtheorem4.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="bold" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is well-defined and enjoys the following properties:</text></p>
          <enumerate xml:id="S5.I4">
            <item xml:id="S5.I4.ix15">
              <tags>
                <tag>(a)</tag>

                <tag role="typerefnum">item (a)</tag>
              </tags>
              <para xml:id="S5.I4.ix15.p1">
                <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\boldsymbol{\pi}" text="pi" xml:id="S5.I4.ix15.p1.m1">

                    </XMath>

of

                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic">
on </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\boldsymbol{H}={\bigotimes_{n\geq 1}^{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{a}}{H_{n}}}" text="H = ((tensor-product _ (n &gt;= 1)) ^ a)@(H _ n)" xml:id="S5.I4.ix15.p1.m3">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMApp>

                            <XMApp>

                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>

                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>

                  </Math><text font="italic">-invariant
vector;</text></p>
              </para>
            </item>
            <item xml:id="S5.I4.ix17">
              <tags>

                  </Math><text font="italic"> is weakly mixing.</text></p>
              </para>

          </enumerate>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <para xml:id="S5.SS4.p3">
        <p>Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_6.2"/>
proves the existence, for every <Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon&gt;0" text="varepsilon &gt; 0" xml:id="S5.SS4.p3.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, of a representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S5.SS4.p3.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> with a <Math mode="inline" tex="({Q},\varepsilon)" text="open-interval@(Q, varepsilon)" xml:id="S5.SS4.p3.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.SS4.p3.m3.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.SS4.p3.m3.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS4.p3.m3.1">Q</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS4.p3.m3.2">ε</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-invariant vector but no finite dimensional subrepresentation. This
clearly violates assumption (<ref labelref="LABEL:Pro1"/>)
of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/>. It thus suffices to prove Proposition
<ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_6.2"/> to conclude the proof of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/>
under the additional assumption of Case 1.
<ERROR class="undefined">{proof}</ERROR>[Proof of Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_6.2"/>] We will prove
successively properties (a) to (c), the hardest one being property (c).
<!--  %**** String Line 1450 **** --></p>
      </para>
      <para class="ltx_noindent" xml:id="S5.SS4.p4">
        <p><text font="sansserif">Proof of property</text> (a).
In order to prove that <Math mode="inline" tex="\boldsymbol{\pi}" text="pi" xml:id="S5.SS4.p4.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="bold italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is well-defined and strongly continuous, it suffices
to
check that the assumptions of Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_3.2"/> in the appendix hold true.
For every <Math mode="inline" tex="g\in G" text="g element-of G" xml:id="S5.SS4.p4.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>

            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, we have
<Math mode="inline" tex="|1-{{\langle{\pi_{n}(g){a_{n}}},{a_{n}}\rangle}}|\leq||\pi_{n}(g){a_{n}}-{a_{n%&#10;}}||" text="absolute-value@(1 - list@(pi _ n * g * a _ n, a _ n)) less= norm@(pi _ n * g * a _ n - a _ n)" xml:id="S5.SS4.p4.m4">

              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> so that</p>

        <p>By assumption (i), the series <Math mode="inline" tex="\sum_{n\geq 1}{\varepsilon_{n}}" text="(sum _ (n &gt;= 1))@(varepsilon _ n)" xml:id="S5.SS4.p4.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∑</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is convergent. Since every
element <Math mode="inline" tex="g\in G" text="g element-of G" xml:id="S5.SS4.p4.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> belongs to all the sets <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q_{n}}" text="Q _ n" xml:id="S5.SS4.p4.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> except finitely many, the
series <Math mode="inline" tex="\sum_{n\geq 1}|1-{{\langle{\pi_{n}(g){a_{n}}},{a_{n}}\rangle}}|" text="(sum _ (n &gt;= 1))@(absolute-value@(1 - list@(pi _ n * g * a _ n, a _ n)))" xml:id="S5.SS4.p4.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∑</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS4.p4.m8.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS4.p4.m8.2">
                      <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.SS4.p4.m8.2.1"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.SS4.p4.m8.2.2"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS4.p4.m8.2.1">
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S5.SS4.p4.m8.1"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS4.p4.m8.1">g</XMTok>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post6"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS4.p4.m8.2.2">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is convergent for every
<Math mode="inline" tex="g\in G" text="g element-of G" xml:id="S5.SS4.p4.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Moreover, it is uniformly convergent on <Math mode="inline" tex="Q_{1}" text="Q _ 1" xml:id="S5.SS4.p4.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, and hence on
<Math mode="inline" tex="W_{1}" text="W _ 1" xml:id="S5.SS4.p4.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. The function</p>
        <equation xml:id="S5.Ex69">
          <Math mode="display" tex="\smash{\xymatrix{g\ar@{|-&gt;}[r]&amp;{\displaystyle}\sum_{n\geq 1}|1-{{\langle{\pi_{%&#10;n}(g){a_{n}}},{a_{n}}\rangle}}|}}" text="[\xymatrix] * g * [\ar] * @ * ket@(-) * delimited-[]@(r) * &amp; * (sum _ (n &gt;= 1))@(absolute-value@(1 - list@(pi _ n * g * a _ n, a _ n)))" xml:id="S5.Ex69.m1">

        </equation>
      </para>
      <para class="ltx_noindent" xml:id="S5.SS4.p5">
        <p>is thus continuous on <Math mode="inline" tex="W_{1}" text="W _ 1" xml:id="S5.SS4.p5.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, which is a neighborhood of <Math mode="inline" tex="e" text="e" xml:id="S5.SS4.p5.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. It follows
then from Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_3.2"/> that <Math mode="inline" tex="\boldsymbol{\pi}" text="pi" xml:id="S5.SS4.p5.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="bold italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is strongly
continuous on <Math mode="inline" tex="\boldsymbol{H}" text="H" xml:id="S5.SS4.p5.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. If <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S5.SS4.p5.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is locally compact,
Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_3.2.0"/> and the first part of the argument
above suffice to show that <Math mode="inline" tex="\boldsymbol{\pi}" text="pi" xml:id="S5.SS4.p5.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="bold italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is strongly continuous, even when
<Math mode="inline" tex="W_{1}" text="W _ 1" xml:id="S5.SS4.p5.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is not a neighborhood of <Math mode="inline" tex="e" text="e" xml:id="S5.SS4.p5.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
<!--  %**** String Line 1475 **** -->      <para class="ltx_noindent" xml:id="S5.SS4.p6">
        <p><text font="sansserif">Proof of property</text> (b).

                      <XMTok role="CLOSE">||</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>

                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>

              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, and for every <Math mode="inline" tex="g\in{Q}" text="g element-of Q" xml:id="S5.SS4.p6.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
we have (using the fact that <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}\subseteq{Q_{n}}" text="Q subset-of-or-equals Q _ n" xml:id="S5.SS4.p6.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="subset-of-or-equals" name="subseteq" role="RELOP">⊆</XMTok>

                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for every <Math mode="inline" tex="{n\geq 1}" text="n &gt;= 1" xml:id="S5.SS4.p6.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>)</p>
        <equationgroup class="ltx_eqn_align" xml:id="A1.EGx8">
          <equation xml:id="S5.Ex70">
            <MathFork>
              <Math tex="\displaystyle||\boldsymbol{\pi}(g){\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{a}}-{\mskip 1.5mu %&#10;\boldsymbol{a}}||^{2}=2\,(1-\Re e{{\langle{\boldsymbol{\pi}(g){\mskip 1.5mu %&#10;\boldsymbol{a}}},{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{a}}\rangle}})\leq 2\,\Bigl{|}1-%&#10;\prod_{n\geq 1}{{\langle{\pi_{n}(g){a_{n}}},{a_{n}}\rangle}}\Bigr{|}" text="(norm@(pi * g * a - a)) ^ 2 = 2 * (1 - real-part@(e) * list@(pi * g * a, a)) less= 2 * absolute-value@(1 - (product _ (n &gt;= 1))@(list@(pi _ n * g * a _ n, a _ n)))" xml:id="S5.Ex70.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post8"/>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.Ex70.m3.5"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN">||</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex70.m3.5">
                            <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP" rpadding="0.8pt">-</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="bold italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                              <XMDual>
                                <XMRef idref="S5.Ex70.m3.1"/>
                                <XMWrap>

                                            <XMDual>
                                              <XMRef idref="S5.Ex71.m2.1"/>
                                              <XMWrap>
                                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                              </XMWrap>
                                            </XMDual>
                                            <XMApp>
                                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post12"/>
                                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                                            </XMApp>
                                          </XMApp>
                                          <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                                          <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex71.m2.2.1.2">
                                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post11"/>
                                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                                          </XMApp>

                                        </XMWrap>
                                      </XMDual>
                                    </XMApp>
                                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid8"/>

                                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post9"/>

                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math></td>
              </MathBranch>
            </MathFork>
          </equation>
        </equationgroup>
        <p>Assumption (i) on the sequence <Math mode="inline" tex="({\varepsilon_{n}})_{n\geq 1}" text="varepsilon _ n _ (n &gt;= 1)" xml:id="S5.SS4.p6.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.SS4.p6.m9.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> implies that
<Math mode="inline" tex="\sup_{g\,\in\,{Q}}||\boldsymbol{\pi}(g){\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{a}}-{\mskip 1%&#10;.5mu \boldsymbol{a}}||^{2}&lt;\varepsilon^{2}" text="(supremum _ (g element-of Q))@((norm@(pi * g * a - a)) ^ 2) less varepsilon ^ 2" xml:id="S5.SS4.p6.m10">

                              <XMWrap>

                              </XMWrap>

                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>,
and <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{a}}" text="a" xml:id="S5.SS4.p6.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="bold italic" lpadding="0.8pt" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is thus a <Math mode="inline" tex="({Q},\varepsilon)" text="open-interval@(Q, varepsilon)" xml:id="S5.SS4.p6.m12">
            <XMath>

                <XMApp>

                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS4.p6.m12.2">ε</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-invariant vector for <Math mode="inline" tex="\boldsymbol{\pi}" text="pi" xml:id="S5.SS4.p6.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="bold italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S5.SS4.p7">
        <p><text font="sansserif">Proof of property</text> (c).
It remains to show that <Math mode="inline" tex="\boldsymbol{\pi}" text="pi" xml:id="S5.SS4.p7.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="bold italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is weakly mixing. By Proposition
<ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_4.3"/>, it suffices to prove that
<Math mode="inline" tex="\underline{\lim}_{\,\,n\to+\infty\,}m(\,|{{\langle{\pi_{n}(\,\centerdot\,){a_{%&#10;n}}},{a_{n}}\rangle}}|^{2})=0" text="(underline@(limit)) _ (n to + infinity) * m * (absolute-value@(list@(pi _ n * centerdot * a _ n, a _ n))) ^ 2 = 0" xml:id="S5.SS4.p7.m2">

              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>

                    <XMApp>

<ref labelref="LABEL:Section_3"/> the invariant mean on
WAP<Math mode="inline" tex="(G)" text="G" xml:id="S5.SS4.p7.m4">

                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>

                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                                  <XMDual>
                                    <XMApp>
                                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                                      <XMRef idref="S5.Ex72.m1.6"/>
                                      <XMRef idref="S5.Ex72.m1.7"/>
                                    </XMApp>
                                    <XMWrap>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.Ex72.m1.6">j</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok fontsize="50%" role="PUNCT" rpadding="1.7pt">,</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.Ex72.m1.7">n</XMTok>
                                    </XMWrap>
                                  </XMDual>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                              <XMDual>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                                  <XMRef idref="S5.Ex72.m1.8"/>
                                  <XMRef idref="S5.Ex72.m1.9"/>
                                  <XMRef idref="S5.Ex72.m1.10"/>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMWrap>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.Ex72.m1.8">i</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT" rpadding="1.7pt">,</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.Ex72.m1.9">j</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT" rpadding="1.7pt">,</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.Ex72.m1.10">n</XMTok>
                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="160%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>respectively. Since <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{n}" text="H _ n" xml:id="S5.SS4.p7.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is finite dimensional, all the sets <Math mode="inline" tex="J_{n}" text="J _ n" xml:id="S5.SS4.p7.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">J</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
and <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{j,\,n}" text="I _ (list@(j, n))" xml:id="S5.SS4.p7.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS4.p7.m10.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS4.p7.m10.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS4.p7.m10.1">j</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT" rpadding="1.7pt">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS4.p7.m10.2">n</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>,
<Math mode="inline" tex="j\in J_{n}" text="j element-of J _ n" xml:id="S5.SS4.p7.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">J</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, are finite. For every <Math mode="inline" tex="j\in J_{n}" text="j element-of J _ n" xml:id="S5.SS4.p7.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">J</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{i,\,j,\,n}=K_{j,\,n}" text="H _ (list@(i, j, n)) = K _ (list@(j, n))" xml:id="S5.SS4.p7.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS4.p7.m13.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS4.p7.m13.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS4.p7.m13.3"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS4.p7.m13.1">i</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT" rpadding="1.7pt">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS4.p7.m13.2">j</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT" rpadding="1.7pt">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS4.p7.m13.3">n</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS4.p7.m13.4"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS4.p7.m13.5"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS4.p7.m13.4">j</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT" rpadding="1.7pt">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS4.p7.m13.5">n</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>,
which is of dimension <Math mode="inline" tex="d_{j,\,n}" text="d _ (list@(j, n))" xml:id="S5.SS4.p7.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS4.p7.m14.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS4.p7.m14.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS4.p7.m14.1">j</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT" rpadding="1.7pt">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS4.p7.m14.2">n</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. We have, using again the notation of
Section <ref labelref="LABEL:Section_4.1"/>,</p>
        <equation xml:id="S5.Ex73">
          <Math mode="display" tex="\pi_{i,\,j,\,n}=U^{*}_{i,\,j,\,n}\,\pi_{j,\,n}\,U_{i,\,j,\,n},\quad j\in J_{n}%&#10;,\ i\in I_{j,\,n}." text="formulae@(pi _ (list@(i, j, n)) = (U ^ *) _ (list@(i, j, n)) * pi _ (list@(j, n)) * U _ (list@(i, j, n)), formulae@(j element-of J _ n, i element-of I _ (list@(j, n))))" xml:id="S5.Ex73.m1">
