                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN">||</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p2.m10.2">
                          <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>

                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Let
now <Math mode="inline" tex="\boldsymbol{\rho}={\otimes}_{n\geq 1}\rho_{n}" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p2.m11">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="bold italic" name="rho" role="UNKNOWN">ρ</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>

                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> be the infinite tensor product of the representations <Math mode="inline" tex="\rho_{n}" text="rho _ n" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p2.m12">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="rho" role="UNKNOWN">ρ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> on the space
<Math mode="inline" tex="\boldsymbol{\mathscr{H}}=\bigotimes_{n\geq 1}^{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{a}}{%&#10;\mathscr{H}}_{n}" text="H = ((tensor-product _ (n &gt;= 1)) ^ a)@(H _ n)" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p2.m13">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="script bold" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="tensor-product" name="bigotimes" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⊗</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="bold italic" fontsize="70%" lpadding="0.8pt" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Using similar tools
to those employed in the proof of Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_6.2"/>, we
are going to show:</p>
        </para>
        <theorem class="ltx_theorem_proposition" inlist="thm theorem:proposition" labels="LABEL:Proposition_6.3" xml:id="S5.Thmtheorem5">

          <para xml:id="S5.Thmtheorem5.p1">
            <p><text font="italic">Under the assumptions above on the sequence <Math mode="inline" tex="(\varepsilon_{n})_{n\geq 1}" text="varepsilon _ n _ (n &gt;= 1)" xml:id="S5.Thmtheorem5.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>

                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>

                        </XMWrap>

                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>,
<Math mode="inline" tex="\boldsymbol{\rho}" text="rho" xml:id="S5.Thmtheorem5.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>

                  </XMath>

          </para>
        </theorem>
        <ERROR class="undefined">{proof}</ERROR>
        <para xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3">
          <p>[Proof of Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_6.3"/>]
The proofs of properties (a) and (b) are exactly the same as the ones
given in Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_6.2"/>, using the fact that
<Math mode="inline" tex="\sup_{g\,\in\,{Q_{n}}}||\rho_{n}(g){a_{n}}-{a_{n}}||&lt;{\varepsilon_{n}}" text="(supremum _ (g element-of Q _ n))@(norm@(rho _ n * g * a _ n - a _ n)) less varepsilon _ n" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok meaning="supremum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="post">sup</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP" rpadding="1.7pt">∈</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" rpadding="1.7pt">g</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m1.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN">||</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m1.2">
                          <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" name="rho" role="UNKNOWN">ρ</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m1.1"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m1.1">g</XMTok>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE">||</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> for every <Math mode="inline" tex="{n\geq 1}" text="n &gt;= 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. In
order to
prove that <Math mode="inline" tex="\boldsymbol{\rho}" text="rho" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="bold italic" name="rho" role="UNKNOWN">ρ</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is weakly mixing, we will show as in
Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_6.2"/> that
<Math mode="inline" tex="m(|{{\langle{\rho_{n}(\,\centerdot\,){a_{n}}},{a_{n}}\rangle}}|^{2})" text="m * (absolute-value@(list@(rho _ n * centerdot * a _ n, a _ n))) ^ 2" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m4.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m4.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m4.2.1"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                            <XMDual xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m4.2.1">
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                                <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m4.2.1.1"/>
                                <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m4.2.1.2"/>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                                <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m4.2.1.1">
                                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" name="rho" role="UNKNOWN">ρ</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMDual>
                                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m4.1"/>
                                    <XMWrap>
                                      <XMTok role="OPEN" rpadding="1.7pt" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok name="centerdot" role="MULOP" rpadding="1.7pt" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m4.1">∙</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                    </XMWrap>
                                  </XMDual>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post6"/>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                                <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m4.2.1.2">
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>

                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                            <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> tends to zero as <Math mode="inline" tex="n" text="n" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> tends to
infinity.
Recall that for every <Math mode="inline" tex="{n\geq 1}" text="n &gt;= 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, the representations <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{n},\dots,\pi_{2n}" text="list@(pi _ n, dots, pi _ (2 * n))" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m7.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m7.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m7.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m7.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m7.1">…</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m7.3">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> are mutually non-equivalent, so that, with the notation of Section <ref labelref="LABEL:Section_4.1"/>, <Math mode="inline" tex="J_{n}=\{n,\ldots,2n\}" text="J _ n = set@(n, ldots, 2 * n)" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m8">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">J</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m8.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m8.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m8.3"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m8.1">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="ldots" role="ID" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m8.2">…</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m8.3">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{j,n}=I_{n}" text="I _ (list@(j, n)) = I _ n" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m9">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>

                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m9.1">j</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m9.2">n</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> for every <Math mode="inline" tex="j\in J_{n}" text="j element-of J _ n" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m10">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">J</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. By Corollary <ref labelref="LABEL:Corollary_5.7"/>, we
have for every <Math mode="inline" tex="{n\geq 1}" text="n &gt;= 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m11">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math></p>
          <equation xml:id="S5.Ex82">
            <Math mode="display" tex="m(|{{\langle{\rho_{n}(\,\centerdot\,){a_{n}}},{a_{n}}\rangle}}|^{2})\leq\sum_{%&#10;j=n}^{2n}\Bigl{|}\Bigl{|}\dfrac{1}{\sqrt{n+1}}{\widetilde{{a}}}_{j}\Bigr{|}%&#10;\Bigr{|}^{4}\leq\max_{n\leq j\leq 2n}\Bigl{(}\,\dfrac{1}{n+1}||{\widetilde{{a}%&#10;}}_{j}||^{2}\Bigr{)}\sum_{j=n}^{2n}\Bigl{|}\Bigl{|}\dfrac{{\widetilde{{a}}}_{j%&#10;}}{\sqrt{n+1}}\Bigr{|}\Bigr{|}^{2}\leq\dfrac{1}{n+1}\cdot" xml:id="S5.Ex82.m1">
              <XMath>

                    </XMWrap>

                    <XMTok fontsize="160%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok name="cdot" role="MULOP">⋅</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
          </equation>
          <p>So <Math mode="inline" tex="m(|{{\langle{\rho_{n}(\,\centerdot\,){a_{n}}},{a_{n}}\rangle}}|^{2})" text="m * (absolute-value@(list@(rho _ n * centerdot * a _ n, a _ n))) ^ 2" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m12">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m12.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m12.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m12.2.1"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                            <XMDual xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m12.2.1">
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                                <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m12.2.1.1"/>
                                <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m12.2.1.2"/>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                                <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m12.2.1.1">
                                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" name="rho" role="UNKNOWN">ρ</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMDual>
                                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m12.1"/>
                                    <XMWrap>
                                      <XMTok role="OPEN" rpadding="1.7pt" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok name="centerdot" role="MULOP" rpadding="1.7pt" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m12.1">∙</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                    </XMWrap>
                                  </XMDual>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post6"/>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                                <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m12.2.1.2">
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                            <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> tends to zero as <Math mode="inline" tex="n" text="n" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m13">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> tends
to infinity. By Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_4.3"/>,
<Math mode="inline" tex="\boldsymbol{\rho}" text="rho" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p3.m14">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="bold italic" name="rho" role="UNKNOWN">ρ</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is weakly mixing, and Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_6.3"/> is
proved.</p>
        </para>
        <para xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4">
          <p>The other case we have to consider is when there exists an integer <Math mode="inline" tex="n_{0}\geq 1" text="n _ 0 &gt;= 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> such that for every <Math mode="inline" tex="n\geq n_{0}" text="n &gt;= n _ 0" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{n}" text="pi _ n" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is equivalent to one of the representations <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{1},\dots,\pi_{n_{0}}" text="list@(pi _ 1, dots, pi _ n _ 0)" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m4.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m4.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m4.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m4.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m4.1">…</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m4.3">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Indeed, if there is no such integer, we can construct a strictly increasing sequence <Math mode="inline" tex="(n_{k})_{k\geq 1}" text="n _ k _ (k &gt;= 1)" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m5.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m5.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> of integers such that, for every <Math mode="inline" tex="k\geq 1" text="k &gt;= 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{n_{k}}" text="pi _ n _ k" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is not equivalent to one of the representations <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{1},\dots,\pi_{n_{k-1}}" text="list@(pi _ 1, dots, pi _ n _ (k - 1))" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m8">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m8.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m8.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m8.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m8.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m8.1">…</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m8.3">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. The set <Math mode="inline" tex="D=\{n_{k}\,;\,k\geq 1\}" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m9">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                  <XMApp rpadding="1.7pt">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="1.7pt">;</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m9.1">k</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMath>
            </Math> then has the property that whenever <Math mode="inline" tex="m" text="m" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m10">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="n" text="n" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m11">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> are two distinct elements of <Math mode="inline" tex="D" text="D" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m12">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{m}" text="pi _ m" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m13">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{n}" text="pi _ n" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m14">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> are not equivalent, and we are back to the setting of Case <Math mode="inline" tex="1" text="1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS1.p4.m15">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.</p>
        </para>
      </subsubsection>
      <subsubsection inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:Section_6.6.2" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2">
        <tags>
          <tag>5.5.2</tag>
          <tag role="autoref">subsubsection 5.5.2</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">5.5.2</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">§5.5.2</tag>
        </tags>
        <title><tag close=" ">5.5.2</tag>Case 2.b</title>
        <para xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1">
          <p>There exists an integer
<Math mode="inline" tex="n_{0}\geq 1" text="n _ 0 &gt;= 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> such that for every
<Math mode="inline" tex="n\geq n_{0}" text="n &gt;= n _ 0" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{n}" text="pi _ n" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is equivalent to one of the representations
<Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{1},\dots,\pi_{n_{0}}" text="list@(pi _ 1, dots, pi _ n _ 0)" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m4.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m4.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m4.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m4.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m4.1">…</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m4.3">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. There exists hence in this case an index <Math mode="inline" tex="j_{0}\in\{1,\ldots,n_{0}\}" text="j _ 0 element-of set@(1, ldots, n _ 0)" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m5.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m5.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m5.3"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m5.1">1</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="ldots" role="ID" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m5.2">…</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m5.3">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{n}" text="pi _ n" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is equivalent to <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{j_{0}}" text="pi _ j _ 0" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> for infinitely many integers <Math mode="inline" tex="n" text="n" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m8">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Extracting a subsequence from <Math mode="inline" tex="(\pi_{n})_{n\geq 1}" text="pi _ n _ (n &gt;= 1)" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m9">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m9.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m9.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, we
can suppose without loss of generality
that <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{n}" text="pi _ n" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m10">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is equivalent to <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{1}" text="pi _ 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m11">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> for every <Math mode="inline" tex="n\geq 1" text="n &gt;= 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m12">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, and so
that <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{n}=H_{1}" text="H _ n = H _ 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m13">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> for every <Math mode="inline" tex="{n\geq 1}" text="n &gt;= 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m14">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>

                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. For each <Math mode="inline" tex="{n\geq 1}" text="n &gt;= 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m15">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>

                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, let
<Math mode="inline" tex="U_{n}" text="U _ n" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m16">

              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>

                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. By (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq++"/>), there exists for every
<Math mode="inline" tex="{n\geq 1}" text="n &gt;= 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m19">
              <XMath>

            </Math> a finite family <Math mode="inline" tex="(a_{i,\,n})_{i\,\in I_{n}}" text="a _ (list@(i, n)) _ (i element-of I _ n)" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m20">

            </Math> of vectors of

          <p>For each <Math mode="inline" tex="{n\geq 1}" text="n &gt;= 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m22">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, set <Math mode="inline" tex="b_{n}={\mathop{\oplus}}\limits_{i\,\in I_{n}}U_{n}a_{i,\,n}" text="b _ n = (direct-sum _ (i element-of I _ n))@(U _ n * a _ (list@(i, n)))" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m23">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                      <XMTok meaning="direct-sum" name="oplus" role="BIGOP" scriptpos="mid">⊕</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" rpadding="1.7pt">i</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="list"/>

                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>

                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, seen as a vector of the infinite direct

              </XMath>
            </Math> coordinate to be zero when <Math mode="inline" tex="j" text="j" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m26">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
              </XMath>

                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Let also <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p1.m28">

        <para xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2">
          <p>Let now <Math mode="inline" tex="S" text="S" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m1">

              </XMath>
            </Math>. There exists an integer <Math mode="inline" tex="n_{S}\geq 1" text="n _ S &gt;= 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m3">

          <equation xml:id="S5.Ex85">
            <Math mode="display" tex="\sup_{g\,\in S}\,||\pi(g)b_{n}-b_{n}||&lt;{\varepsilon_{n}}\quad\textrm{for every%&#10; $n\geq n_{S}$.}" text="(supremum _ (g element-of S))@(norm@(pi * g * b _ n - b _ n)) less list@(varepsilon _ n, [for every ≥nnS.])" xml:id="S5.Ex85.m1">
