<!--  %**** String Line 1725 **** -->          <p>It follows that <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> has almost-invariant vectors for finite sets in the
sense of <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Pet" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Sec. 1.5]</cite>: for every <Math mode="inline" tex="\delta&gt;0" text="delta &gt; 0" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and every finite
subset <Math mode="inline" tex="S" text="S" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m8">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m9">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m10">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> has an <Math mode="inline" tex="(S,\delta)" text="open-interval@(S, delta)" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m11">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m11.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m11.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m11.1">S</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m11.2">δ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-invariant vector. This
implies that <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{1}" text="pi _ 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m12">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> itself has almost-invariant vectors for finite
sets (see <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Pet" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Sec. 1.5]</cite> or <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Ke" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>).
Since <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{1}" text="pi _ 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m13">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is a finite dimensional representation, it follows that <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{1}" text="pi _ 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m14">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
has almost-invariant vectors for any subset <Math mode="inline" tex="C" text="C" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m15">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m16">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, and in particular
for compact subsets of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m17">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Indeed, let <Math mode="inline" tex="C" text="C" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m18">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> be any subset of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m19">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, and
suppose that there exists a <Math mode="inline" tex="\delta&gt;0" text="delta &gt; 0" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m20">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{1}" text="pi _ 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m21">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> has no
<Math mode="inline" tex="(C,\delta)" text="open-interval@(C, delta)" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m22">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m22.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m22.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m22.1">C</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m22.2">δ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-invariant vector. This means that for every <Math mode="inline" tex="x" text="x" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m23">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> belonging
to the unit sphere
<Math mode="inline" tex="S_{H_{1}}" text="S _ H _ 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m24">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m25">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, there exists an element <Math mode="inline" tex="g_{x}" text="g _ x" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m26">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="C" text="C" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m27">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> such that
<Math mode="inline" tex="||\pi_{1}(g_{x})x-x||&gt;\delta" text="norm@(pi _ 1 * g _ x * x - x) &gt; delta" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m28">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m28.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN">||</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m28.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m28.1.1"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m28.1.1">
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE">||</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. The sets
<Math mode="inline" tex="V_{x}=\{y\in S_{H_{1}}\,;\,||\pi_{1}(g_{x})y-y||&gt;\delta\}" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m29">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMApp rpadding="1.7pt">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="1.7pt">;</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMath>
            </Math> form an open
covering of <Math mode="inline" tex="S_{H_{1}}" text="S _ H _ 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m30">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Since <Math mode="inline" tex="S_{H_{1}}" text="S _ H _ 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m31">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is compact, there exists a
finite
subset <Math mode="inline" tex="\{x_{1},\dots,x_{r}\}" text="set@(x _ 1, dots, x _ r)" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m32">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m32.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m32.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m32.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m32.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m32.1">…</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m32.3">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="S_{H_{1}}" text="S _ H _ 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m33">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> such that for every <Math mode="inline" tex="x\in S_{H_{1}}" text="x element-of S _ H _ 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m34">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\sup_{1\leq i\leq r}||\pi_{1}(g_{x_{i}})x-x||&gt;\delta" text="(supremum _ (1 less= i less= r))@(norm@(pi _ 1 * g _ x _ i * x - x)) &gt; delta" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m35">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok meaning="supremum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="post">sup</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m35.1"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN">||</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m35.1">
                          <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m35.1.1"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m35.1.1">
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE">||</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. If we
set <Math mode="inline" tex="S=\{g_{x_{1}},\dots,g_{x_{r}}\}" text="S = set@(g _ x _ 1, dots, g _ x _ r)" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m36">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m36.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m36.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m36.3"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m36.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m36.1">…</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m36.3">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, this means that <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{1}" text="pi _ 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m37">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> has no <Math mode="inline" tex="(S,\delta)" text="open-interval@(S, delta)" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m38">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m38.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m38.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m38.1">S</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p2.m38.2">δ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-invariant vector, which contradicts what we
just proved above.</p>
        </para>
        <para xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p3">
          <p>So <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{1}" text="pi _ 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p3.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> has almost-invariant vectors in the sense of
<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BdHV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Def. 1.1.1]</cite>, and the unit representation <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbbm{1}_{G}" text="1 _ G" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p3.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
<!--  %**** String Line 1750 **** -->is weakly contained in <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{1}" text="pi _ 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p3.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BdHV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Cor. F.1.5]</cite>. As <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{1}" text="pi _ 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p3.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is finite dimensional, it follows from <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BdHV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Cor. F.2.9]</cite> that
<Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbbm{1}_{G}" text="1 _ G" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p3.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is contained in <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{1}" text="pi _ 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p3.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, i. e. that <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{1}" text="pi _ 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p3.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> has a
non-zero <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p3.m8">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-invariant vector. This contradicts our initial assumption on
<Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{1}" text="pi _ 1" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p3.m9">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, and shows that the hypothesis of Case 2.b cannot be fulfilled.</p>
        </para>
        <para xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p4">
          <p>So under the assumption of Case 2, there exists for every <Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon&gt;0" text="varepsilon &gt; 0" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p4.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> a representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p4.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> with a <Math mode="inline" tex="(Q,\varepsilon)" text="open-interval@(Q, varepsilon)" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p4.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS2.p4.m3.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS5.SSS2.p4.m3.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p4.m3.1">Q</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS5.SSS2.p4.m3.2">ε</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-invariant vector but
no finite dimensional subrepresentation (this is Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_6.3"/>). This contradicts again assumption (<ref labelref="LABEL:Pro1"/>) of Theorem
<ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/>, and concludes the proof in this second case.</p>
        </para>
      </subsubsection>
    </subsection>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:Section_6" xml:id="S6">
    <tags>
      <tag>6</tag>
      <tag role="autoref">section 6</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">6</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">§6</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=" ">6</tag>Some consequences of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/></title>
    <para xml:id="S6.p1">
      <p>We begin this section by proving the two characterizations of Kazhdan sets obtained as consequences of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/>.</p>
    </para>
    <subsection inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:Section_7.2" xml:id="S6.SS1">
      <tags>
        <tag>6.1</tag>
        <tag role="autoref">subsection 6.1</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">6.1</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§6.1</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=" ">6.1</tag>Proofs
of Corollary <ref labelref="LABEL:Corollary_1"/> and Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_2"/></title>
      <para xml:id="S6.SS1.p1">
        <p>Let us first prove Corollary
<ref labelref="LABEL:Corollary_1"/>.
<ERROR class="undefined">{proof}</ERROR>[Proof of Corollary <ref labelref="LABEL:Corollary_1"/>]
Let <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}_{0}" text="Q _ 0" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
be a subset of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> which has non-empty interior and which generates <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
Denote for each <Math mode="inline" tex="{n\geq 1}" text="n &gt;= 1" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> by <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}_{0}^{\,\pm n}" text="(Q _ 0) ^ (plus-or-minus n)" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" lpadding="1.7pt" meaning="plus-or-minus" name="pm" role="ADDOP">±</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> the set <Math mode="inline" tex="\{g_{1}^{\,\pm 1}\dots g_{n}^{\,\pm 1}\,;\,g_{1},\dots,g_{n}\in{Q}_{0}\}" text="set@(list@((g _ 1) ^ (plus-or-minus 1) * dots * (g _ n) ^ (plus-or-minus 1), g _ 1, dots, g _ n) element-of Q _ 0)" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.SS1.p1.m6.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m6.2">
                    <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.SS1.p1.m6.2.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.SS1.p1.m6.2.2"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.SS1.p1.m6.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.SS1.p1.m6.2.3"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m6.2.1">
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" lpadding="1.7pt" meaning="plus-or-minus" name="pm" role="ADDOP">±</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok name="dots" role="ID">…</XMTok>
                          <XMApp rpadding="1.7pt">
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" lpadding="1.7pt" meaning="plus-or-minus" name="pm" role="ADDOP">±</XMTok>

                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="1.7pt">;</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m6.2.2">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m6.1">…</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m6.2.3">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Then
<!--  %**** String Line 1775 **** --><Math mode="inline" tex="G=\bigcup_{n\geq 1}{Q}_{0}^{\,\pm n}" text="G = (union _ (n &gt;= 1))@((Q _ 0) ^ (plus-or-minus n))" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>

                    <XMTok fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="union" name="bigcup" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⋃</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>

                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" lpadding="1.7pt" meaning="plus-or-minus" name="pm" role="ADDOP">±</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Let <Math mode="inline" tex="g_{0}" text="g _ 0" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be an element of the
interior of
<Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}_{0}" text="Q _ 0" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Then <Math mode="inline" tex="g_{0}^{-1}{Q}_{0}" text="(g _ 0) ^ (- 1) * Q _ 0" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a neighborhood of <Math mode="inline" tex="e" text="e" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. There
exists <Math mode="inline" tex="n_{0}\geq 1" text="n _ 0 &gt;= 1" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="g_{0}^{-1}" text="(g _ 0) ^ (- 1)" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> belongs to
<Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}_{0}^{\,\pm n_{0}}" text="(Q _ 0) ^ (plus-or-minus n _ 0)" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" lpadding="1.7pt" meaning="plus-or-minus" name="pm" role="ADDOP">±</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>,
and thus <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}_{0}^{\,\pm(n_{0}+1)}" text="(Q _ 0) ^ (plus-or-minus (n _ 0 + 1))" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" lpadding="1.7pt" meaning="plus-or-minus" name="pm" role="ADDOP">±</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.SS1.p1.m15.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m15.1">
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a neighborhood of <Math mode="inline" tex="e" text="e" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. If we set
<Math mode="inline" tex="W_{n}={Q}_{0}^{\,\pm(n_{0}+n)}" text="W _ n = (Q _ 0) ^ (plus-or-minus (n _ 0 + n))" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m17">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>

                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" lpadding="1.7pt" meaning="plus-or-minus" name="pm" role="ADDOP">±</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.SS1.p1.m17.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m17.1">
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for <Math mode="inline" tex="{n\geq 1}" text="n &gt;= 1" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m18">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, the sequence of sets
<Math mode="inline" tex="(W_{n})_{n\geq 1}" text="W _ n _ (n &gt;= 1)" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m19">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.SS1.p1.m19.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m19.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is increasing, <Math mode="inline" tex="W_{1}" text="W _ 1" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m20">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a neighborhood of <Math mode="inline" tex="e" text="e" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m21">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, and <Math mode="inline" tex="(W_{n})_{n\geq 1}" text="W _ n _ (n &gt;= 1)" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m22">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.SS1.p1.m22.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m22.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
satisfies the assumptions of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/>. So if <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m23">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a
subset of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m24">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for which assumption (<ref labelref="LABEL:Pro1"/>) of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/>
holds true, there exists
<Math mode="inline" tex="n\geq 1" text="n &gt;= 1" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m25">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}_{0}^{\,\pm(n+n_{0})}\cup Q" text="(Q _ 0) ^ (plus-or-minus (n + n _ 0)) union Q" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m26">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="union" name="cup" role="ADDOP">∪</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" lpadding="1.7pt" meaning="plus-or-minus" name="pm" role="ADDOP">±</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.SS1.p1.m26.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m26.1">
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m27">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon&gt;0" text="varepsilon &gt; 0" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m28">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be a Kazhdan constant for this set. Then <Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon/(n+n_{0})" text="varepsilon / (n + n _ 0)" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m29">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.SS1.p1.m29.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m29.1">
                      <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a Kazhdan constant for <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}_{0}\cup{Q}" text="Q _ 0 union Q" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m30">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="union" name="cup" role="ADDOP">∪</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>,
and <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}_{0}\cup{Q}" text="Q _ 0 union Q" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m31">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="union" name="cup" role="ADDOP">∪</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a Kazhdan set in
<Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m32">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. If <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m33">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is locally compact, the same proof
holds true without the assumption that <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}_{0}" text="Q _ 0" xml:id="S6.SS1.p1.m34">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> has non-empty interior.</p>
      </para>
      <ERROR class="undefined">{proof}</ERROR>
      <para xml:id="S6.SS1.p2">
        <p>[Proof of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_2"/>]
Let us first show that (a) implies (b). If (a) holds true, then, according to the definition of a Kazhdan set, there exists <Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon&gt;0" text="varepsilon &gt; 0" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that the following property holds true:
any unitary representation <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on a complex Hilbert space <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
with a
<Math mode="inline" tex="({Q},\varepsilon)" text="open-interval@(Q, varepsilon)" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.SS1.p2.m5.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.SS1.p2.m5.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m5.1">Q</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m5.2">ε</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-invariant vector has a non-zero <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-invariant vector. Without any loss of generality one can assume that <Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon&lt;2" text="varepsilon less 2" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Let
<Math mode="inline" tex="\delta=\sqrt{1-{\varepsilon}/{2}}" text="delta = square-root@(1 - varepsilon / 2)" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>

                  <XMTok meaning="square-root"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>

            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>

          <Math mode="display" tex="{{\langle{\pi{\otimes}{\overline{{\pi}}}(g)x{\otimes}{\overline{{x}}}},{x{%&#10;\otimes}{\overline{{x}}}}\rangle}}=|{{\langle{\pi(g)x},{x}\rangle}}|^{2}&gt;%&#10;\delta^{2}" text="list@(((pi tensor-product overline@(pi)) * g * x) tensor-product overline@(x), x tensor-product overline@(x)) = (absolute-value@(list@(pi * g * x, x))) ^ 2 &gt; delta ^ 2" xml:id="S6.Ex86.m1">

        <p>for every <Math mode="inline" tex="g\in{Q}" text="g element-of Q" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m17">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>

            </XMath>
          </Math>.
Therefore we have</p>
        <equation xml:id="S6.Ex87">
          <Math mode="display" tex="2\Re e{{\langle{\pi{\otimes}{\overline{{\pi}}}(g)x{\otimes}{\overline{{x}}}},{%&#10;x{\otimes}{\overline{{x}}}}\rangle}}=2|{{\langle{\pi(g)x},{x}\rangle}}|^{2}&gt;2-\varepsilon" text="2 * real-part@(e) * list@(((pi tensor-product overline@(pi)) * g * x) tensor-product overline@(x), x tensor-product overline@(x)) = 2 * (absolute-value@(list@(pi * g * x, x))) ^ 2 &gt; 2 - varepsilon" xml:id="S6.Ex87.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="real-part" name="Re" role="OPFUNCTION">ℜ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.Ex87.m1.4"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.Ex87.m1.5"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex87.m1.4">
                        <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S6.Ex87.m1.1"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.Ex87.m1.1">g</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex87.m1.5">
                        <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.Ex87.m1.6"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        <XMDual xml:id="S6.Ex87.m1.6">
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S6.Ex87.m1.6.1"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S6.Ex87.m1.3"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex87.m1.6.1">
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                              <XMDual>
                                <XMRef idref="S6.Ex87.m1.2"/>
                                <XMWrap>
                                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.Ex87.m1.2">g</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>

                            <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>for every <Math mode="inline" tex="g\in{Q}" text="g element-of Q" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m18">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Hence
<Math mode="inline" tex="\left\|\pi{\otimes}{\overline{{\pi}}}(g)x{\otimes}{\overline{{x}}}-x{\otimes}{%&#10;\overline{{x}}}\right\|&lt;\varepsilon" text="norm@(((pi tensor-product overline@(pi)) * g * x) tensor-product overline@(x) - x tensor-product overline@(x)) less varepsilon" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m19">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>

                  <XMApp>

                  <XMWrap>

                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m19.2">
                      <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S6.SS1.p2.m19.1"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m19.1">g</XMTok>

                          </XMDual>

                        <XMApp>

                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">∥</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
for every <Math mode="inline" tex="g\in{Q}" text="g element-of Q" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m20">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Using (a) we obtain that the representation <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi{\otimes}{\overline{{\pi}}}" text="pi tensor-product overline@(pi)" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m21">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of
<Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m22">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="H{\otimes}{\overline{{H}}}" text="H tensor-product overline@(H)" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m23">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> has a non-zero <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m24">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-invariant vector. It follows from Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_4.1"/> that <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m25">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> has a finite dimensional subrepresentation. Thus <Math mode="inline" tex="(b)" text="b" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m26">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S6.SS1.p2.m26.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m26.1">b</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is true.
Suppose now that (b) holds true for some <Math mode="inline" tex="\delta\in(0,1)" text="delta element-of open-interval@(0, 1)" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m27">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>

                    <XMRef idref="S6.SS1.p2.m27.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m27.1">0</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m27.2">1</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Let
<Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon=\sqrt{2(1-\delta)}" text="varepsilon = square-root@(2 * (1 - delta))" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m28">

                      <XMRef idref="S6.SS1.p2.m28.1"/>

                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

              </XMApp>

          </Math>
and consider a unitary representation <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m29">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m30">

          </Math>
with a <Math mode="inline" tex="({Q},\varepsilon)" text="open-interval@(Q, varepsilon)" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m32">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>

              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-invariant vector <Math mode="inline" tex="x" text="x" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m33">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of norm one. Noticing again that

we get that
<Math mode="inline" tex="\left|{{\langle{\pi(g)x},{x}\rangle}}\right|\geq\Re e{{\langle{\pi(g)x},{x}%&#10;\rangle}}&gt;\delta" text="absolute-value@(list@(pi * g * x, x)) &gt;= real-part@(e) * list@(pi * g * x, x) &gt; delta" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m35">
