                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="real-part" name="Re" role="OPFUNCTION">ℜ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.SS1.p2.m35.6"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.SS1.p2.m35.4"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m35.6">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.SS1.p2.m35.3"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m35.3">g</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m35.4">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
for every <Math mode="inline" tex="g\in{Q}" text="g element-of Q" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m36">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. It follows from (b) that <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S6.SS1.p2.m37">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> has a finite dimensional subrepresentation. Thus (b) implies (c).
The fact that (c) implies (a) is a consequence of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/>.</p>
      </para>
    </subsection>
    <subsection inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:Section7.1" xml:id="S6.SS2">
      <tags>
        <tag>6.2</tag>
        <tag role="autoref">subsection 6.2</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">6.2</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§6.2</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=" ">6.2</tag>Property (T) in <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma" text="sigma" xml:id="S6.SS2.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-compact
locally compact groups</title>
      <para xml:id="S6.SS2.p1">
        <p>As a consequence of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/>, we retrieve a
characterization of Property (T) due to Bekka and Valette <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>,
<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BdHV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Th. 2.12.9]</cite>, valid for <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma" text="sigma" xml:id="S6.SS2.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-compact locally compact
groups. Recall that a unitary representation <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S6.SS2.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS2.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on a Hilbert
space <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S6.SS2.p1.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> has <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">almost-invariant vectors</text> if it has <Math mode="inline" tex="({Q},\varepsilon)" text="open-interval@(Q, varepsilon)" xml:id="S6.SS2.p1.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.SS2.p1.m5.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.SS2.p1.m5.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.SS2.p1.m5.1">Q</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.SS2.p1.m5.2">ε</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-invariant vectors for every compact subset <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S6.SS2.p1.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S6.SS2.p1.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and every
<Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon&gt;0" text="varepsilon &gt; 0" xml:id="S6.SS2.p1.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Then Property (T) can be characterized by the fact that
every unitary representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS2.p1.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> with almost-invariant vectors has a
non-zero <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS2.p1.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-invariant vector <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BdHV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Prop. 1.2.1]</cite>. A result due to Bekka and Valette <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> (see also
<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BdHV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Th. 2.12.9]</cite>) states the following:</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_theorem" inlist="thm theorem:theorem" labels="LABEL:Theorem_7.1" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem1">
        <tags>
          <tag>Theorem 6.1</tag>
          <tag role="autoref">Theorem 6.1</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">6.1</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Theorem 6.1</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Theorem 6.1</text></tag> (<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>)</title>
        <para xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem1.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem1.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma" text="sigma" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem1.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>-compact locally compact group.
Then <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem1.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> has
Property (T) if and only if every unitary representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem1.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> with
almost-invariant vectors has a non-trivial finite dimensional
subrepresentation.
<!--  %**** String Line 1850 **** --></text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <para xml:id="S6.SS2.p2">
        <p>The proof of <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> relies on the equivalence between Property (T) and
Property (FH) for such groups <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BdHV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Th. 2.12.4]</cite>: every affine
isometric action of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS2.p2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on a real Hilbert space has a fixed point. As a
direct consequence of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/>, we will derive a new proof of
Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_7.1"/> which does not involve property (FH).</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S6.SS2.p3">
        <p>If <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S6.SS2.p3.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a subset of a topological group <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS2.p3.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, and if <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S6.SS2.p3.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a unitary representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS2.p3.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on a Hilbert space <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S6.SS2.p3.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, we say that <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S6.SS2.p3.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> has <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S6.SS2.p3.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math><text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">-almost-invariant vectors</text> if it has <Math mode="inline" tex="({Q},\varepsilon)" text="open-interval@(Q, varepsilon)" xml:id="S6.SS2.p3.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.SS2.p3.m8.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.SS2.p3.m8.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.SS2.p3.m8.1">Q</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.SS2.p3.m8.2">ε</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-invariant vectors for every <Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon&gt;0" text="varepsilon &gt; 0" xml:id="S6.SS2.p3.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. The same argument as in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BdHV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Prop. 1.2.1]</cite> shows that <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S6.SS2.p3.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS2.p3.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> if and only if every representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS2.p3.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> with <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S6.SS2.p3.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-almost-invariant vectors has a non-zero <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS2.p3.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-invariant vector. As a direct corollary of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_2"/>, we obtain the following characterization of Kazhdan sets which generate the group:</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_corollary" inlist="thm theorem:corollary" labels="LABEL:CorollaryA" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem2">
        <tags>
          <tag>Corollary 6.2</tag>
          <tag role="autoref">6.2</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">6.2</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Corollary 6.2</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Corollary 6.2</text></tag></title>
        <para xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem2.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem2.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a subset of a locally compact group <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem2.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> which generates <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem2.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>. Then <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem2.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem2.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> if and only if every representation <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem2.p1.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem2.p1.m7">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> with <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem2.p1.m8">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>-almost-invariant vectors has a non-trivial finite dimensional subrepresentation.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <ERROR class="undefined">{proof}</ERROR>
      <para xml:id="S6.SS2.p4">
        <p>[Proof of Corollary <ref labelref="LABEL:CorollaryA"/>]
The only thing to prove is that if every representation <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S6.SS2.p4.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS2.p4.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> with <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S6.SS2.p4.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-almost-invariant vectors has a non-trivial finite dimensional representation, <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S6.SS2.p4.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a Kazhdan set. For this it suffices to show the existence of an <Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon&gt;0" text="varepsilon &gt; 0" xml:id="S6.SS2.p4.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that assumption (<ref labelref="LABEL:Pro1"/>) of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/> holds true.
The argument is again exactly the same as the one given in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BdHV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Prop. 1.2.1]</cite>: suppose that there is no such <Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon" text="varepsilon" xml:id="S6.SS2.p4.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, and let, for every <Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon&gt;0" text="varepsilon &gt; 0" xml:id="S6.SS2.p4.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{\varepsilon}" text="pi _ varepsilon" xml:id="S6.SS2.p4.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be a representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS2.p4.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> with a <Math mode="inline" tex="({Q},\varepsilon)" text="open-interval@(Q, varepsilon)" xml:id="S6.SS2.p4.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.SS2.p4.m10.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.SS2.p4.m10.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.SS2.p4.m10.1">Q</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.SS2.p4.m10.2">ε</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-invariant vector but no finite dimensional subrepresentation. Then <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi=\bigoplus_{\varepsilon&gt;0}\pi_{\varepsilon}" text="pi = (direct-sum _ (varepsilon &gt; 0))@(pi _ varepsilon)" xml:id="S6.SS2.p4.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="direct-sum" name="bigoplus" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⊕</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> has <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S6.SS2.p4.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-almost-invariant vectors but no finite dimensional subrepresentation (this follows immediately from <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BdHV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Prop. A.1.8]</cite>), contradicting our initial assumption.</p>
      </para>
      <ERROR class="undefined">{proof}</ERROR>
      <para xml:id="S6.SS2.p5">
        <p>[Proof of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_7.1"/>]
It is clear that Property (T) implies that every representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS2.p5.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> with almost-invariant vectors
has a non-trivial finite dimensional subrepresentation.
Conversely, suppose that every representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS2.p5.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> with almost-invariant vectors
has a non-trivial finite dimensional subrepresentation. Using the same argument as in the proof of Corollary <ref labelref="LABEL:CorollaryA"/>, we see that there exists
a compact subset <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S6.SS2.p5.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS2.p5.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that assumption (<ref labelref="LABEL:Pro1"/>) of
Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/> holds true.
Choosing for <Math mode="inline" tex="(W_{n})_{n\geq 1}" text="W _ n _ (n &gt;= 1)" xml:id="S6.SS2.p5.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.SS2.p5.m5.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.SS2.p5.m5.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> an increasing sequence of compact subsets of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS2.p5.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
such that <Math mode="inline" tex="\bigcup_{\gnW}{}_{n}=G" xml:id="S6.SS2.p5.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="union" name="bigcup" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⋃</XMTok>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\gnW</ERROR>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="pre2"/>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/> implies that there exists an <Math mode="inline" tex="{n\geq 1}" text="n &gt;= 1" xml:id="S6.SS2.p5.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that
<Math mode="inline" tex="W_{n}\cup{Q}" text="W _ n union Q" xml:id="S6.SS2.p5.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="union" name="cup" role="ADDOP">∪</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS2.p5.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Since <Math mode="inline" tex="W_{n}\cup{Q}" text="W _ n union Q" xml:id="S6.SS2.p5.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="union" name="cup" role="ADDOP">∪</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is compact,
<Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS2.p5.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> has Property (T).</p>
      </para>
    </subsection>
    <subsection inlist="toc" xml:id="S6.SS3">
      <tags>
        <tag>6.3</tag>
        <tag role="autoref">subsection 6.3</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">6.3</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§6.3</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=" ">6.3</tag>Equidistribution assumptions: proofs of Theorems
<ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_1"/>, <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_3"/> and <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_4"/></title>
      <para class="ltx_noindent" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1">
        <p>Let <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be a second countable locally compact
group, and let <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be a unitary
representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on a separable Hilbert space <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Such a
representation
can be decomposed as a direct integral of irreducible unitary
representations over a Borel space (see for instance
<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BdHV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Sec. F.5]</cite> or <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Fo" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>). More precisely, there exists a finite positive
measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on a standard Borel space <Math mode="inline" tex="Z" text="Z" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, a measurable field
<Math mode="inline" tex="\smash{\xymatrix{z\ar@{|-&gt;}[r]&amp;H_{z}}}" text="[\xymatrix] * z * [\ar] * @ * ket@(-) * delimited-[]@(r) * &amp; * H _ z" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\xymatrix</ERROR>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\ar</ERROR>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">@</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="ket"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.SS3.p1.m7.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m7.1">-</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="CLOSE">&gt;</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="delimited-[]"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.SS3.p1.m7.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m7.2">r</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">&amp;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of Hilbert spaces over
<Math mode="inline" tex="Z" text="Z" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, and a measurable field of irreducible representations
<Math mode="inline" tex="\smash{\xymatrix{z\ar@{|-&gt;}[r]&amp;\pi_{z}}}" text="[\xymatrix] * z * [\ar] * @ * ket@(-) * delimited-[]@(r) * &amp; * pi _ z" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\xymatrix</ERROR>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\ar</ERROR>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">@</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="ket"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.SS3.p1.m9.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m9.1">-</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="CLOSE">&gt;</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="delimited-[]"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.SS3.p1.m9.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m9.2">r</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">&amp;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, where each <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{z}" text="pi _ z" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{z}" text="H _ z" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>,
such that <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is unitarily equivalent to the direct integral
<Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{\mu}={\displaystyle}\int_{Z}^{\mathop{\oplus}}\pi_{z}\,d\mu(z)" text="pi _ mu = ((integral _ Z) ^ direct-sum)@(pi _ z * differential-d@(mu) * z)" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="integral" name="int" role="INTOP">∫</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="direct-sum" name="oplus" role="BIGOP" scriptpos="post">⊕</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp rpadding="1.7pt">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="italic" meaning="differential-d" role="DIFFOP">d</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.SS3.p1.m14.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m14.1">z</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathscr{H}}={\displaystyle}\int_{Z}^{\oplH}{}_{z}\,d\mu(z)" text="H = ((integral _ Z) ^ [\oplH])@(_ z d * mu * z)" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="script" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="integral" name="int" role="INTOP">∫</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <ERROR class="undefined">\oplH</ERROR>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="pre2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.SS3.p1.m15.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m15.1">z</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. The Hilbert space
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathscr{H}}" text="H" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="script" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is the set of equivalence classes of square integrable vector
fields <Math mode="inline" tex="\smash{\xymatrix{z\ar@{|-&gt;}[r]&amp;x_{z}}}" text="[\xymatrix] * z * [\ar] * @ * ket@(-) * delimited-[]@(r) * &amp; * x _ z" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m17">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\xymatrix</ERROR>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\ar</ERROR>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">@</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="ket"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.SS3.p1.m17.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m17.1">-</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="CLOSE">&gt;</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="delimited-[]"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.SS3.p1.m17.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m17.2">r</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">&amp;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, with <Math mode="inline" tex="x_{z}\in H_{z}" text="x _ z element-of H _ z" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m18">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>,
with respect to the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m19">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>;
<Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{\mu}" text="pi _ mu" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m20">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is the
<!--  %**** String Line 1900 **** -->representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m21">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathscr{H}}" text="H" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m22">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="script" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> defined by
<Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{\mu}(g)x=[\smash{\xymatrix{z\ar@{|-&gt;}[r]&amp;\pi_{z}(g)x_{z}}}]" text="pi _ mu * g * x = delimited-[]@([\xymatrix] * z * [\ar] * @ * ket@(-) * delimited-[]@(r) * &amp; * pi _ z * g * x _ z)" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m23">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.SS3.p1.m23.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m23.1">g</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="delimited-[]"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.SS3.p1.m23.5"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m23.5">
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <ERROR class="undefined">\xymatrix</ERROR>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                      <ERROR class="undefined">\ar</ERROR>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">@</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="ket"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.SS3.p1.m23.2"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                          <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m23.2">-</XMTok>
                          <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="CLOSE">&gt;</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="delimited-[]"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.SS3.p1.m23.3"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m23.3">r</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">&amp;</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.SS3.p1.m23.4"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m23.4">g</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
for every <Math mode="inline" tex="g\in G" text="g element-of G" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m24">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="x\in{\mathscr{H}}" text="x element-of H" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m25">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="script" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. If <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu_{c}" text="mu _ c" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m26">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu_{d}" text="mu _ d" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m27">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> denote respectively the
continuous and discrete parts of the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m28">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathscr{H}}" text="H" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m29">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="script" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> decomposes as
an
orthogonal direct sum <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathscr{H}}={\mathscr{H}}_{c}{\mathop{\oplus}}{\mathscr{H}}_{d}" text="H = H _ c * direct-sum@(H _ d)" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m30">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="script" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="script" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="direct-sum" name="oplus" role="BIGOP" scriptpos="post">⊕</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="script" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, and <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{\mu}" text="pi _ mu" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m31">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> as a direct
sum <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{\mu}=\pi_{\mu,c}{\mathop{\oplus}}\pi_{\mu,d}" text="pi _ mu = pi _ (list@(mu, c)) * direct-sum@(pi _ (list@(mu, d)))" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m32">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.SS3.p1.m32.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.SS3.p1.m32.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m32.1">μ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m32.2">c</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="direct-sum" name="oplus" role="BIGOP" scriptpos="post">⊕</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.SS3.p1.m32.3"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.SS3.p1.m32.4"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m32.3">μ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m32.4">d</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, where</p>

                <td align="left"><Math mode="inline" tex="\displaystyle{\mathscr{H}}_{d}=\int_{Z}^{\oplH}{}_{z}\,d\mu_{d}(z),\quad\pi_{%&#10;\mu,d}=\int_{Z}^{\mathop{\oplus}}\pi_{z}\,d\mu_{d}(z)." text="formulae@(H _ d = ((integral _ Z) ^ [\oplH])@(_ z d * mu _ d * z), pi _ (list@(mu, d)) = ((integral _ Z) ^ direct-sum)@(pi _ z * differential-d@(mu _ d) * z))" xml:id="S6.Ex89.m1">

                            <XMApp>

                              <XMRef idref="S6.Ex89.m1.5.1"/>

        <p>If we denote by <Math mode="inline" tex="Z_{d}" text="Z _ d" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m33">

        <p>It follows that if <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m36">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> has a non-trivial discrete part, one of the
irreducible representations <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{z}" text="pi _ z" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m37">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a subrepresentation of <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{\mu}" text="pi _ mu" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m38">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
This observation lies at the core of the proof of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_3"/>.
<ERROR class="undefined">{proof}</ERROR>[Proof of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_3"/>] Our aim is to show that,
under the hypothesis of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_3"/>, assumption (<ref labelref="LABEL:Pro1"/>)
of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/> is satisfied. Fix <Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon\in(0,1)" text="varepsilon element-of open-interval@(0, 1)" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m39">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.SS3.p1.m39.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.SS3.p1.m39.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m39.1">0</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m39.2">1</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and
<!--  %**** String Line 1925 **** -->let <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m40">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be a representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m41">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on
a Hilbert space <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m42">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Since <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m43">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is second countable, we can suppose that
<Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m44">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is separable. Suppose that <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m45">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> admits a <Math mode="inline" tex="({Q},\varepsilon)" text="open-interval@(Q, varepsilon)" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m46">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>

                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-invariant vector <Math mode="inline" tex="x\in H" text="x element-of H" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m47">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>

              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. By the result recalled above, we can
suppose
without loss of generality that</p>

                                <ERROR class="undefined">\oplH</ERROR>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="pre2"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMRef idref="S6.Ex91.m1.4"/>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>where <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m48">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a finite positive Borel measure on a standard Borel space

            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>

                                          </XMApp>
                                          <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.Ex93.m2.1">x</XMTok>
                                          <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                                        </XMWrap>
                                      </XMDual>
                                    </XMApp>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER" rpadding="1.7pt">2</XMTok>
                              <XMDual>

                                <XMWrap>

          <p class="ltx_intertext">so that</p>
