        <p>Now, by assumption (<ref labelref="LABEL:Pro3"/>) of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_3"/>,</p>
        <equation xml:id="S6.Ex95">
          <Math mode="display" tex="\xymatrix@C=50pt{\dfrac{1}{N}{\displaystyle}\sum_{k=1}^{N}{{\langle{\pi(g_{k})%&#10;x_{z}},{x_{z}}\rangle}}\ar[r]_{-}{\smash[b]{\xymatrix@C=13pt{\scriptstyle N\ar%&#10;[r]&amp;\scriptstyle+\infty}}}&amp;0}\quad\textrm{for}\;\mu\textrm{-}\textrm{almost %&#10;every}\;z\in Z\setminus Z_{0}," text="formulae@([\xymatrix] * @ * C = 50 * p * t * (1 / N) * ((sum _ (k = 1)) ^ N)@(list@(pi * g _ k * x _ z, x _ z) * [\ar] * (delimited-[]@(r)) _ - * [\xymatrix] * [@C=13ptN\ar[r]&amp;+] * infinity * &amp; * 0), [for] * mu * [-almost every] * z element-of Z set-minus Z _ 0)" xml:id="S6.Ex95.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S6.Ex95.m1.2"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMDual xml:id="S6.Ex95.m1.2">
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.Ex95.m1.2.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.Ex95.m1.2.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex95.m1.2.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <ERROR class="undefined">\xymatrix</ERROR>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">@</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok meaning="50" role="NUMBER">50</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">t</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                            <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid3"/>
                              <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid3"/>
                                <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">∑</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMDual>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                                  <XMRef idref="S6.Ex95.m1.2.1.1"/>
                                  <XMRef idref="S6.Ex95.m1.2.1.2"/>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMWrap>
                                  <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex95.m1.2.1.1">
                                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                                    <XMDual>
                                      <XMRef idref="S6.Ex95.m1.2.1.1.1"/>
                                      <XMWrap>
                                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                        <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex95.m1.2.1.1.1">
                                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post6"/>
                                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                                        </XMApp>
                                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                      </XMWrap>
                                    </XMDual>
                                    <XMApp>
                                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post6"/>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                                    </XMApp>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex95.m1.2.1.2">
                                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post6"/>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>
                              <ERROR class="undefined">\ar</ERROR>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok meaning="delimited-[]"/>
                                    <XMRef idref="S6.Ex95.m1.1"/>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.Ex95.m1.1">r</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <ERROR class="undefined">\xymatrix</ERROR>
                              <XMText>@C=13pt<text fontsize="70%">N<ERROR class="undefined">\ar</ERROR>[r]&amp;+</text></XMText>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">&amp;</XMTok>
                              <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="quad" role="PUNCT"> </XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex95.m1.2.2">
                        <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMText rpadding="2.8pt">for</XMText>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                          <XMText rpadding="2.8pt">-almost every</XMText>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="set-minus" name="setminus" role="ADDOP">∖</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>where <Math mode="inline" tex="Z_{0}" text="Z _ 0" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m56">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
is a subset of <Math mode="inline" tex="Z" text="Z" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m57">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> which is countable.
We infer from this that <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu(Z_{0})&gt;0" text="mu * Z _ 0 &gt; 0" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m58">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.SS3.p1.m58.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m58.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, and thus <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m59">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> has a non-trivial
discrete part. Hence one of the representations <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{z}" text="pi _ z" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m60">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="z\in Z_{0}" text="z element-of Z _ 0" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m61">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>,
is
a subrepresentation of <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m62">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Since all irreducible representations of
<Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m63">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> are supposed to be finite dimensional, <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m64">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> has a finite dimensional
subrepresentation. So assumption (<ref labelref="LABEL:Pro1"/>) of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/>
is satisfied. As <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m65">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> generates <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m66">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, it now follows from
Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_2"/> that <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m67">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m68">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.

<ERROR class="undefined">{proof}</ERROR>[Proof of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_1"/>]
The proof of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_1"/> is exactly the same as that of
Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_3"/>, using the fact that if <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m69">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a locally compact
abelian group (not necessarily second countable), any unitary
representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.SS3.p1.m70">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is equivalent to a direct integral of irreducible
representations (see for instance <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Fo" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Th. 7.36]</cite>).

<!--  %**** String Line 1975 **** -->Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_4"/> is
a direct consequence of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_1"/> and
Corollary <ref labelref="LABEL:Corollary_100"/>.
We finish this section with the following remark.</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_remark" inlist="thm theorem:remark" labels="LABEL:Remarque_Fin" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem3">
        <tags>
          <tag>Remark 6.3</tag>
          <tag role="autoref">6.3</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">6.3</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Remark 6.3</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Remark 6.3</text></tag></title>
        <para xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem3.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">When the equidistribution assumption (<ref labelref="LABEL:Pro3"/>) of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_3"/> is satisfied, but <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem3.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> does not generate <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem3.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, the same proof shows that <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem3.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> becomes a Kazhdan set when one adds to it a suitable “small” perturbation. More precisely:</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_theorem" inlist="thm theorem:theorem" labels="LABEL:Theorem_+" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem4">
        <tags>
          <tag>Theorem 6.4</tag>
          <tag role="autoref">Theorem 6.4</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">6.4</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Theorem 6.4</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Theorem 6.4</text></tag></title>
        <para xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem4.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem4.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a second countable locally compact Moore group, and let <Math mode="inline" tex="(W_{n})_{n\geq 1}" text="W _ n _ (n &gt;= 1)" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem4.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.Thmtheorem4.p1.m2.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem4.p1.m2.1">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be an increasing sequence of subsets of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem4.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="\bigcup_{\gnW}{}_{n}=G" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem4.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="union" name="bigcup" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⋃</XMTok>
                    <ERROR class="undefined">\gnW</ERROR>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="pre3"/>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>. Let <Math mode="inline" tex="(g_{k})_{k\geq 1}" text="g _ k _ (k &gt;= 1)" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem4.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.Thmtheorem4.p1.m5.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem4.p1.m5.1">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a
sequence of elements of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem4.p1.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> which satisfies the following assumption:</text></p>
          <equation labels="LABEL:Equation3" xml:id="S6.E14">
            <tags>
              <tag>(14)</tag>
              <tag role="autoref"><text font="italic">Equation 14</text></tag>
              <tag role="refnum">14</tag>
            </tags>
            <inline-para class="ltx_markedasmath ltx_minipage" vattach="middle" width="341.4pt">
              <para xml:id="S6.E14.m1.p1">
                <p><text font="italic">for all irreducible representations
</text><Math mode="inline" tex="{\pi}" text="pi" xml:id="S6.E14.m1.p1.m1">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> of </text><Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.E14.m1.p1.m2">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> on a Hilbert space </text><Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S6.E14.m1.p1.m3">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic">, except at most countably
many,</text></p>
                <equation xml:id="S6.Ex96">
                  <Math mode="display" tex="\xymatrix@C=50pt{\dfrac{1}{N}{\displaystyle}\sum_{k=1}^{N}{{\langle{\pi(g_{k})%&#10;x},{y}\rangle}}\ar[r]_{-}{\smash[b]{\xymatrix@C=13pt{\scriptstyle N\ar[r]&amp;%&#10;\scriptstyle+\infty}}}&amp;0}\quad\textrm{for every}\;x,y\in H." text="formulae@([\xymatrix] * @ * C = list@(50 * p * t * (1 / N) * ((sum _ (k = 1)) ^ N)@(list@(pi * g _ k * x, y) * [\ar] * (delimited-[]@(r)) _ - * [\xymatrix] * [@C=13ptN\ar[r]&amp;+] * infinity * &amp; * 0), [for every] * x), y element-of H)" xml:id="S6.Ex96.m1">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.Ex96.m1.3"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMDual xml:id="S6.Ex96.m1.3">

                                    <XMTok font="italic" name="quad" role="PUNCT"> </XMTok>
                                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex96.m1.3.1.2">
                                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                      <XMText rpadding="2.8pt"><text font="italic">for every</text></XMText>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                                    </XMApp>
                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex96.m1.3.2">
                                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math>
                </equation>
              </para>
            </inline-para>
          </equation>
          <p><text font="italic">Set <Math mode="inline" tex="Q=\{g_{k}\;;\;k\geq 1\}" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem4.p1.m7">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                    <XMApp rpadding="2.8pt">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT" rpadding="2.8pt">;</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem4.p1.m7.1">k</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.
There exists <Math mode="inline" tex="n\geq 1" text="n &gt;= 1" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem4.p1.m8">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="W_{n}\cup{Q}" text="W _ n union Q" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem4.p1.m9">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="union" name="cup" role="ADDOP">∪</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S6.Thmtheorem4.p1.m10">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
<!--  %**** String Line 2000 **** -->    </subsection>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:Section_7" xml:id="S7">
    <tags>
      <tag>7</tag>
      <tag role="autoref">section 7</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">7</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">§7</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=" ">7</tag>Examples and applications</title>
    <para xml:id="S7.p1">
      <p>We present in this section some more examples of Kazhdan sets in different kinds of groups, some statements being obtained as consequences of Theorems <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/>, <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_2"/> or <ref labelref="LABEL:Corollary_100"/>. We do not try to be exhaustive, and our aim here is rather to highlight some interesting phenomena which appear when looking for Kazhdan sets, as well as the connections of these phenomena with some remarkable properties of the group. We begin with the simplest case, that of locally compact abelian (LCA) groups.</p>
    </para>
    <subsection inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:Subsection_8.1" xml:id="S7.SS1">
      <tags>
        <tag>7.1</tag>
        <tag role="autoref">subsection 7.1</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">7.1</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§7.1</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=" ">7.1</tag>Kazhdan sets in locally compact abelian groups</title>
      <para xml:id="S7.SS1.p1">
        <p>Let <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.SS1.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be a second countable LCA group, the dual group of which we denote by <Math mode="inline" tex="\Gamma" text="Gamma" xml:id="S7.SS1.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. If <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma" text="sigma" xml:id="S7.SS1.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a finite Borel measure on <Math mode="inline" tex="\Gamma" text="Gamma" xml:id="S7.SS1.p1.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, recall that its Fourier-Stieljes transform is defined by</p>
        <equation xml:id="S7.Ex97">
          <Math mode="display" tex="\widehat{\sigma}(g)=\int_{\Gamma}\gamma(g)\,d\sigma(\gamma)\quad\textrm{for %&#10;every}\ g\in G." text="formulae@(widehat@(sigma) * g = (integral _ Gamma)@(gamma * g * differential-d@(sigma) * gamma), [for every] * g element-of G)" xml:id="S7.Ex97.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S7.Ex97.m1.4"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMDual xml:id="S7.Ex97.m1.4">
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.Ex97.m1.4.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.Ex97.m1.4.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S7.Ex97.m1.4.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S7.Ex97.m1.1"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.Ex97.m1.1">g</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="integral" name="int" role="INTOP">∫</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="gamma" role="UNKNOWN">γ</XMTok>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S7.Ex97.m1.2"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.Ex97.m1.2">g</XMTok>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" rpadding="1.7pt" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok font="italic" meaning="differential-d" role="DIFFOP">d</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S7.Ex97.m1.3"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" name="gamma" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.Ex97.m1.3">γ</XMTok>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="quad" role="PUNCT"> </XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S7.Ex97.m1.4.2">
                        <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMText rpadding="5.0pt">for every</XMText>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>The spectral theorem for unitary representations of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.SS1.p1.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> acting on a (separable) Hilbert space easily yields the following characterization of Kazhdan subsets of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.SS1.p1.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> in terms of Fourier coefficients of probability measures on <Math mode="inline" tex="\Gamma" text="Gamma" xml:id="S7.SS1.p1.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_proposition" inlist="thm theorem:proposition" labels="LABEL:Proposition_A" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem1">
        <tags>
          <tag>Proposition 7.1</tag>
          <tag role="autoref">7.1</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">7.1</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Proposition 7.1</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Proposition 7.1</text></tag></title>
        <para xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem1.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="Q" text="Q" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem1.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a subset of a second countable LCA group <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem1.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>. The following assertions are equivalent:</text></p>
          <enumerate xml:id="S7.I1">
            <item xml:id="S7.I1.ix23">
              <tags>
                <tag>(1)</tag>
                <tag role="autoref"><text font="italic">item </text></tag>
                <tag role="typerefnum">item (1)</tag>
              </tags>
              <para xml:id="S7.I1.ix23.p1">
                <p><Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S7.I1.ix23.p1.m1">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> is a Kazhdan set in </text><Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.I1.ix23.p1.m2">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic">;</text></p>
              </para>
            </item>
            <item xml:id="S7.I1.ix24">
              <tags>
                <tag>(2)</tag>
                <tag role="autoref"><text font="italic">item </text></tag>
                <tag role="typerefnum">item (2)</tag>
              </tags>
              <para xml:id="S7.I1.ix24.p1">
                <p><text font="italic">there exists </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon&gt;0" text="varepsilon &gt; 0" xml:id="S7.I1.ix24.p1.m1">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                        <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> such that any probability measure </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma" text="sigma" xml:id="S7.I1.ix24.p1.m2">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> on </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\Gamma" text="Gamma" xml:id="S7.I1.ix24.p1.m3">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> with </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\sup_{g\in{Q}}|\widehat{\sigma}(g)-1|&lt;\varepsilon" text="(supremum _ (g element-of Q))@(absolute-value@(widehat@(sigma) * g - 1)) less varepsilon" xml:id="S7.I1.ix24.p1.m4">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                            <XMTok meaning="supremum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="post">sup</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S7.I1.ix24.p1.m4.2"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S7.I1.ix24.p1.m4.2">
                                <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMDual>
                                    <XMRef idref="S7.I1.ix24.p1.m4.1"/>
                                    <XMWrap>
                                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.I1.ix24.p1.m4.1">g</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                    </XMWrap>
                                  </XMDual>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic">
satisfies </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma(\{{1}\})&gt;0" text="sigma * set@(1) &gt; 0" xml:id="S7.I1.ix24.p1.m5">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S7.I1.ix24.p1.m5.2"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMDual xml:id="S7.I1.ix24.p1.m5.2">
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                                  <XMRef idref="S7.I1.ix24.p1.m5.1"/>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMWrap>
                                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.I1.ix24.p1.m5.1">1</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic">, where </text><Math mode="inline" tex="{1}" text="1" xml:id="S7.I1.ix24.p1.m6">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> denotes the trivial character on </text><Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.I1.ix24.p1.m7">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic">.</text></p>
              </para>
            </item>
          </enumerate>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <para xml:id="S7.SS1.p2">
        <p>Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_A"/> is extremely useful to obtain various examples of Kazhdan and non-Kazhdan sets in classic LCA groups such as <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{Z}}^{d}" text="Z ^ d" xml:id="S7.SS1.p2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> or <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{R}}^{d}" text="R ^ d" xml:id="S7.SS1.p2.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. We give here two such examples.</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_example" inlist="thm theorem:example" labels="LABEL:Example_B" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem2">
        <tags>
          <tag>Example 7.2</tag>
          <tag role="autoref">7.2</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">7.2</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Example 7.2</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Example 7.2</text></tag></title>
        <para xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem2.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">The set <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}=\{2^{k}+k\,;\,k\geq 0\}" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem2.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" rpadding="1.7pt">k</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT" rpadding="1.7pt">;</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem2.p1.m1.1">k</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{Z}}" text="Z" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem2.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard upright" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, while the set <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}^{\prime}=\{2^{k}\,;\,k\geq 0\}" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem2.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                    <XMApp rpadding="1.7pt">
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT" rpadding="1.7pt">;</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem2.p1.m3.1">k</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is not a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{Z}}" text="Z" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem2.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard upright" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <ERROR class="undefined">{proof}</ERROR>
      <para xml:id="S7.SS1.p3">
        <p>The sequence <Math mode="inline" tex="(n_{k})_{k\geq 0}" text="n _ k _ (k &gt;= 0)" xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p3.m1.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m1.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> defined by <Math mode="inline" tex="n_{k}=2^{k}+k" text="n _ k = 2 ^ k + k" xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for every <Math mode="inline" tex="k\geq 0" text="k &gt;= 0" xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> satisfies the relation <Math mode="inline" tex="2n_{k}=n_{k+1}+k-1" text="2 * n _ k = (n _ (k + 1) + k) - 1" xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for every
<Math mode="inline" tex="k\geq 0" text="k &gt;= 0" xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. If <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma" text="sigma" xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a probability measure on <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{T}}" text="T" xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="\sup_{k\geq 0}|\widehat{\sigma}(n_{k})-1|&lt;1/3" text="(supremum _ (k &gt;= 0))@(absolute-value@(widehat@(sigma) * n _ k - 1)) less 1 / 3" xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok meaning="supremum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="post">sup</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p3.m8.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m8.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p3.m8.1.1"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m8.1.1">
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="3" role="NUMBER">3</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, it follows from the fact that</p>
        <equation xml:id="S7.Ex98">
          <Math mode="display" tex="|\widehat{\sigma}(k-1)-1|\leq 2|{\widehat{{\sigma}}}(n_{k})-1|+|{\widehat{{%&#10;\sigma}}}(n_{k+1})-1|\quad\textrm{for all}\ k\geq 1" text="formulae@(absolute-value@(widehat@(sigma) * (k - 1) - 1) less= 2 * absolute-value@(widehat@(sigma) * n _ k - 1) + absolute-value@(widehat@(sigma) * n _ (k + 1) - 1), [for all] * k &gt;= 1)" xml:id="S7.Ex98.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>

                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S7.Ex98.m1.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S7.Ex98.m1.1.1"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>

                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>

                          <XMApp>

                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S7.Ex98.m1.1.3"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S7.Ex98.m1.1.3">
                            <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>

                              </XMApp>
                              <XMDual>
                                <XMRef idref="S7.Ex98.m1.1.3.1"/>
                                <XMWrap>
                                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp xml:id="S7.Ex98.m1.1.3.1">
                                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                                    <XMApp>
                                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                                    </XMApp>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
