                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="quad" role="PUNCT"> </XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S7.Ex98.m1.2">
                    <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMText rpadding="5.0pt">for all</XMText>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>that <Math mode="inline" tex="\sup_{k\geq 0}|\widehat{\sigma}(k)-1|&lt;1" text="(supremum _ (k &gt;= 0))@(absolute-value@(widehat@(sigma) * k - 1)) less 1" xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok meaning="supremum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="post">sup</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p3.m9.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m9.2">
                        <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p3.m9.1"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m9.1">k</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Hence <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma(\{1\})&gt;0" text="sigma * set@(1) &gt; 0" xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p3.m10.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMDual xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m10.2">
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p3.m10.1"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                          <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m10.1">1</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, and
<Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}=\{n_{k}\,;\,k\geq 0\}" xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                <XMApp rpadding="1.7pt">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="1.7pt">;</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m11.1">k</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{Z}}" text="Z" xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. The fact that <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}^{\prime}" text="Q ^ prime" xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is not a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{Z}}" text="Z" xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> relies on the observation that <Math mode="inline" tex="2^{k}" text="2 ^ k" xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> divides <Math mode="inline" tex="2^{k+1}" text="2 ^ (k + 1)" xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for every <Math mode="inline" tex="k\geq 0" text="k &gt;= 0" xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m17">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Using the same construction as the one of <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="EG" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Prop. 3.9]</cite>, one can construct for every <Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon&gt;0" text="varepsilon &gt; 0" xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m18">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> a continuous probability measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma" text="sigma" xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m19">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{T}}" text="T" xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m20">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, given as an infinite convolution of two-points Dirac measures, such that</p>
        <equation xml:id="S7.Ex99">
          <Math mode="display" tex="\sup_{k\geq 0}|\widehat{\sigma}(2^{k})-1|&lt;\varepsilon," text="(supremum _ (k &gt;= 0))@(absolute-value@(widehat@(sigma) * 2 ^ k - 1)) less varepsilon" xml:id="S7.Ex99.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S7.Ex99.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S7.Ex99.m1.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                        <XMTok meaning="supremum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="mid">sup</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S7.Ex99.m1.1.1"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S7.Ex99.m1.1.1">
                            <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMDual>
                                <XMRef idref="S7.Ex99.m1.1.1.1"/>
                                <XMWrap>
                                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp xml:id="S7.Ex99.m1.1.1.1">
                                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                    <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>and this proves that <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}^{\prime}" text="Q ^ prime" xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m21">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is not a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{Z}}" text="Z" xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m22">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_remark" inlist="thm theorem:remark" labels="LABEL:rem+" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem3">
        <tags>
          <tag>Remark 7.3</tag>
          <tag role="autoref">7.3</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">7.3</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Remark 7.3</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Remark 7.3</text></tag></title>
        <para xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">The set <Math mode="inline" tex="\{2^{k}+k\,;\,k\geq 0\}" text="set@(list@(2 ^ k + k, k) &gt;= 0)" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m1.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m1.2">
                        <XMTok font="upright" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m1.2.1"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m1.1"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m1.2.1">
                              <XMTok font="upright" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                <XMTok font="upright" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" rpadding="1.7pt">k</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT" rpadding="1.7pt">;</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m1.1">k</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok font="upright" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math> being lacunary, it follows from a result proved independently
by Pollington <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Pol" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> and De Mathan <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="DM" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> that there exists a subset <Math mode="inline" tex="A" text="A" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="[0,1]" text="closed-interval@(0, 1)" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="closed-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m3.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m3.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m3.1">0</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m3.2">1</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math> of Hausdorff measure <Math mode="inline" tex="1" text="1" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> such that for every <Math mode="inline" tex="\theta" text="theta" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok name="theta" role="UNKNOWN">θ</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="A" text="A" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, the set
of all fractional parts of <Math mode="inline" tex="(2^{k}+k)\theta" text="(2 ^ k + k) * theta" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m7">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m7.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m7.1">
                          <XMTok font="upright" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="upright" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok name="theta" role="UNKNOWN">θ</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="k\geq 0" text="k &gt;= 0" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m8">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, is not dense in <Math mode="inline" tex="[0,1]" text="closed-interval@(0, 1)" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m9">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="closed-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m9.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m9.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m9.1">0</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m9.2">1</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math>. One of these numbers <Math mode="inline" tex="\theta" text="theta" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m10">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok name="theta" role="UNKNOWN">θ</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is irrational, and <Math mode="inline" tex="((2^{k}+k)\theta)_{k\geq 0}" text="((2 ^ k + k) * theta) _ (k &gt;= 0)" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m11">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m11.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m11.1">
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m11.1.1"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m11.1.1">
                                <XMTok font="upright" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMTok name="theta" role="UNKNOWN">θ</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is of course not uniformly distributed modulo <Math mode="inline" tex="1" text="1" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem3.p1.m12">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <para xml:id="S7.SS1.p4">
        <p>As a consequence of
Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_2"/> and of the spectral theorem for unitary representations of the group, we obtain the following characterization of Kazhdan sets which generate the group
in any second countable LCA group.</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_theorem" inlist="thm theorem:theorem" labels="LABEL:nimporte" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem4">
        <tags>
          <tag>Theorem 7.4</tag>
          <tag role="autoref">Theorem 7.4</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">7.4</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Theorem 7.4</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Theorem 7.4</text></tag></title>
        <para xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem4.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem4.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a second countable LCA group, and let <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem4.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> a subset of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem4.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> which generates <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem4.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>. The following assertions are equivalent:</text></p>
          <enumerate xml:id="S7.I2">
            <item xml:id="S7.I2.ix25">
              <tags>
                <tag>(1)</tag>
                <tag role="autoref"><text font="italic">item </text></tag>
                <tag role="typerefnum">item (1)</tag>
              </tags>
              <para xml:id="S7.I2.ix25.p1">
                <p><Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S7.I2.ix25.p1.m1">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> is a Kazhdan set in </text><Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.I2.ix25.p1.m2">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic">;</text></p>
              </para>
            </item>
            <item xml:id="S7.I2.ix26">
              <tags>
                <tag>(2)</tag>
                <tag role="autoref"><text font="italic">item </text></tag>
                <tag role="typerefnum">item (2)</tag>
              </tags>
              <para xml:id="S7.I2.ix26.p1">
                <p><text font="italic">there exists </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\delta\in(0,1)" text="delta element-of open-interval@(0, 1)" xml:id="S7.I2.ix26.p1.m1">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S7.I2.ix26.p1.m1.1"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S7.I2.ix26.p1.m1.2"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.I2.ix26.p1.m1.1">0</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                            <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.I2.ix26.p1.m1.2">1</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> such that any probability measure </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma" text="sigma" xml:id="S7.I2.ix26.p1.m2">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> on </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\Gamma" text="Gamma" xml:id="S7.I2.ix26.p1.m3">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> with </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\inf_{g\in{Q}}|\widehat{\sigma}(g)|&gt;\delta" text="(infimum _ (g element-of Q))@(absolute-value@(widehat@(sigma) * g)) &gt; delta" xml:id="S7.I2.ix26.p1.m4">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                            <XMTok meaning="infimum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="post">inf</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S7.I2.ix26.p1.m4.2"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S7.I2.ix26.p1.m4.2">
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMRef idref="S7.I2.ix26.p1.m4.1"/>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.I2.ix26.p1.m4.1">g</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic">
</text><!--  %**** String Line 2050 **** --><text font="italic">has a discrete part;</text></p>
              </para>
            </item>
            <item xml:id="S7.I2.ix27">
              <tags>
                <tag>(3)</tag>
                <tag role="autoref"><text font="italic">item </text></tag>
                <tag role="typerefnum">item (3)</tag>
              </tags>
              <para xml:id="S7.I2.ix27.p1">
                <p><text font="italic">there exists </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon&gt;0" text="varepsilon &gt; 0" xml:id="S7.I2.ix27.p1.m1">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                        <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> such that any probability measure </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma" text="sigma" xml:id="S7.I2.ix27.p1.m2">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> on </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\Gamma" text="Gamma" xml:id="S7.I2.ix27.p1.m3">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> with </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\sup_{g\in{Q}}|\widehat{\sigma}(g)-1|&lt;\varepsilon" text="(supremum _ (g element-of Q))@(absolute-value@(widehat@(sigma) * g - 1)) less varepsilon" xml:id="S7.I2.ix27.p1.m4">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                            <XMTok meaning="supremum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="post">sup</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S7.I2.ix27.p1.m4.2"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S7.I2.ix27.p1.m4.2">
                                <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMDual>
                                    <XMRef idref="S7.I2.ix27.p1.m4.1"/>
                                    <XMWrap>
                                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.I2.ix27.p1.m4.1">g</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                    </XMWrap>
                                  </XMDual>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic">
has a discrete part.</text></p>
              </para>
            </item>
          </enumerate>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <para xml:id="S7.SS1.p5">
        <p>It is worth stating explicitly the corresponding
characterization of non-Kazhdan subsets of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>: <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is not a Kazhdan subset of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> if and only if
there exists for every <Math mode="inline" tex="\delta\in(0,1)" text="delta element-of open-interval@(0, 1)" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p5.m4.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p5.m4.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m4.1">0</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m4.2">1</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> a continuous probability measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma" text="sigma" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="\Gamma" text="Gamma" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="\inf_{g\in{Q}}|\widehat{\sigma}(g)|&gt;\delta" text="(infimum _ (g element-of Q))@(absolute-value@(widehat@(sigma) * g)) &gt; delta" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok meaning="infimum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="post">inf</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p5.m7.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m7.2">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p5.m7.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m7.1">g</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, or, equivalently, if and only
if there exists for every <Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon&gt;0" text="varepsilon &gt; 0" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> a continuous probability measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma" text="sigma" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="\Gamma" text="Gamma" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="\sup_{g\in{Q}}|\widehat{\sigma}(g)-1|&lt;\varepsilon" text="(supremum _ (g element-of Q))@(absolute-value@(widehat@(sigma) * g - 1)) less varepsilon" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok meaning="supremum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="post">sup</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p5.m11.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m11.2">
                        <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p5.m11.1"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m11.1">g</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. If the group <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is discrete, Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Corollary_100"/> combined with the spectral theorem for unitary representations again
implies that a subset <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> if and only if <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> generates <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m17">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and either assertion <Math mode="inline" tex="(2)" text="2" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m18">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p5.m18.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m18.1">2</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> or <Math mode="inline" tex="(3)" text="3" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m19">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p5.m19.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="3" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m19.1">3</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:nimporte"/> holds true.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S7.SS1.p6">
        <p>Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:nimporte"/> becomes particularly meaningful in the case of the group <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{Z}}" text="Z" xml:id="S7.SS1.p6.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, as it yields a characterization of Kazhdan subsets of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{Z}}" text="Z" xml:id="S7.SS1.p6.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> involving some classic sets in harmonic analysis, introduced by Kaufman in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Ka1" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>. They are called <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">w-sets</text> by Kaufman <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Ka2" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, and <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">Kaufman sets</text> (<text font="bold">Ka</text> sets) by other authors, such as Hartman <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Ha1" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Ha2" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>.</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_definition" inlist="thm theorem:definition" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5">
        <tags>
          <tag>Definition 7.5</tag>
          <tag role="autoref">7.5</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">7.5</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Definition 7.5</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Definition 7.5</text></tag></title>
        <para xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a subset of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{Z}}" text="Z" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard upright" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, and let <Math mode="inline" tex="\delta\in(0,1)" text="delta element-of open-interval@(0, 1)" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S7.Thmtheorem5.p1.m3.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S7.Thmtheorem5.p1.m3.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p1.m3.1">0</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p1.m3.2">1</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.</text></p>
        </para>
        <para xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p2">
          <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\bullet" text="bullet" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p2.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok name="bullet" role="MULOP">∙</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math><text font="italic"> We say that <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p2.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> belongs to the class <text font="bold">Ka</text> if there exists a finite complex-valued continuous Borel measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p2.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{T}}" text="T" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p2.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard upright" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="\inf_{n\in{Q}}|\hat{\mu}(n)|&gt;0" text="(infimum _ (n element-of Q))@(absolute-value@(hat@(mu) * n)) &gt; 0" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p2.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="upright" meaning="infimum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="post">inf</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S7.Thmtheorem5.p2.m5.2"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p2.m5.2">
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok font="upright" name="hat" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">^</XMTok>
                              <XMTok name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S7.Thmtheorem5.p2.m5.1"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p2.m5.1">n</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, and to the class <Math mode="inline" tex="\delta" text="delta" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p2.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math><text font="bold">-Ka</text> if there exists a finite complex-valued continuous Borel measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p2.m7">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{T}}" text="T" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p2.m8">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard upright" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> with <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu({\mathbb{T}})=1" text="mu * T = 1" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p2.m9">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S7.Thmtheorem5.p2.m9.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="blackboard upright" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p2.m9.1">T</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="\inf_{n\in{Q}}|\hat{\mu}(n)|&gt;\delta" text="(infimum _ (n element-of Q))@(absolute-value@(hat@(mu) * n)) &gt; delta" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p2.m10">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="upright" meaning="infimum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="post">inf</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S7.Thmtheorem5.p2.m10.2"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p2.m10.2">
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok font="upright" name="hat" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">^</XMTok>
                              <XMTok name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S7.Thmtheorem5.p2.m10.1"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p2.m10.1">n</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.</text></p>
        </para>
        <para xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p3">
          <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\bullet" text="bullet" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p3.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok name="bullet" role="MULOP">∙</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math><text font="italic"> We say that <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p3.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> belongs to the class <text font="bold">Ka<Math mode="inline" tex="{}^{+}" text="^+" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p3.m3">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp role="FLOATSUPERSCRIPT" scriptpos="3">
                      <XMTok font="medium upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math></text> if there exists a continuous probability measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma" text="sigma" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p3.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{T}}" text="T" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p3.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard upright" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="\inf_{n\in{Q}}|\hat{\sigma}(n)|&gt;0" text="(infimum _ (n element-of Q))@(absolute-value@(hat@(sigma) * n)) &gt; 0" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p3.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="upright" meaning="infimum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="post">inf</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S7.Thmtheorem5.p3.m6.2"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p3.m6.2">
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok font="upright" name="hat" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">^</XMTok>
                              <XMTok name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S7.Thmtheorem5.p3.m6.1"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p3.m6.1">n</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, and to the class <Math mode="inline" tex="\delta" text="delta" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p3.m7">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math><text font="bold">-Ka<Math mode="inline" tex="{}^{+}" text="^+" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p3.m8">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp role="FLOATSUPERSCRIPT" scriptpos="4">
                      <XMTok font="medium upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math></text> if there exists a continuous probability measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma" text="sigma" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p3.m9">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{T}}" text="T" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p3.m10">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard upright" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="\inf_{n\in{Q}}|\hat{\sigma}(n)|&gt;\delta" text="(infimum _ (n element-of Q))@(absolute-value@(hat@(sigma) * n)) &gt; delta" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p3.m11">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="upright" meaning="infimum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="post">inf</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S7.Thmtheorem5.p3.m11.2"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p3.m11.2">
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok font="upright" name="hat" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">^</XMTok>
                              <XMTok name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S7.Thmtheorem5.p3.m11.1"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem5.p3.m11.1">n</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <para xml:id="S7.SS1.p7">
        <p>Our final characterization of Kazhdan subsets of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{Z}}" text="Z" xml:id="S7.SS1.p7.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is given by Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:nimportebis"/> below:</p>
      </para>

        <para xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem6.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem6.p1.m1">

                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>

                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard upright" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>

                <p><Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S7.I3.ix29.p1.m1">

                    <XMath>

                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="bold italic">-Ka<Math mode="inline" tex="{}^{+}" text="^+" xml:id="S7.I3.ix29.p1.m6">
                      <XMath>

                    </Math></text><text font="italic">.</text></p>
              </para>

          </enumerate>
        </para>
        <para xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem6.p2">
          <p><text font="italic">In particular, if <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem6.p2.m1">

      </theorem>
      <para xml:id="S7.SS1.p8">
        <p>It is interesting to remark <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Ha2" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> that a set <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S7.SS1.p8.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> belongs to <text font="bold">Ka</text> if and only if it belongs to <Math mode="inline" tex="\delta" text="delta" xml:id="S7.SS1.p8.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math><text font="bold">-Ka</text> for every <Math mode="inline" tex="\delta\in(0,1)" text="delta element-of open-interval@(0, 1)" xml:id="S7.SS1.p8.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p8.m3.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p8.m3.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.SS1.p8.m3.1">0</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.SS1.p8.m3.2">1</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. There is no similar statement for the class <text font="bold">Ka<Math mode="inline" tex="{}^{+}" text="^+" xml:id="S7.SS1.p8.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp role="FLOATSUPERSCRIPT" scriptpos="2">
                  <XMTok font="medium" fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math></text>: any sufficiently lacunary subset of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{Z}}" text="Z" xml:id="S7.SS1.p8.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, such as <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}=\{3^{k}+k\;;\;k\geq 1\}" xml:id="S7.SS1.p8.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok meaning="3" role="NUMBER">3</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" rpadding="2.8pt">k</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="2.8pt">;</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS1.p8.m6.1">k</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, is easily seen to belong to <text font="bold">Ka<Math mode="inline" tex="{}^{+}" text="^+" xml:id="S7.SS1.p8.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp role="FLOATSUPERSCRIPT" scriptpos="2">
                  <XMTok font="medium" fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math></text>;
but the same reasoning as in Example <ref labelref="LABEL:Example_B"/> above shows that this set <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S7.SS1.p8.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a Kazhdan subset of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{Z}}" text="Z" xml:id="S7.SS1.p8.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Thus there exists by Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:nimportebis"/> a <Math mode="inline" tex="\delta\in(0,1)" text="delta element-of open-interval@(0, 1)" xml:id="S7.SS1.p8.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p8.m10.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p8.m10.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.SS1.p8.m10.1">0</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.SS1.p8.m10.2">1</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S7.SS1.p8.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
does not belong to <Math mode="inline" tex="\delta" text="delta" xml:id="S7.SS1.p8.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math><text font="bold">-Ka<Math mode="inline" tex="{}^{+}" text="^+" xml:id="S7.SS1.p8.m13">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp role="FLOATSUPERSCRIPT" scriptpos="3">
                  <XMTok font="medium" fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math></text>.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S7.SS1.p9">
        <p>Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_4"/> is another powerful tool for exhibiting Kazhdan sets in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{Z}}^{d}" text="Z ^ d" xml:id="S7.SS1.p9.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> or <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{R}}^{d}" text="R ^ d" xml:id="S7.SS1.p9.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Here are typical examples of Kazhdan sets in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{Z}}" text="Z" xml:id="S7.SS1.p9.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> or <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{R}}" text="R" xml:id="S7.SS1.p9.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> obtained in this way.</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_example" inlist="thm theorem:example" labels="LABEL:Example_C" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem7">
        <tags>
          <tag>Example 7.7</tag>
          <tag role="autoref">7.7</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">7.7</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Example 7.7</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Example 7.7</text></tag></title>
        <para xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem7.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">If <Math mode="inline" tex="p" text="p" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem7.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is a non-constant polynomial with integer coefficients such that <Math mode="inline" tex="p({\mathbb{Z}})" text="p * Z" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem7.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.Thmtheorem7.p1.m2.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="blackboard upright" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem7.p1.m2.1">Z</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is included in <Math mode="inline" tex="a{\mathbb{Z}}" text="a * Z" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem7.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="blackboard upright" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> for no integer <Math mode="inline" tex="a\in{\mathbb{Z}}" text="a element-of Z" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem7.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="blackboard upright" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, then <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}=\{p(k)\,;\,k\geq 0\}" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem7.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem7.p1.m5.1">k</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" rpadding="1.7pt" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT" rpadding="1.7pt">;</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem7.p1.m5.2">k</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{Z}}" text="Z" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem7.p1.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard upright" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.</text></p>

      </theorem>

            </XMath>

      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_example" inlist="thm theorem:example" labels="LABEL:Example_8.5" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem8">
        <tags>
          <tag>Example 7.8</tag>
