              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>(<ref labelref="LABEL:Equation_21"/>) implies that <Math mode="inline" tex="{\displaystyle}\sup_{\{(a,b)\,;\,\ln a\in{Q}_{0}\}}\,||\rho(a,b)\mathbbm{1}-%&#10;\mathbbm{1}||&lt;\varepsilon" text="(supremum _ [{(a,b);lna∈Q0}])@(norm@(rho * open-interval@(a, b) * 1 - 1)) less varepsilon" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp rpadding="1.7pt">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok meaning="supremum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="post">sup</XMTok>
                    <XMArg rule="Subscript">
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m15.1">a</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m15.2">b</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" rpadding="1.7pt" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT" rpadding="1.7pt">;</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="natural-logarithm" role="OPFUNCTION">ln</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMArg>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m15.5"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN">||</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m15.5">
                        <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="rho" role="UNKNOWN">ρ</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m15.3"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m15.4"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m15.3">a</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m15.4">b</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMTok font="blackboard" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="blackboard" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE">||</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, i. e. <Math mode="inline" tex="{\displaystyle}\sup_{(a,b)\in{Q}}\,||\rho(a,b)\mathbbm{1}-\mathbbm{1}||&lt;\varepsilon" text="(supremum _ (open-interval@(a, b) element-of Q))@(norm@(rho * open-interval@(a, b) * 1 - 1)) less varepsilon" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp rpadding="1.7pt">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok meaning="supremum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="post">sup</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m16.1"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m16.2"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m16.1">a</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m16.2">b</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m16.5"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN">||</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m16.5">
                        <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="rho" role="UNKNOWN">ρ</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m16.3"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m16.4"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m16.3">a</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m16.4">b</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMTok font="blackboard" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="blackboard" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE">||</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Hence <Math mode="inline" tex="\rho" text="rho" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m17">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="rho" role="UNKNOWN">ρ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> admits a non-zero <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m18">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-invariant function <Math mode="inline" tex="f\in L^{2}({\mathbb{R}},\sigma)" text="f element-of L ^ 2 * open-interval@(R, sigma)" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m19">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m19.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m19.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m19.1">R</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m19.2">σ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, and the same argument as in the proof of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_F"/> shows then that <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma(\{0\})&gt;0" text="sigma * set@(0) &gt; 0" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m20">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m20.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMDual xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m20.2">
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m20.1"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                          <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m20.1">0</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. The converse implication
<Math mode="inline" tex="(2)\Longrightarrow(1)" text="2 Longrightarrow 1" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m21">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="Longrightarrow" role="ARROW">⟹</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m21.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m21.1">2</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m21.2"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m21.2">1</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is proved in exactly the same way as in Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_F"/>, using the same modifications as those outlined above.
The group <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{R}}^{2n}" text="R ^ (2 * n)" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m22">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> has to be replaced by the multiplicative group <Math mode="inline" tex="((0,+\infty),\times)" text="open-interval@(open-interval@(0, + infinity), *)" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m23">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m23.3"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m23.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMDual xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m23.3">
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m23.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m23.3.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m23.1">0</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m23.3.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                        <XMTok meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m23.2">×</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and the analogue of Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:Lemma_G"/> is that Kazhdan subsets of this group contain elements of arbitrarily large absolute value. If <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}_{0}" text="Q _ 0" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m24">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{R}}" text="R" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m25">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, with Kazhdan constant <Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon" text="varepsilon" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m26">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> small enough, the same argument as in the proof of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_F"/> (involving the same notation) shows that it suffices to prove the following statement: let <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m27">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be a finite Borel measure on a Borel space <Math mode="inline" tex="Z" text="Z" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m28">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="x=(x_{z})_{z\in Z}" text="x = x _ z _ (z element-of Z)" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m29">

              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> a scalar-valued function of <Math mode="inline" tex="L^{2}(Z,\mu)" text="L ^ 2 * open-interval@(Z, mu)" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m30">

        <equation xml:id="S7.Ex124">
          <Math mode="display" tex="\sup_{(a,b)\in{Q}}\bigl{|}1-{{\langle{\pi(a,b)x},{x}\rangle}}\bigr{|}=\sup_{\{%&#10;a\,;\,\ln a\,\in\,{Q}_{0}\}}\Bigl{|}1-\int_{Z}e^{i(\ln a)\lambda_{z}}|x_{z}|^{%&#10;2}d\mu(z)\Bigr{|}&lt;\varepsilon." text="(supremum _ (open-interval@(a, b) element-of Q))@(absolute-value@(1 - list@(pi * open-interval@(a, b) * x, x))) = (supremum _ [{a;lna∈Q0}])@(absolute-value@(1 - (integral _ Z)@(e ^ (i * natural-logarithm@(a) * lambda _ z) * (absolute-value@(x _ z)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(mu) * z))) less varepsilon" xml:id="S7.Ex124.m1">

        <p>Then the set <Math mode="inline" tex="Z_{0}=\{z\in Z\,;\,\lambda_{z}=0\}" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m35">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" rpadding="1.7pt">Z</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="1.7pt">;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMath>
          </Math> satisfies <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu(Z_{0})&gt;0" text="mu * Z _ 0 &gt; 0" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m36">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m36.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m36.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. The proof of this statement uses the same argument as the one employed in the proof of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_F"/>. It involves the representation <Math mode="inline" tex="\rho" text="rho" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m37">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="rho" role="UNKNOWN">ρ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of the group <Math mode="inline" tex="((0,+\infty),\times)" text="open-interval@(open-interval@(0, + infinity), *)" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m38">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m38.3"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m38.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMDual xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m38.3">
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m38.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m38.3.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m38.1">0</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m38.3.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                        <XMTok meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m38.2">×</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="L^{2}(Z,\mu)" text="L ^ 2 * open-interval@(Z, mu)" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m39">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m39.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m39.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m39.1">Z</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m39.2">μ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> defined by
<Math mode="inline" tex="\smash{\xymatrix{\rho(a)f:z\ar@{|-&gt;}[r]&amp;e^{i(\ln a)\lambda_{z}}f_{z}}}" text="[\xymatrix] * rho * a * f colon z * [\ar] * @ * ket@(-) * delimited-[]@(r) * &amp; * e ^ (i * natural-logarithm@(a) * lambda _ z) * f _ z" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m40">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <ERROR class="undefined">\xymatrix</ERROR>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="rho" role="UNKNOWN">ρ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m40.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m40.2">a</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                  <ERROR class="undefined">\ar</ERROR>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">@</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="ket"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m40.3"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m40.3">-</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="CLOSE">&gt;</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="delimited-[]"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m40.4"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m40.4">r</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">&amp;</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m40.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m40.1">
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="natural-logarithm" role="OPFUNCTION">ln</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for every <Math mode="inline" tex="a&gt;0" text="a &gt; 0" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m41">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and every <Math mode="inline" tex="(f_{z})_{z\in Z}\in L^{2}(Z,\mu)" text="f _ z _ (z element-of Z) element-of L ^ 2 * open-interval@(Z, mu)" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m42">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m42.3"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m42.3">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m42.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m42.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m42.1">Z</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m42.2">μ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, and uses the obvious fact that since <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}_{0}" text="Q _ 0" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m43">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{R}}" text="R" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m44">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\{a\,;\,\ln a\,\in\,{Q}_{0}\}" text="set@(list@(a, natural-logarithm@(a)) element-of Q _ 0)" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m45">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m45.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m45.2">
                    <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP" rpadding="1.7pt">∈</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m45.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m45.2.1"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" rpadding="1.7pt" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m45.1">a</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="1.7pt">;</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m45.2.1">
                          <XMTok meaning="natural-logarithm" role="OPFUNCTION">ln</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" rpadding="1.7pt">a</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="((0,+\infty),\times)" text="open-interval@(open-interval@(0, + infinity), *)" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m46">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m46.3"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m46.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMDual xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m46.3">
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m46.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p4.m46.3.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m46.1">0</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m46.3.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                        <XMTok meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP" xml:id="S7.SS3.p4.m46.2">×</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S7.SS3.p5">
        <p>Facts <ref labelref="LABEL:Fact_E"/> and <ref labelref="LABEL:Fact_M"/> have played a crucial role in the proofs of Theorems <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_F"/> and <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_N"/> respectively, as they allowed us to discard all irreducible representations except the one-dimensional inequalities of the form (<ref labelref="LABEL:Eq17"/>). There are locally compact groups in which all non-trivial irreducible representations have the vanishing property of the matrix coefficients stated in Facts <ref labelref="LABEL:Fact_E"/> or <ref labelref="LABEL:Fact_M"/>: these groups are said to have the Howe-Moore property. The study of Kazhdan sets becomes easier in such groups, and it is even possible to characterize Kazhdan sets in groups which do not have Property (T), but have the Howe-Moore property, such as <Math mode="inline" tex="SL_{2}({\mathbb{R}})" text="S * L _ 2 * R" xml:id="S7.SS3.p5.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.SS3.p5.m1.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS3.p5.m1.1">R</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. This is the object of the next section.</p>
      </para>
    </subsection>
    <subsection inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:Subsection_8.3" xml:id="S7.SS4">
      <tags>
        <tag>7.4</tag>
        <tag role="autoref">subsection 7.4</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">7.4</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§7.4</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=" ">7.4</tag>Kazhdan sets in groups with the Howe-Moore property</title>
      <para xml:id="S7.SS4.p1">
        <p>The Howe-Moore property was introduced by Howe and Moore in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="HM" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>: a locally compact group <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.SS4.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> has the <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">Howe-Moore property</text> if whenever <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S7.SS4.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a unitary representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.SS4.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on a Hilbert space <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S7.SS4.p1.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, the following alternative holds true:</p>
        <enumerate xml:id="S7.I6">
          <item xml:id="S7.I6.ix34">
            <tags>
              <tag>–</tag>
              <tag role="autoref">item </tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">item –</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S7.I6.ix34.p1">
              <p>either <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S7.I6.ix34.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> has a non-zero <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.I6.ix34.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>-invariant vector;</p>
            </para>
          </item>
          <item xml:id="S7.I6.ix35">
            <tags>
              <tag>–</tag>
              <tag role="autoref">item </tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">item –</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S7.I6.ix35.p1">
              <p>or whenever <Math mode="inline" tex="x" text="x" xml:id="S7.I6.ix35.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="y" text="y" xml:id="S7.I6.ix35.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> are two vectors of <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S7.I6.ix35.p1.m3">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>, the matrix coefficient <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\langle{\pi(g)x},{y}\rangle}}" text="list@(pi * g * x, y)" xml:id="S7.I6.ix35.p1.m4">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S7.I6.ix35.p1.m4.3"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S7.I6.ix35.p1.m4.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S7.I6.ix35.p1.m4.3">
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S7.I6.ix35.p1.m4.1"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.I6.ix35.p1.m4.1">g</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.I6.ix35.p1.m4.2">y</XMTok>
                        <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> vanishes at infinity in the sense that for any <Math mode="inline" tex="\delta&gt;0" text="delta &gt; 0" xml:id="S7.I6.ix35.p1.m5">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>, the set
<Math mode="inline" tex="\{g\in G\,;\,\bigl{|}{{\langle{\pi(g)x},{y}\rangle}}\bigr{|}\geq\delta\}" text="set@(formulae@(g element-of G, absolute-value@(list@(pi * g * x, y)) &gt;= delta))" xml:id="S7.I6.ix35.p1.m6">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S7.I6.ix35.p1.m6.3"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                        <XMDual xml:id="S7.I6.ix35.p1.m6.3">
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S7.I6.ix35.p1.m6.3.1"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S7.I6.ix35.p1.m6.3.2"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S7.I6.ix35.p1.m6.3.1">
                              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" rpadding="1.7pt">G</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="1.7pt">;</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S7.I6.ix35.p1.m6.3.2">
                              <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                              <XMDual>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                                  <XMRef idref="S7.I6.ix35.p1.m6.3.2.1"/>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMWrap>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="120%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                                  <XMDual xml:id="S7.I6.ix35.p1.m6.3.2.1">
                                    <XMApp>
                                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                                      <XMRef idref="S7.I6.ix35.p1.m6.3.2.1.1"/>
                                      <XMRef idref="S7.I6.ix35.p1.m6.2"/>
                                    </XMApp>
                                    <XMWrap>
                                      <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                                      <XMApp xml:id="S7.I6.ix35.p1.m6.3.2.1.1">
                                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                        <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                                        <XMDual>
                                          <XMRef idref="S7.I6.ix35.p1.m6.1"/>
                                          <XMWrap>
                                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.I6.ix35.p1.m6.1">g</XMTok>
                                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                          </XMWrap>
                                        </XMDual>
                                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                                      </XMApp>
                                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.I6.ix35.p1.m6.2">y</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                                    </XMWrap>
                                  </XMDual>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="120%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>
                              <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> is compact in <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.I6.ix35.p1.m7">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>.</p>
            </para>
          </item>
        </enumerate>
<!--  %**** String Line 2350 **** -->        <p>It was proved in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="HM" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> and <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Z" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> that connected, non-compact, simple real Lie groups with finite center have the Howe-Moore property. We refer the reader to the references <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BM" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="C" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, and <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="CdHC" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> for more on this topic. If the group <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.SS4.p1.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is locally compact and second countable, it follows from the decomposition of unitary representations as direct integrals of irreducible representations that <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.SS4.p1.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> has the Howe-Moore property if and only if all matrix coefficients of non-trivial irreducible representations vanish at infinity.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S7.SS4.p2">
        <p>The following proposition states that all subsets with non-compact closure are Kazhdan sets in groups with the Howe-Moore property. This testifies of the rigidity of the structure of such groups, and stands in sharp contrast with all the examples we have presented until now.</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_proposition" inlist="thm theorem:proposition" labels="LABEL:Proposition_H" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem16">
        <tags>
          <tag>Proposition 7.16</tag>
          <tag role="autoref">7.16</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">7.16</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Proposition 7.16</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Proposition 7.16</text></tag></title>
        <para xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem16.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem16.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a locally compact group with the Howe-Moore property, and let <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem16.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a subset of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem16.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>. If the closure <Math mode="inline" tex="{\overline{Q}}" text="overline@(Q)" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem16.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem16.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem16.p1.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is non-compact, <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem16.p1.m7">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem16.p1.m8">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <ERROR class="undefined">{proof}</ERROR>
      <para xml:id="S7.SS4.p3">
        <p>Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon\in(0,2)" text="varepsilon element-of open-interval@(0, 2)" xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.SS4.p3.m1.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.SS4.p3.m1.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m1.1">0</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m1.2">2</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, and let <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be a representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on a Hilbert space <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> which admits a <Math mode="inline" tex="({Q},\varepsilon)" text="open-interval@(Q, varepsilon)" xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.SS4.p3.m5.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.SS4.p3.m5.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m5.1">Q</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m5.2">ε</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-invariant vector <Math mode="inline" tex="x\in H" text="x element-of H" xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, which we suppose to be of norm <Math mode="inline" tex="1" text="1" xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Then</p>

        <p>Suppose that <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> has no non-zero <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-invariant vector. Since <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> has the Howe-Moore property, and <Math mode="inline" tex="1-\varepsilon/2&gt;0" text="1 - varepsilon / 2 &gt; 0" xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, the set <Math mode="inline" tex="\{g\in\ G\,;\,\bigl{|}{{\langle{\pi(g)x},{x}\rangle}}\bigr{|}\geq 1-%&#10;\varepsilon/2\}" text="set@(formulae@(g element-of G, absolute-value@(list@(pi * g * x, x)) &gt;= 1 - varepsilon / 2))" xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.SS4.p3.m12.3"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                  <XMDual xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m12.3">
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.SS4.p3.m12.3.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.SS4.p3.m12.3.2"/>

                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m12.3.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP" rpadding="5.0pt">∈</XMTok>

                      <XMApp xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m12.3.2">
                        <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S7.SS4.p3.m12.3.2.1"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok fontsize="120%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
