                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is compact. It contains <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, hence <Math mode="inline" tex="{\overline{Q}}" text="overline@(Q)" xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, so <Math mode="inline" tex="{\overline{Q}}" text="overline@(Q)" xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is compact. It follows that if <Math mode="inline" tex="{\overline{Q}}" text="overline@(Q)" xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is not compact, <Math mode="inline" tex="({Q},\varepsilon)" text="open-interval@(Q, varepsilon)" xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m17">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.SS4.p3.m17.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.SS4.p3.m17.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m17.1">Q</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m17.2">ε</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a Kazhdan pair in <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m18">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for any <Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon\in(0,2)" text="varepsilon element-of open-interval@(0, 2)" xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m19">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.SS4.p3.m19.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.SS4.p3.m19.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m19.1">0</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.SS4.p3.m19.2">2</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.

As a direct consequence of Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_H"/>, we obtain the following characterization of Kazhdan sets in groups without Property (T), but which have the Howe-Moore property.</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_theorem" inlist="thm theorem:theorem" labels="LABEL:Proposition_I" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem17">
        <tags>
          <tag>Theorem 7.17</tag>
          <tag role="autoref">Theorem 7.17</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">7.17</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Theorem 7.17</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Theorem 7.17</text></tag></title>
        <para xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem17.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem17.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a locally compact group with the Howe-Moore property, but without Property (T). A subset <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem17.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem17.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem17.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> if and only if <Math mode="inline" tex="{\overline{Q}}" text="overline@(Q)" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem17.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is not compact.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <ERROR class="undefined">{proof}</ERROR>
      <para xml:id="S7.SS4.p4">
        <p>We only have to prove that if <Math mode="inline" tex="{\overline{Q}}" text="overline@(Q)" xml:id="S7.SS4.p4.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is compact, <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S7.SS4.p4.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is not a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.SS4.p4.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. This follows directly from the observation that since unitary representations are strongly continuous, <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S7.SS4.p4.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.SS4.p4.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> as soon as <Math mode="inline" tex="{\overline{Q}}" text="overline@(Q)" xml:id="S7.SS4.p4.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.SS4.p4.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Since <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.SS4.p4.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> does not have Property (T), it admits no compact Kazhdan set, and hence a set with compact closure is not a Kazhdan set.

As <Math mode="inline" tex="SL_{2}({\mathbb{R}})" text="S * L _ 2 * R" xml:id="S7.SS4.p4.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.SS4.p4.m9.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS4.p4.m9.1">R</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a non-compact connected simple real Lie group with finite center, it has the Howe-Moore property. But it does not have Property (T), and so we have:</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_example" inlist="thm theorem:example" labels="LABEL:Example_J" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem18">
        <tags>
          <tag>Example 7.18</tag>
          <tag role="autoref">7.18</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">7.18</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Example 7.18</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Example 7.18</text></tag></title>
        <para xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem18.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">The Kazhdan sets in <Math mode="inline" tex="SL_{2}({\mathbb{R}})" text="S * L _ 2 * R" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem18.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.Thmtheorem18.p1.m1.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="blackboard upright" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem18.p1.m1.1">R</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> are exactly the subsets of <Math mode="inline" tex="SL_{2}({\mathbb{R}})" text="S * L _ 2 * R" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem18.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.Thmtheorem18.p1.m2.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="blackboard upright" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.Thmtheorem18.p1.m2.1">R</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> with non-compact closure.
<!--  %**** String Line 2375 **** --></text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
    </subsection>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:Section_8" xml:id="S8">
    <tags>
      <tag>8</tag>
      <tag role="autoref">section 8</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">8</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">§8</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=" ">8</tag>Further applications of Kazhdan sets</title>
    <subsection inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:sect:rapinchuk" xml:id="S8.SS1">
      <tags>
        <tag>8.1</tag>
        <tag role="autoref">subsection 8.1</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">8.1</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§8.1</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=" ">8.1</tag>Kazhdan sets and local rigidity</title>
      <para xml:id="S8.SS1.p1">
        <p>It was proved by Rapinchuk <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="rapin" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> that finite dimensional
unitary representations of a discrete group <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.SS1.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> with Property (T) are <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">locally rigid</text> in the following
sense: let <Math mode="inline" tex="S" text="S" xml:id="S8.SS1.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be a finite set of generators of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.SS1.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> (recall that discrete groups with Property (T) are finitely generated, and that the Kazhdan subsets of such groups are the generating sets), and let <Math mode="inline" tex="d\geq 1" text="d &gt;= 1" xml:id="S8.SS1.p1.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be an integer. If two <Math mode="inline" tex="d" text="d" xml:id="S8.SS1.p1.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-dimensional unitary representations of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.SS1.p1.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> are sufficiently close
on <Math mode="inline" tex="S" text="S" xml:id="S8.SS1.p1.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, they are unitarily equivalent.
A generalization of this result is given in the next theorem, following an idea from <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BOTulam" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>.</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_theorem" inlist="thm theorem:theorem" labels="LABEL:thm:rapinchuk" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem1">
        <tags>
          <tag>Theorem 8.1</tag>
          <tag role="autoref">Theorem 8.1</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">8.1</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Theorem 8.1</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Theorem 8.1</text></tag></title>
        <para xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a topological group, and let <Math mode="inline" tex="({Q},\varepsilon)" text="open-interval@(Q, varepsilon)" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m2.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m2.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m2.1">Q</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m2.2">ε</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a Kazhdan pair for <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>. Let <Math mode="inline" tex="d\geq 1" text="d &gt;= 1" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be an integer.
For every <Math mode="inline" tex="\alpha&gt;0" text="alpha &gt; 0" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, there exists <Math mode="inline" tex="\beta&gt;0" text="beta &gt; 0" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="beta" role="UNKNOWN">β</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> such that
the following property holds true: for
all unitary representations <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{1}" text="pi _ 1" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m7">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{2}" text="pi _ 2" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m8">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m9">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> into a <Math mode="inline" tex="d" text="d" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m10">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>-dimensional Hilbert space <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m11">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> with</text></p>
          <equation xml:id="S8.Ex126">
            <Math mode="display" tex="\sup_{g\in Q}\|\pi_{1}(g)-\pi_{2}(g)\|&lt;\beta," text="(supremum _ (g element-of Q))@(norm@(pi _ 1 * g - pi _ 2 * g)) less beta" xml:id="S8.Ex126.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.Ex126.m1.3"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S8.Ex126.m1.3">
                      <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid3"/>
                          <XMTok meaning="supremum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="mid">sup</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S8.Ex126.m1.3.1"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S8.Ex126.m1.3.1">
                              <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMRef idref="S8.Ex126.m1.1"/>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.Ex126.m1.1">g</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMRef idref="S8.Ex126.m1.2"/>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.Ex126.m1.2">g</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="beta" role="UNKNOWN">β</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
          </equation>
          <p><text font="italic">there exists a unitary operator <Math mode="inline" tex="U" text="U" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m12">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m13">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="\|U-I\|&lt;\alpha" text="norm@(U - I) less alpha" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m14">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m14.1"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m14.1">
                          <XMTok font="upright" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>
and <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{2}(g)=U^{*}\pi_{1}(g)U" text="pi _ 2 * g = U ^ * * pi _ 1 * g * U" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m15">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m15.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m15.1">g</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m15.2"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m15.2">g</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> for every <Math mode="inline" tex="g\in G" text="g element-of G" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m16">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.
If <Math mode="inline" tex="0&lt;\alpha\leq 2" text="0 less alpha less= 2" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m17">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, we can choose <Math mode="inline" tex="\beta=\alpha\varepsilon/(2\sqrt{d})" text="beta = (alpha * varepsilon) / (2 * square-root@(d))" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m18">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="beta" role="UNKNOWN">β</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                        <XMTok name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m18.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem1.p1.m18.1">
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="upright" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="square-root"/>
                              <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <ERROR class="undefined">{proof}</ERROR>
      <para xml:id="S8.SS1.p2">
        <p>Without loss of generality we can assume that <Math mode="inline" tex="0&lt;\alpha\leq 2" text="0 less alpha less= 2" xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m1">

          </Math>.

            <XMath>

Then</p>
        <equation xml:id="S8.Ex127">
          <Math mode="display" tex="\sup_{g\in Q}\left|\rho(g)(I)-I\right|_{HS}=\sup_{g\in Q}\left|\pi_{1}(g)-\pi_%&#10;{2}(g)\right|_{HS}\leq\sqrt{d}\,\sup_{g\in Q}\|\pi_{1}(g)-\pi_{2}(g)\|&lt;\sqrt{d%&#10;}\beta." text="(supremum _ (g element-of Q))@((absolute-value@(rho * g * I - I)) _ (H * S)) = (supremum _ (g element-of Q))@((absolute-value@(pi _ 1 * g - pi _ 2 * g)) _ (H * S)) less= square-root@(d) * (supremum _ (g element-of Q))@(norm@(pi _ 1 * g - pi _ 2 * g)) less square-root@(d) * beta" xml:id="S8.Ex127.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S8.Ex127.m1.7"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S8.Ex127.m1.7">
                    <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                        <XMTok meaning="supremum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="mid">sup</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>

                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S8.Ex127.m1.7.1"/>

                            <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S8.Ex127.m1.7.1">
                              <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMRef idref="S8.Ex127.m1.1"/>

                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>

                            <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>

                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                        <XMTok meaning="supremum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="mid">sup</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>

                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S8.Ex127.m1.7.2"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S8.Ex127.m1.7.2">
                              <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMRef idref="S8.Ex127.m1.3"/>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.Ex127.m1.3">g</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMRef idref="S8.Ex127.m1.4"/>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.Ex127.m1.4">g</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp rpadding="1.7pt">
                        <XMTok meaning="square-root"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                          <XMTok meaning="supremum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="mid">sup</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S8.Ex127.m1.7.3"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S8.Ex127.m1.7.3">
                              <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMRef idref="S8.Ex127.m1.5"/>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.Ex127.m1.5">g</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMRef idref="S8.Ex127.m1.6"/>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.Ex127.m1.6">g</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="square-root"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="beta" role="UNKNOWN">β</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>Therefore</p>
        <equation xml:id="S8.Ex128">
          <Math mode="display" tex="\sup_{g\in Q}|\rho(g)(d^{-1/2}I)-d^{-1/2}I|_{HS}&lt;\beta=\left(\frac{\alpha}{2%&#10;\sqrt{d}}\right)\varepsilon." text="(supremum _ (g element-of Q))@((absolute-value@(rho * g * d ^ (- 1 / 2) * I - d ^ (- 1 / 2) * I)) _ (H * S)) less beta = (alpha / (2 * square-root@(d))) * varepsilon" xml:id="S8.Ex128.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S8.Ex128.m1.3"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S8.Ex128.m1.3">
                    <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                        <XMTok meaning="supremum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="mid">sup</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S8.Ex128.m1.3.1"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S8.Ex128.m1.3.1">
                              <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" name="rho" role="UNKNOWN">ρ</XMTok>
                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMRef idref="S8.Ex128.m1.1"/>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMRef idref="S8.Ex128.m1.3.1.1"/>

                                      <XMApp>

                                      </XMApp>

                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                                  <XMApp>

                                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>

                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>

                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="beta" role="UNKNOWN">β</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S8.Ex128.m1.2"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="true">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S8.Ex128.m1.2">
                            <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="square-root"/>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="true">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>As <Math mode="inline" tex="({Q},\varepsilon)" text="open-interval@(Q, varepsilon)" xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m20">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS1.p2.m20.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS1.p2.m20.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m20.1">Q</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m20.2">ε</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a Kazhdan pair for <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m21">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, it follows
from <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BdHV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Prop. 1.1.9]</cite> that there exists
a <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m22">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-invariant vector <Math mode="inline" tex="L^{\prime}\in HS(H)" text="L ^ prime element-of H * S * H" xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m23">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS1.p2.m23.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m23.1">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for <Math mode="inline" tex="\rho" text="rho" xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m24">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="rho" role="UNKNOWN">ρ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> which
is <Math mode="inline" tex="\left(\frac{\alpha}{2\sqrt{d}}\right)" text="alpha / (2 * square-root@(d))" xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m25">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S8.SS1.p2.m25.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="true">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m25.1">
                    <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="square-root"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="true">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-close to <Math mode="inline" tex="d^{-1/2}I" text="d ^ (- 1 / 2) * I" xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m26">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
Then <Math mode="inline" tex="L=\sqrt{d}L^{\prime}" text="L = square-root@(d) * L ^ prime" xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m27">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="square-root"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m28">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-invariant vector for <Math mode="inline" tex="\rho" text="rho" xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m29">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="rho" role="UNKNOWN">ρ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> satisfying</p>
        <equation labels="LABEL:eq:LminusI" xml:id="S8.E19">
          <tags>
            <tag>(19)</tag>
            <tag role="autoref">Equation 19</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">19</tag>
          </tags>
          <Math mode="display" tex="\|L-I\|\leq\left|L-I\right|_{HS}&lt;\frac{\alpha}{2}\cdot" xml:id="S8.E19.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
              <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok name="cdot" role="MULOP">⋅</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>Since <Math mode="inline" tex="\alpha\leq 2" text="alpha less= 2" xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m30">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, the operator <Math mode="inline" tex="L" text="L" xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m31">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is invertible. The equation <Math mode="inline" tex="\rho(g)(L)=L" text="rho * g * L = L" xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m32">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="rho" role="UNKNOWN">ρ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS1.p2.m32.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m32.1">g</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS1.p2.m32.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m32.2">L</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for every <Math mode="inline" tex="g\in G" text="g element-of G" xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m33">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> implies that</p>
        <equation labels="LABEL:eq:qqch" xml:id="S8.E20">
          <tags>
            <tag>(20)</tag>
            <tag role="autoref">Equation 20</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">20</tag>
          </tags>
          <Math mode="display" tex="\pi_{2}(g)=L^{-1}\pi_{1}(g)L\quad\textrm{ for every }g\in G." text="formulae@(pi _ 2 * g = L ^ (- 1) * pi _ 1 * g * L, [ for every ] * g element-of G)" xml:id="S8.E20.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S8.E20.m1.3"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMDual xml:id="S8.E20.m1.3">
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>

                      <XMApp xml:id="S8.E20.m1.3.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                          </XMApp>

                            <XMRef idref="S8.E20.m1.1"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>

                      <XMTok font="italic" name="quad" role="PUNCT"> </XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S8.E20.m1.3.2">
                        <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMText> for every </XMText>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>

                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>Consider now the polar decomposition <Math mode="inline" tex="L=U(L^{*}L)^{1/2}" text="L = U * (L ^ * * L) ^ (1 / 2)" xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m34">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                <XMApp>

                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S8.SS1.p2.m34.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>

                          </XMApp>

                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="L" text="L" xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m35">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
Using Equation (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:LminusI"/>) and <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BOTulam" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Lem. 4.5]</cite> we obtain that
<Math mode="inline" tex="\|U-I\|&lt;\alpha" text="norm@(U - I) less alpha" xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m36">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS1.p2.m36.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m36.1">
                      <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
The fact that <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{2}(g)=U^{*}\pi_{1}(g)U" text="pi _ 2 * g = U ^ * * pi _ 1 * g * U" xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m37">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS1.p2.m37.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m37.1">g</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS1.p2.m37.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m37.2">g</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for every <Math mode="inline" tex="g\in G" text="g element-of G" xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m38">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a consequence of Equation (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:qqch"/>) and of the fact that <Math mode="inline" tex="(L^{*}L)^{1/2}" text="(L ^ * * L) ^ (1 / 2)" xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m39">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>

                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a norm limit of polynomials in <Math mode="inline" tex="L^{*}L" text="L ^ * * L" xml:id="S8.SS1.p2.m40">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>

            </XMath>
          </Math>.

      </para>
    </subsection>
    <subsection inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:Section_8.2" xml:id="S8.SS2">
      <tags>
        <tag>8.2</tag>
        <tag role="autoref">subsection 8.2</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">8.2</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§8.2</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=" ">8.2</tag>Kazhdan sets and asymptotically invariant sequences</title>
      <para xml:id="S8.SS2.p1">
        <p>Connes and Weiss provide (<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="CW" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, see also <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Sch" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>) a characterization of Property (T) for countable groups in terms of ergodicity properties of actions of the group on probability spaces.
This result is extended in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BdHV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Th. 6.3.4]</cite> to second countable locally compact groups, and a simplified proof is given there.
If <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is such a group, and <Math mode="inline" tex="(\Omega,\mathcal{F},\nu)" text="vector@(Omega, F, nu)" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="vector"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p1.m2.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p1.m2.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p1.m2.3"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m2.1">Ω</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m2.2">F</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m2.3">ν</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a probability space, a measure-preserving action
<Math mode="inline" tex="(T_{g})_{g\in G}" text="T _ g _ (g element-of G)" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p1.m3.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m3.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="(\Omega,\mathcal{F},\nu)" text="vector@(Omega, F, nu)" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="vector"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p1.m5.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p1.m5.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p1.m5.3"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m5.1">Ω</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m5.2">F</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m5.3">ν</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> gives rise to a unitary representation <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{\nu}" text="pi _ nu" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="L^{2}(\Omega,\mathcal{F},\nu)" text="L ^ 2 * vector@(Omega, F, nu)" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>

                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="vector"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p1.m8.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p1.m8.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p1.m8.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m8.1">Ω</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m8.2">F</XMTok>

                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> defined by setting
<Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{\nu}(g)f(\omega)=f(T_{g^{-1}}\omega)" text="pi _ nu * g * f * omega = f * T _ (g ^ (- 1)) * omega" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>

                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p1.m9.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p1.m9.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p1.m9.3"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m9.3">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>

            </XMath>
          </Math> for every <Math mode="inline" tex="f\in L^{2}(\Omega,\mathcal{F},\nu)" text="f element-of L ^ 2 * vector@(Omega, F, nu)" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m10">
            <XMath>

                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
