                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="g\in G" text="g element-of G" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\omega\in\Omega" text="omega element-of Omega" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="omega" role="UNKNOWN">ω</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. The restriction of <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{\nu}" text="pi _ nu" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> to the space <Math mode="inline" tex="L^{2}_{0}(\Omega,\mathcal{F},\nu)" text="(L ^ 2) _ 0 * vector@(Omega, F, nu)" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="vector"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p1.m14.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p1.m14.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p1.m14.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m14.1">Ω</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m14.2">F</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m14.3">ν</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of functions of <Math mode="inline" tex="L^{2}(\Omega,\mathcal{F},\nu)" text="L ^ 2 * vector@(Omega, F, nu)" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="vector"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p1.m15.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p1.m15.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p1.m15.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m15.1">Ω</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m15.2">F</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m15.3">ν</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of mean zero is denoted by <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{\nu}^{0}" text="(pi _ nu) ^ 0" xml:id="S8.SS2.p1.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S8.SS2.p2">
        <p>The Connes-Weiss characterization of Property (T) is given in terms of <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">asymptotically invariant sequences</text> <Math mode="inline" tex="(A_{n})_{n\geq 1}" text="A _ n _ (n &gt;= 1)" xml:id="S8.SS2.p2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p2.m1.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S8.SS2.p2.m1.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of sets for measure preserving actions of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.SS2.p2.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Given such an action <Math mode="inline" tex="(T_{g})_{g\in G}" text="T _ g _ (g element-of G)" xml:id="S8.SS2.p2.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p2.m3.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S8.SS2.p2.m3.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.SS2.p2.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on a probability space <Math mode="inline" tex="(\Omega,\mathcal{F},\nu)" text="vector@(Omega, F, nu)" xml:id="S8.SS2.p2.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="vector"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p2.m5.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p2.m5.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p2.m5.3"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p2.m5.1">Ω</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p2.m5.2">F</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p2.m5.3">ν</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, these are the sequences <Math mode="inline" tex="(A_{n})_{n\geq 1}" text="A _ n _ (n &gt;= 1)" xml:id="S8.SS2.p2.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p2.m6.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of elements of <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{F}" text="F" xml:id="S8.SS2.p2.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that for every compact subset <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S8.SS2.p2.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.SS2.p2.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>,</p>
        <equation labels="LABEL:AS" xml:id="S8.E21">
          <tags>
            <tag>(21)</tag>
            <tag role="autoref">Equation 21</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">21</tag>
          </tags>
          <Math mode="display" tex="\lim_{n\to+\infty}\sup_{g\in{Q}}\nu(T_{g}A_{n}\bigtriangleup A_{n})=0." text="(limit _ (n to + infinity))@((supremum _ (g element-of Q))@(nu * (T _ g * A _ n bigtriangleup A _ n))) = 0" xml:id="S8.E21.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S8.E21.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S8.E21.m1.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                        <XMTok meaning="limit" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="mid">lim</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMApp scriptpos="mid">

                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S8.E21.m1.1.1"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S8.E21.m1.1.1">
                                <XMTok name="bigtriangleup" role="ADDOP">△</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>Such a sequence <Math mode="inline" tex="(A_{n})_{n\geq 1}" text="A _ n _ (n &gt;= 1)" xml:id="S8.SS2.p2.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p2.m10.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S8.SS2.p2.m10.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of sets is non-trivial if <Math mode="inline" tex="\inf_{n\geq 1}\nu(A_{n})(1-\nu(A_{n}))&gt;0" text="(infimum _ (n &gt;= 1))@(nu * A _ n * (1 - nu * A _ n)) &gt; 0" xml:id="S8.SS2.p2.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok meaning="infimum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="post">inf</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p2.m11.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S8.SS2.p2.m11.1">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p2.m11.2"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S8.SS2.p2.m11.2">
                          <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                          <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p2.m11.2.1"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMApp xml:id="S8.SS2.p2.m11.2.1">
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. A measure-preserving action of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.SS2.p2.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is said to be <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">strongly ergodic</text> if it admits no non-trivial asymptotically invariant sequence.</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_theorem" inlist="thm theorem:theorem" labels="LABEL:OOO" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem2">
        <tags>
          <tag>Theorem 8.2</tag>
          <tag role="autoref">Theorem 8.2</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">8.2</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Theorem 8.2</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Theorem 8.2</text></tag> (<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="CW" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>)</title>
        <para xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem2.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem2.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a second countable locally compact group. The following assertions are equivalent:</text></p>
          <enumerate xml:id="S8.I1">
            <item xml:id="S8.I1.ix36">
              <tags>
                <tag class="ltx_emph"><text font="italic">(a)</text></tag>
                <tag role="autoref"><text font="italic">item </text></tag>
                <tag class="ltx_emph" role="typerefnum">item <text font="italic">(a)</text></tag>
              </tags>
              <para xml:id="S8.I1.ix36.p1">
                <p><Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.I1.ix36.p1.m1">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> has Property (T);</text></p>
              </para>
            </item>
            <item xml:id="S8.I1.ix37">
              <tags>
                <tag class="ltx_emph"><text font="italic">(b)</text></tag>
                <tag role="autoref"><text font="italic">item </text></tag>
                <tag class="ltx_emph" role="typerefnum">item <text font="italic">(b)</text></tag>
              </tags>
              <para xml:id="S8.I1.ix37.p1">
                <p><text font="italic">every measure-preserving ergodic action of </text><Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.I1.ix37.p1.m1">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> is strongly ergodic;</text></p>
              </para>
            </item>
            <item xml:id="S8.I1.ix38">
              <tags>
                <tag class="ltx_emph"><text font="italic">(c)</text></tag>
                <tag role="autoref"><text font="italic">item </text></tag>
                <tag class="ltx_emph" role="typerefnum">item <text font="italic">(c)</text></tag>
              </tags>
              <para xml:id="S8.I1.ix38.p1">
                <p><text font="italic">every measure-preserving weakly mixing action of </text><Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.I1.ix38.p1.m1">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> is strongly ergodic.</text></p>
              </para>
            </item>
          </enumerate>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <para xml:id="S8.SS2.p3">
        <p>We refer the reader to <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BdHV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Sec. 6.3]</cite> or <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Gl" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Ch. 13]</cite> for more on the consequences of Property (T) on the measure-preserving actions of the group. Our aim here is to present a last consequence of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/>, which is a Connes-Weiss type characterization of Kazhdan subsets of the group.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S8.SS2.p4">
        <p>Consider a measure-preserving action <Math mode="inline" tex="(T_{g})_{g\in G}" text="T _ g _ (g element-of G)" xml:id="S8.SS2.p4.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p4.m1.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S8.SS2.p4.m1.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.SS2.p4.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on a probability space <Math mode="inline" tex="(\Omega,\mathcal{F},\nu)" text="vector@(Omega, F, nu)" xml:id="S8.SS2.p4.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="vector"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p4.m3.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p4.m3.2"/>

                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p4.m3.2">F</XMTok>

                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, and let <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S8.SS2.p4.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be a subset of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.SS2.p4.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. A sequence <Math mode="inline" tex="(A_{n})_{n\geq 1}" text="A _ n _ (n &gt;= 1)" xml:id="S8.SS2.p4.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p4.m6.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S8.SS2.p4.m6.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of elements of <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{F}" text="F" xml:id="S8.SS2.p4.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is said to be <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S8.SS2.p4.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math><text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">-asymptotically invariant</text> for this action if (<ref labelref="LABEL:AS"/>) holds true for this particular set <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S8.SS2.p4.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.

            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p4.m10.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S8.SS2.p4.m10.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>

              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S8.SS2.p4.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math><text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">-strongly-ergodic</text> if it has no non-trivial <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S8.SS2.p4.m12">
            <XMath>

      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_theorem" inlist="thm theorem:theorem" labels="LABEL:Theorem_AA" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem3">
        <tags>
          <tag>Theorem 8.3</tag>
          <tag role="autoref">Theorem 8.3</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">8.3</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Theorem 8.3</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Theorem 8.3</text></tag></title>
        <para xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem3.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem3.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a second countable locally compact group, and let <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem3.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a subset of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem3.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> which generates <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem3.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>. The following assertions are equivalent:</text></p>
          <enumerate xml:id="S8.I2">
            <item xml:id="S8.I2.ix39">
              <tags>

              </tags>

                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math><text font="italic"> is a Kazhdan set in </text><Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.I2.ix39.p1.m2">
                    <XMath>

                  </Math><text font="italic">;</text></p>
              </para>
            </item>
            <item xml:id="S8.I2.ix40">
              <tags>
                <tag class="ltx_emph"><text font="italic">(b)</text></tag>

              </tags>

                <p><text font="italic">every measure-preserving ergodic action of </text><Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.I2.ix40.p1.m1">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>

                    <XMath>

                  </Math><text font="italic">-strongly ergodic;</text></p>
              </para>

                    <XMath>

          </enumerate>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <ERROR class="undefined">{proof}</ERROR>
      <para xml:id="S8.SS2.p5">
        <p>The proof of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_AA"/> follows in spirit that of the Connes-Weiss characterization of Property (T) given in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BdHV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Th. 6.3.4]</cite>, and so we will content ourselves with highlighting the main differences between the two proofs.
The proof of <Math mode="inline" tex="\textrm{(a)}\Longrightarrow\textrm{(b)}" text="[(a)] Longrightarrow [(b)]" xml:id="S8.SS2.p5.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="Longrightarrow" role="ARROW">⟹</XMTok>
                <XMText>(a)</XMText>
                <XMText>(b)</XMText>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is the consequence of the following generalization of <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BdHV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Prop. 6.3.2]</cite> and the fact that if <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S8.SS2.p5.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.SS2.p5.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, representations of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.SS2.p5.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> with <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S8.SS2.p5.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-almost-invariant vectors have non-zero <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.SS2.p5.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-invariant vectors:</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_fact" inlist="thm theorem:fact" labels="LABEL:Fact_BB" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem4">
        <tags>
          <tag>Fact 8.4</tag>
          <tag role="autoref">8.4</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">8.4</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Fact 8.4</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Fact 8.4</text></tag></title>
        <para xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem4.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem4.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a second countable locally compact group, and let <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem4.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a subset of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem4.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>. If a measure-preserving action of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem4.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> on a probability space <Math mode="inline" tex="(\Omega,\mathcal{F},\nu)" text="vector@(Omega, F, nu)" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem4.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="vector"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S8.Thmtheorem4.p1.m5.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S8.Thmtheorem4.p1.m5.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S8.Thmtheorem4.p1.m5.3"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem4.p1.m5.1">Ω</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem4.p1.m5.2">F</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="nu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem4.p1.m5.3">ν</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math> admits a non-trivial <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem4.p1.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>-asymptotically invariant sequence, then <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{\nu}^{0}" text="(pi _ nu) ^ 0" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem4.p1.m7">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> has <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem4.p1.m8">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>-almost-invariant vectors.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <para xml:id="S8.SS2.p6">
        <p>The implication <Math mode="inline" tex="\textrm{(b)}\Longrightarrow\textrm{(c)}" text="[(b)] Longrightarrow [(c)]" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="Longrightarrow" role="ARROW">⟹</XMTok>
                <XMText>(b)</XMText>
                <XMText>(c)</XMText>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is obvious, and we concentrate on the proof of the implication <Math mode="inline" tex="\textrm{(c)}\Longrightarrow\textrm{(a)}" text="[(c)] Longrightarrow [(a)]" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="Longrightarrow" role="ARROW">⟹</XMTok>
                <XMText>(c)</XMText>
                <XMText>(a)</XMText>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Suppose that assumption (c) holds true, but that <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is not a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. By Corollary <ref labelref="LABEL:CorollaryA"/>, there exists a unitary representation <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on a Hilbert space <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> (which, as <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is second countable, can be assumed to be separable) which has <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-almost-invariant vectors but no finite dimensional subrepresentation. Let <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{\mathbb{R}}" text="H _ R" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> denote the space <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> viewed as a real Hilbert space with the scalar product defined by
<Math mode="inline" tex="{{\langle{x},{y}\rangle}}_{\mathbb{R}}=\Re e{{\langle{x},{y}\rangle}}" text="(list@(x, y)) _ R = real-part@(e) * list@(x, y)" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p6.m12.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p6.m12.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m12.1">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m12.2">y</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="real-part" name="Re" role="OPFUNCTION">ℜ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p6.m12.3"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p6.m12.4"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m12.3">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m12.4">y</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for every <Math mode="inline" tex="x,y\in H" text="list@(x, y) element-of H" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p6.m13.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p6.m13.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m13.1">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m13.2">y</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. The representation <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> acting on <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{\mathbb{R}}" text="H _ R" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, denoted by <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{\mathbb{R}}" text="pi _ R" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, is an orthogonal representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m17">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. It also has <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m18">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-invariant vectors but no finite dimensional subrepresentation (if <Math mode="inline" tex="E" text="E" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m19">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a finite dimensional subspace of <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{\mathbb{R}}" text="H _ R" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m20">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> which is invariant by the representation <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{\mathbb{R}}" text="pi _ R" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m21">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>,
<Math mode="inline" tex="\widetilde{E}=\{\lambda x\,;\,x\in E,\lambda\in{\mathbb{C}}\}" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m22">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="widetilde" role="OVERACCENT">~</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" rpadding="1.7pt">x</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="1.7pt">;</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m22.1">x</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a finite dimensional subspace of <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m23">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> which is invariant by <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S8.SS2.p6.m24">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>).</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S8.SS2.p7">
        <p>We proceed now as in the proof of <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BdHV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Th. 6.3.4]</cite>. Let <Math mode="inline" tex="K" text="K" xml:id="S8.SS2.p7.m1">
            <XMath>

            </XMath>
          </Math> be an infinite dimensional Gaussian subspace of the space <Math mode="inline" tex="L^{2}_{\mathbb{R}}(\Omega,\mathcal{F},\nu)" text="(L ^ 2) _ R * vector@(Omega, F, nu)" xml:id="S8.SS2.p7.m2">

            </XMath>
          </Math>. Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\smash[t]{{{\phi}:\xymatrix{{H_{\mathbb{R}}}\ar[r]&amp;{K}}}}" text="phi colon [\xymatrix] * H _ R * [\ar] * delimited-[]@(r) * &amp; * K" xml:id="S8.SS2.p7.m4">

        <equation xml:id="S8.Ex129">
          <Math mode="display" tex="\pi_{\nu,{\mathbb{R}}}(g)\widetilde{\phi}=\widetilde{\phi}\ \bigoplus_{n\geq 0%&#10;}S^{n}(\pi_{\mathbb{R}})(g)\ \textrm{for every}\ g\in G," text="pi _ (list@(nu, R)) * g * widetilde@(phi) = widetilde@(phi) * (direct-sum _ (n &gt;= 0))@(S ^ n * pi _ R * g * [for every] * g) element-of G" xml:id="S8.Ex129.m1">

        <p>where <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{\nu,{\mathbb{R}}}" text="pi _ (list@(nu, R))" xml:id="S8.SS2.p7.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> denotes the orthogonal representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.SS2.p7.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="L^{2}_{\mathbb{R}}(\Omega,\mathcal{F},\nu)" text="(L ^ 2) _ R * vector@(Omega, F, nu)" xml:id="S8.SS2.p7.m12">
            <XMath>

                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p7.m12.1">Ω</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p7.m12.2">F</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p7.m12.3">ν</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> associated to the action <Math mode="inline" tex="(T_{g})_{g\in G}" text="T _ g _ (g element-of G)" xml:id="S8.SS2.p7.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p7.m13.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S8.SS2.p7.m13.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Since <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{\mathbb{R}}" text="pi _ R" xml:id="S8.SS2.p7.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> has no finite dimensional subrepresentation, the same argument as in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BdHV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Th. 6.3.4]</cite> shows that <Math mode="inline" tex="(T_{g})_{g\in G}" text="T _ g _ (g element-of G)" xml:id="S8.SS2.p7.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p7.m15.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S8.SS2.p7.m15.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a weakly mixing action of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.SS2.p7.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="(\Omega,\mathcal{F},\nu)" text="vector@(Omega, F, nu)" xml:id="S8.SS2.p7.m17">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="vector"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p7.m17.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p7.m17.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p7.m17.3"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p7.m17.1">Ω</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p7.m17.2">F</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p7.m17.3">ν</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S8.SS2.p8">
        <p>In order to get a contradiction, it remains to show that the action <Math mode="inline" tex="(T_{g})_{g\in G}" text="T _ g _ (g element-of G)" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p8.m1.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m1.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> admits a non-trivial <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-asymptotically-invariant sequence. Exactly as in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BdHV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Th. 6.3.4]</cite>, consider a sequence <Math mode="inline" tex="(\xi_{n})_{n\geq 1}" text="xi _ n _ (n &gt;= 1)" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p8.m3.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m3.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of vectors of norm one in <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{\mathbb{R}}" text="H _ R" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that</p>
        <equation xml:id="S8.Ex130">
          <Math mode="display" tex="\xymatrix{\sup_{g\in{Q}}||\pi_{\mathbb{R}}(g)\xi_{n}-\xi_{n}||\ar[r]&amp;0,}\quad%&#10;\textrm{i.e.}\quad\xymatrix{\sup_{g\in{Q}}{{\langle{\pi_{\mathbb{R}}(g)\xi_{n}%&#10;},{\xi_{n}}\rangle}}\ar[r]&amp;1}\ \textrm{as}\ \xymatrix{n\ar[r]&amp;+\infty.}" text="list@([\xymatrix] * (supremum _ (g element-of Q))@(norm@(pi _ R * g * xi _ n - xi _ n) * [\ar] * delimited-[]@(r) * &amp; * 0), [i.e.], [\xymatrix] * (supremum _ (g element-of Q))@(list@(pi _ R * g * xi _ n, xi _ n) * [\ar] * delimited-[]@(r) * &amp; * 1 * [as] * [\xymatrix] * n * [\ar] * delimited-[]@(r) * &amp;) + infinity)" xml:id="S8.Ex130.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S8.Ex130.m1.7"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMDual xml:id="S8.Ex130.m1.7">

                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="10.0pt">,</XMTok>
                      <XMText xml:id="S8.Ex130.m1.6">i.e.</XMText>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="quad" role="PUNCT"> </XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S8.Ex130.m1.7.2">
                        <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>

                              </XMDual>
                              <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">&amp;</XMTok>

                              <ERROR class="undefined">\xymatrix</ERROR>

                              <XMDual>
                                <XMApp>

                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>
                              <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">&amp;</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
