                      </XMApp>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>Such a sequence of vectors exists, as <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{\mathbb{R}}" text="pi _ R" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> has <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-almost invariant vectors. For every <Math mode="inline" tex="{n\geq 1}" text="n &gt;= 1" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, let <Math mode="inline" tex="X_{n}=\phi(\xi_{n})" text="X _ n = phi * xi _ n" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p8.m8.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m8.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, and <Math mode="inline" tex="A_{n}=\{X_{n}\geq 0\}" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Then <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu(A_{n})=1/2" text="nu * A _ n = 1 / 2" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p8.m10.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m10.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for every <Math mode="inline" tex="{n\geq 1}" text="n &gt;= 1" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Define also, for <Math mode="inline" tex="{n\geq 1}" text="n &gt;= 1" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="g\in G" text="g element-of G" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\alpha_{n}(g)\in[0,\pi]" text="alpha _ n * g element-of closed-interval@(0, pi)" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p8.m14.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m14.1">g</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="closed-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p8.m14.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p8.m14.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m14.2">0</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m14.3">π</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> by the relation
<Math mode="inline" tex="\cos\alpha_{n}(g)={{\langle{\pi_{\mathbb{R}}(g)\xi_{n}},{\xi_{n}}\rangle}}" text="cosine@(alpha _ n) * g = list@(pi _ R * g * xi _ n, xi _ n)" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="cosine" role="TRIGFUNCTION">cos</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p8.m15.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m15.1">g</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p8.m15.3"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p8.m15.4"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m15.3">
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="blackboard" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p8.m15.2"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m15.2">g</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m15.4">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Then <Math mode="inline" tex="\smash{\xymatrix{\sup_{g\in{Q}}\alpha_{n}(g)\ar[r]&amp;0}}" text="[\xymatrix] * (supremum _ (g element-of Q))@(alpha _ n * g * [\ar] * delimited-[]@(r) * &amp; * 0)" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\xymatrix</ERROR>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok meaning="supremum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="post">sup</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p8.m16.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m16.1">g</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <ERROR class="undefined">\ar</ERROR>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="delimited-[]"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p8.m16.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m16.2">r</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">&amp;</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> as
<Math mode="inline" tex="\smash{\xymatrix{n\ar[r]&amp;+\infty.}}" text="[\xymatrix] * n * [\ar] * delimited-[]@(r) * &amp; + infinity" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m17">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p8.m17.2"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m17.2">
                    <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <ERROR class="undefined">\xymatrix</ERROR>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <ERROR class="undefined">\ar</ERROR>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="delimited-[]"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p8.m17.1"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m17.1">r</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">&amp;</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
As <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu(T_{g}A_{n}\bigtriangleup A_{n})=\alpha_{n}(g)/\pi" text="nu * (T _ g * A _ n bigtriangleup A _ n) = (alpha _ n * g) / pi" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m18">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p8.m18.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m18.2">
                        <XMTok name="bigtriangleup" role="ADDOP">△</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p8.m18.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m18.1">g</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for every <Math mode="inline" tex="{n\geq 1}" text="n &gt;= 1" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m19">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and every <Math mode="inline" tex="g\in G" text="g element-of G" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m20">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> (see <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BdHV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Th. 6.3.4]</cite> for details), <Math mode="inline" tex="(A_{n})_{n\geq 1}" text="A _ n _ (n &gt;= 1)" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m21">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p8.m21.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m21.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m22">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-asymptotically invariant sequence for <Math mode="inline" tex="(T_{g})_{g\in G}" text="T _ g _ (g element-of G)" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m23">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p8.m23.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m23.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, which is non-trivial since <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu(A_{n})=1/2" text="nu * A _ n = 1 / 2" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m24">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.SS2.p8.m24.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m24.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for every <Math mode="inline" tex="{n\geq 1}" text="n &gt;= 1" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m25">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. We have thus constructed a weakly mixing action of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m26">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> which is not <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}" text="Q" xml:id="S8.SS2.p8.m27">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-strongly ergodic, which contradicts assumption (c).</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_remark" inlist="thm theorem:remark" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem5">
        <tags>
          <tag>Remark 8.5</tag>
          <tag role="autoref">8.5</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">8.5</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Remark 8.5</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Remark 8.5</text></tag></title>
        <para xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem5.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">Exactly the same proof shows that if <Math mode="inline" tex="({Q}_{k})_{k\geq 1}" text="Q _ k _ (k &gt;= 1)" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem5.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S8.Thmtheorem5.p1.m1.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem5.p1.m1.1">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is an increasing sequence of subsets of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem5.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> such that, for every <Math mode="inline" tex="k\geq 1" text="k &gt;= 1" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem5.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}_{k}" text="Q _ k" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem5.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> generates <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem5.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}_{k}" text="Q _ k" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem5.p1.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is not a Kazhdan set in <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem5.p1.m7">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, there exists a weakly mixing action of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem5.p1.m8">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> on a probability space <Math mode="inline" tex="(\Omega,\mathcal{F},\nu)" text="vector@(Omega, F, nu)" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem5.p1.m9">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="vector"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S8.Thmtheorem5.p1.m9.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S8.Thmtheorem5.p1.m9.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S8.Thmtheorem5.p1.m9.3"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem5.p1.m9.1">Ω</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem5.p1.m9.2">F</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="nu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem5.p1.m9.3">ν</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and a non-trivial sequence <Math mode="inline" tex="(A_{n})_{n\geq 1}" text="A _ n _ (n &gt;= 1)" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem5.p1.m10">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S8.Thmtheorem5.p1.m10.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem5.p1.m10.1">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> of elements of <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{F}" text="F" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem5.p1.m11">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> which is, for each <Math mode="inline" tex="k\geq 1" text="k &gt;= 1" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem5.p1.m12">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="{Q}_{k}" text="Q _ k" xml:id="S8.Thmtheorem5.p1.m13">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>-asymptotically invariant for this action.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
    </subsection>
  </section>
  <appendix inlist="toc" xml:id="A1">
    <tags>
      <tag>Appendix A</tag>
      <tag role="autoref">Appendix A</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">A</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">Appendix A</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=" ">Appendix A</tag>Infinite tensor products of Hilbert spaces</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">A</tag>Infinite tensor products of Hilbert spaces</toctitle>
    <para xml:id="A1.p1">
      <p>We briefly describe in this appendix some constructions of tensor
<!--  %**** String Line 2500 **** -->products of infinite families of Hilbert spaces, and of tensor products of infinite families of unitary representations. These last objects play an important role in the proof of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:Theorem_0"/>. We review here the properties and results which we need, following the original works of von Neumann <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="VN" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> and Guichardet <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Gui" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>.</p>
    </para>
    <subsection inlist="toc" xml:id="A1.SS1">
      <tags>
        <tag>A.1</tag>
        <tag role="autoref">subsection A.1</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">A.1</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§A.1</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=" ">A.1</tag>The complete and incomplete tensor products of Hilbert
spaces</title>
      <para xml:id="A1.SS1.p1">
        <p>The original construction of the complete and incomplete tensor products
of a family <Math mode="inline" tex="(H_{\alpha})_{\alpha\in I}" text="H _ alpha _ (alpha element-of I)" xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p1.m1.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m1.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of Hilbert spaces is due to von
Neumann <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="VN" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>. It was later on taken up by Guichardet in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Gui" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>
under a somewhat different point of view, and the incomplete tensor
products of von Neumann are rather known today as the Guichardet tensor
products of Hilbert spaces. Although these constructions can be carried
out starting from an arbitrary family <Math mode="inline" tex="(H_{\alpha})_{\alpha\in I}" text="H _ alpha _ (alpha element-of I)" xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p1.m2.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m2.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of
Hilbert spaces, we will present them here only in the case of a countable
family <Math mode="inline" tex="({H_{n}})_{n\geq 1}" text="H _ n _ (n &gt;= 1)" xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p1.m3.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m3.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of (complex) Hilbert spaces.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="A1.SS1.p2">
        <p>The <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">complete infinite tensor product</text> <Math mode="inline" tex="{\bigotimes_{n\geq 1}{H_{n}}}" text="(tensor-product _ (n &gt;= 1))@(H _ n)" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="tensor-product" name="bigotimes" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⊗</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
of the Hilbert spaces <Math mode="inline" tex="{H_{n}}" text="H _ n" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is defined in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="VN" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Part II, Ch. 3]</cite> in
the following way: the elementary infinite tensor products are the elements
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{x}}={{\otimes}_{n\geq 1}{x_{n}}}" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="bold italic" lpadding="0.8pt" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="{x_{n}}" text="x _ n" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> belongs to <Math mode="inline" tex="{H_{n}}" text="H _ n" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for each
<Math mode="inline" tex="{n\geq 1}" text="n &gt;= 1" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and the infinite product <Math mode="inline" tex="\prod_{n\geq 1}||{x_{n}}||" text="(product _ (n &gt;= 1))@(norm@(x _ n))" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="product" name="prod" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∏</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                    <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p2.m7.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN">||</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m7.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE">||</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is convergent
in the sense of <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="VN" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Def. 2.2.1]</cite>, which by <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="VN" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Lem. 2.4.1]</cite> is equivalent to the fact that either <Math mode="inline" tex="x_{n}=0" text="x _ n = 0" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for some <Math mode="inline" tex="n\geq 1" text="n &gt;= 1" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> or the series <Math mode="inline" tex="\sum_{n\geq 1}\max(||x_{n}||-1,0)" text="(sum _ (n &gt;= 1))@(maximum@(norm@(x _ n) - 1, 0))" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∑</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p2.m10.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p2.m10.3"/>
                    <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p2.m10.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="maximum" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m10.1">max</XMTok>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m10.3">
                        <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                            <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p2.m10.3.1"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN">||</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m10.3.1">
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE">||</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m10.2">0</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is convergent. Sequences
<Math mode="inline" tex="{({x_{n}})_{n\geq 1}}" text="x _ n _ (n &gt;= 1)" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p2.m11.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m11.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> with this property are called by von Neumann in
<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="VN" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> <Math mode="inline" tex="C" text="C" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math><text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">-sequences</text>. A scalar product is then defined on the
set of finite linear combinations of elementary tensor products by setting</p>
        <equation xml:id="A1.Ex131">
          <Math mode="display" tex="{{\langle{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{x}},{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{y}}\rangle}}=%&#10;\prod_{n\geq 1}{{\langle{x_{n}},{y_{n}}\rangle}}" text="list@(x, y) = (product _ (n &gt;= 1))@(list@(x _ n, y _ n))" xml:id="A1.Ex131.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="A1.Ex131.m1.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="A1.Ex131.m1.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" rpadding="0.8pt" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="A1.Ex131.m1.1">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="0.8pt">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="A1.Ex131.m1.2">y</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                    <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="product" name="prod" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">∏</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="A1.Ex131.m1.3"/>
                      <XMRef idref="A1.Ex131.m1.4"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="A1.Ex131.m1.3">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="A1.Ex131.m1.4">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
<!--  %**** String Line 2525 **** -->        <p>for any elementary tensor products <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{x}}={{\otimes}_{n\geq 1}{x_{n}}}" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="bold italic" lpadding="0.8pt" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{y}}={{\otimes}_{n\geq 1}{y_{n}}}" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="bold italic" lpadding="0.8pt" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, and extending the definition by linearity to
finite linear combinations of such elements.
The product defining <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\langle{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{x}},{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{y}}\rangle}}" text="list@(x, y)" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p2.m15.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p2.m15.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" rpadding="0.8pt" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m15.1">x</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="0.8pt">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m15.2">y</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for two elementary vectors <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{x}}" text="x" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="bold italic" lpadding="0.8pt" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{y}}" text="y" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m17">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="bold italic" lpadding="0.8pt" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is quasi-convergent in the sense of <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="VN" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Def. 2.5.1]</cite>, i.e. <Math mode="inline" tex="\prod_{n\geq 1}|{{\langle{x_{n}},{y_{n}}\rangle}}|" text="(product _ (n &gt;= 1))@(absolute-value@(list@(x _ n, y _ n)))" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m18">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="product" name="prod" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∏</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                    <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p2.m18.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMDual xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m18.1">
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p2.m18.1.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p2.m18.1.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m18.1.1">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m18.1.2">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is convergent. The value of this quasi-convergent product is <Math mode="inline" tex="\prod_{n\geq 1}{{\langle{x_{n}},{y_{n}}\rangle}}" text="(product _ (n &gt;= 1))@(list@(x _ n, y _ n))" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m19">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="product" name="prod" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∏</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p2.m19.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p2.m19.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m19.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m19.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> if the product is convergent in the usual sense, and <Math mode="inline" tex="0" text="0" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m20">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> if it is not.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="A1.SS1.p3">
        <p>That this is indeed a scalar product which turns the set of finite linear
combinations of elementary tensor products into a complex prehilbertian
space is proved in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="VN" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Lem. 3.21 and Theorem II]</cite>.
For any elementary tensor product <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{x}}={{\otimes}_{n\geq 1}{x_{n}}}" xml:id="A1.SS1.p3.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="bold italic" lpadding="0.8pt" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>,
<Math mode="inline" tex="||{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{x}}||=\prod_{n\geq 1}||{x_{n}}||" text="norm@(x) = (product _ (n &gt;= 1))@(norm@(x _ n))" xml:id="A1.SS1.p3.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                    <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p3.m2.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN">||</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="A1.SS1.p3.m2.1">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE">||</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="product" name="prod" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∏</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                      <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p3.m2.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN">||</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="A1.SS1.p3.m2.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE">||</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. The space <Math mode="inline" tex="{\bigotimes_{n\geq 1}{H_{n}}}" text="(tensor-product _ (n &gt;= 1))@(H _ n)" xml:id="A1.SS1.p3.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="tensor-product" name="bigotimes" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⊗</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is
the completion of this space for the topology induced by the scalar
product. It is always non-separable.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="A1.SS1.p4">
        <p>The <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">incomplete tensor products</text> are closed subspaces of the complete
tensor product. They are defined by von Neumann using an equivalence
relation between sequences <Math mode="inline" tex="{({x_{n}})_{n\geq 1}}" text="x _ n _ (n &gt;= 1)" xml:id="A1.SS1.p4.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p4.m1.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="A1.SS1.p4.m1.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of vectors with <Math mode="inline" tex="{x_{n}}\in{H_{n}}" text="x _ n element-of H _ n" xml:id="A1.SS1.p4.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for each <Math mode="inline" tex="{n\geq 1}" text="n &gt;= 1" xml:id="A1.SS1.p4.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and such that the series
<Math mode="inline" tex="\sum_{n\geq 1}\bigl{|}1-||{x_{n}}||\bigr{|}" text="(sum _ (n &gt;= 1))@(absolute-value@(1 - norm@(x _ n)))" xml:id="A1.SS1.p4.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∑</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                    <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p4.m4.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok fontsize="120%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="A1.SS1.p4.m4.1">
                      <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                          <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p4.m4.1.1"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN">||</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="A1.SS1.p4.m4.1.1">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE">||</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="120%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is convergent. Such sequences are called
<Math mode="inline" tex="C_{0}" text="C _ 0" xml:id="A1.SS1.p4.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math><text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">-sequences</text>. They are <Math mode="inline" tex="C" text="C" xml:id="A1.SS1.p4.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-sequences, and if
<Math mode="inline" tex="{({x_{n}})_{n\geq 1}}" text="x _ n _ (n &gt;= 1)" xml:id="A1.SS1.p4.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p4.m7.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="A1.SS1.p4.m7.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a <Math mode="inline" tex="C" text="C" xml:id="A1.SS1.p4.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-sequence such that <Math mode="inline" tex="\prod_{n\geq 1}||{x_{n}}||&gt;0" text="(product _ (n &gt;= 1))@(norm@(x _ n)) &gt; 0" xml:id="A1.SS1.p4.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="product" name="prod" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∏</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                      <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p4.m9.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN">||</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="A1.SS1.p4.m9.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE">||</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> (i. e. <Math mode="inline" tex="{({x_{n}})_{n\geq 1}}" text="x _ n _ (n &gt;= 1)" xml:id="A1.SS1.p4.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p4.m10.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="A1.SS1.p4.m10.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is non-zero in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\bigotimes_{n\geq 1}{H_{n}}}" text="(tensor-product _ (n &gt;= 1))@(H _ n)" xml:id="A1.SS1.p4.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="tensor-product" name="bigotimes" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⊗</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>) then
<Math mode="inline" tex="{({x_{n}})_{n\geq 1}}" text="x _ n _ (n &gt;= 1)" xml:id="A1.SS1.p4.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p4.m12.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="A1.SS1.p4.m12.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
