                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

              </XMWrap>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a unitary
operator on <Math mode="inline" tex="{\bigotimes_{n\geq 1}^{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{a}}{H_{n}}}" text="((tensor-product _ (n &gt;= 1)) ^ a)@(H _ n)" xml:id="A1.SS2.p2.m17">
            <XMath>

          </Math> for every

          </Math>, and <Math mode="inline" tex="\boldsymbol{\pi}(gh)=\boldsymbol{\pi}(g)\,\boldsymbol{\pi}(h)" text="pi * g * h = pi * g * pi * h" xml:id="A1.SS2.p2.m19">

              <XMApp>

      <para xml:id="A1.SS2.p3">
        <p>If the group <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="A1.SS2.p3.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is discrete, this tensor product representation is of
course automatically strongly continuous. It is also the case if <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="A1.SS2.p3.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is
supposed to be locally compact.</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_proposition" inlist="thm theorem:proposition" labels="LABEL:Proposition_3.2.0" xml:id="A1.Thmtheorem1">
        <tags>
          <tag>Proposition A.1</tag>
          <tag role="autoref">A.1</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">A.1</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Proposition A.1</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Proposition A.1</text></tag></title>
        <para xml:id="A1.Thmtheorem1.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">Suppose that <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="A1.Thmtheorem1.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is locally compact. If the series</text></p>
          <equation xml:id="A1.Ex133">
            <Math mode="display" tex="\sum_{n\geq 1}|1-{{\langle{\pi_{n}(g){a_{n}}},{a_{n}}\rangle}}|" text="(sum _ (n &gt;= 1))@(absolute-value@(1 - list@(pi _ n * g * a _ n, a _ n)))" xml:id="A1.Ex133.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid3"/>
                    <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">∑</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                      <XMRef idref="A1.Ex133.m1.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="A1.Ex133.m1.2">
                        <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                            <XMRef idref="A1.Ex133.m1.2.1"/>
                            <XMRef idref="A1.Ex133.m1.2.2"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="A1.Ex133.m1.2.1">
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post6"/>
                                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMDual>
                                <XMRef idref="A1.Ex133.m1.1"/>
                                <XMWrap>
                                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="A1.Ex133.m1.1">g</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post7"/>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="A1.Ex133.m1.2.2">
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post6"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
          </equation>
          <p><text font="italic">is convergent for every <Math mode="inline" tex="g\in G" text="g element-of G" xml:id="A1.Thmtheorem1.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, then <Math mode="inline" tex="\boldsymbol{\pi}={\otimes}_{n\geq 1}\pi_{n}" xml:id="A1.Thmtheorem1.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="bold" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is strongly continuous, and is hence a unitary
representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="A1.Thmtheorem1.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="{\bigotimes_{n\geq 1}^{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{a}}{H_{n}}}" text="((tensor-product _ (n &gt;= 1)) ^ a)@(H _ n)" xml:id="A1.Thmtheorem1.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="tensor-product" name="bigotimes" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⊗</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="bold" fontsize="70%" lpadding="0.8pt" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <ERROR class="undefined">{proof}</ERROR>

separable too, and by <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BdHV" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Lem. A.6.2]</cite> it suffices to show that

            </XMath>
          </Math>
is a
measurable
map from <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="A1.SS2.p4.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> into <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{C}}" text="C" xml:id="A1.SS2.p4.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for every vector <Math mode="inline" tex="\boldsymbol{\xi}\in{\bigotimes_{n\geq 1}^{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{a}}{H_{n}}}" text="xi element-of ((tensor-product _ (n &gt;= 1)) ^ a)@(H _ n)" xml:id="A1.SS2.p4.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="bold italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="tensor-product" name="bigotimes" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⊗</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="bold italic" fontsize="70%" lpadding="0.8pt" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
(measurability
refers to the Haar measure on <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="A1.SS2.p4.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>). Since the linear span of the elementary vectors is dense in
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\bigotimes_{n\geq 1}^{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{a}}{H_{n}}}" text="((tensor-product _ (n &gt;= 1)) ^ a)@(H _ n)" xml:id="A1.SS2.p4.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="tensor-product" name="bigotimes" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⊗</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="bold italic" fontsize="70%" lpadding="0.8pt" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, standard arguments show that it
suffices to prove this for elementary vectors <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{x}}={\otimes}_{n\geq 1}{x_{n}}" xml:id="A1.SS2.p4.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="bold italic" lpadding="0.8pt" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\bigotimes_{n\geq 1}^{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{a}}{H_{n}}}" text="((tensor-product _ (n &gt;= 1)) ^ a)@(H _ n)" xml:id="A1.SS2.p4.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="tensor-product" name="bigotimes" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⊗</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="bold italic" fontsize="70%" lpadding="0.8pt" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
Since
each map
<Math mode="inline" tex="\smash{\xymatrix{g\ar@{|-&gt;}[r]&amp;{{\langle{\pi_{n}(g){x_{n}}},{x_{n}}\rangle}}}}" text="[\xymatrix] * g * [\ar] * @ * ket@(-) * delimited-[]@(r) * &amp; * list@(pi _ n * g * x _ n, x _ n)" xml:id="A1.SS2.p4.m12">

          </Math> is measurable on <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="A1.SS2.p4.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.

In the general case one
needs
to impose an additional condition on the representations <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{n}" text="pi _ n" xml:id="A1.SS2.p4.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and on the vectors <Math mode="inline" tex="a_{n}" text="a _ n" xml:id="A1.SS2.p4.m17">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> in order that <Math mode="inline" tex="\boldsymbol{\pi}" text="pi" xml:id="A1.SS2.p4.m18">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="bold italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be a strongly
<!--  %**** String Line 2675 **** -->continuous representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="A1.SS2.p4.m19">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="{\bigotimes_{n\geq 1}^{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{a}}{H_{n}}}" text="((tensor-product _ (n &gt;= 1)) ^ a)@(H _ n)" xml:id="A1.SS2.p4.m20">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="tensor-product" name="bigotimes" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⊗</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>

      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_proposition" inlist="thm theorem:proposition" labels="LABEL:Proposition_3.2" xml:id="A1.Thmtheorem2">
        <tags>
          <tag>Proposition A.2</tag>

        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Proposition A.2</text></tag></title>
        <para xml:id="A1.Thmtheorem2.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">Suppose that the series <Math mode="inline" tex="\sum_{n\geq 1}\,\bigl{|}1-{{\langle{\pi_{n}(g)a_{n}},{a_{n}}\rangle}}\bigr{|}" text="(sum _ (n &gt;= 1))@(absolute-value@(1 - list@(pi _ n * g * a _ n, a _ n)))" xml:id="A1.Thmtheorem2.p1.m1">

                  <XMApp>

                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>

                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                              <XMRef idref="A1.Thmtheorem2.p1.m1.2.1"/>

                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                                </XMApp>

                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is convergent for every <Math mode="inline" tex="g\in G" text="g element-of G" xml:id="A1.Thmtheorem2.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and that the
function</text></p>
          <equation xml:id="A1.Ex134">
            <Math mode="display" tex="\xymatrix{g\ar@{|-&gt;}[r]&amp;{\displaystyle}\sum_{n\geq 1}\,\bigl{|}1-{{\langle{\pi%&#10;_{n}(g)a_{n}},{a_{n}}\rangle}}\bigr{|}}" text="[\xymatrix] * g * [\ar] * @ * ket@(-) * delimited-[]@(r) * &amp; * (sum _ (n &gt;= 1))@(absolute-value@(1 - list@(pi _ n * g * a _ n, a _ n)))" xml:id="A1.Ex134.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <ERROR class="undefined">\xymatrix</ERROR>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                  <ERROR class="undefined">\ar</ERROR>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">@</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="ket"/>
                      <XMRef idref="A1.Ex134.m1.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP" xml:id="A1.Ex134.m1.1">-</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="CLOSE">&gt;</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="delimited-[]"/>
                      <XMRef idref="A1.Ex134.m1.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="A1.Ex134.m1.2">r</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">&amp;</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp rpadding="1.7pt" scriptpos="mid">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid4"/>
                      <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">∑</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                        <XMRef idref="A1.Ex134.m1.4"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok fontsize="120%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="A1.Ex134.m1.4">
                          <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                          <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                              <XMRef idref="A1.Ex134.m1.4.1"/>
                              <XMRef idref="A1.Ex134.m1.4.2"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="A1.Ex134.m1.4.1">
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post7"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMRef idref="A1.Ex134.m1.3"/>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="A1.Ex134.m1.3">g</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post7"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="A1.Ex134.m1.4.2">
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post7"/>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="120%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
          </equation>
          <p><text font="italic">is continuous on a neighborhood of the
identity element <Math mode="inline" tex="e" text="e" xml:id="A1.Thmtheorem2.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="A1.Thmtheorem2.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>. Then <Math mode="inline" tex="\boldsymbol{\pi}={\otimes}_{n\geq 1}\pi_{n}" xml:id="A1.Thmtheorem2.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="bold" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is
strongly
continuous, and is hence a unitary representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="A1.Thmtheorem2.p1.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="{\bigotimes_{n\geq 1}^{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{a}}{H_{n}}}" text="((tensor-product _ (n &gt;= 1)) ^ a)@(H _ n)" xml:id="A1.Thmtheorem2.p1.m7">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="tensor-product" name="bigotimes" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⊗</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="bold" fontsize="70%" lpadding="0.8pt" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <ERROR class="undefined">{proof}</ERROR>
      <para xml:id="A1.SS2.p5">
        <p>[Proof of Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_3.2"/>]
Since the linear span of the elementary vectors is dense in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\bigotimes_{n\geq 1}^{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{a}}{H_{n}}}" text="((tensor-product _ (n &gt;= 1)) ^ a)@(H _ n)" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="tensor-product" name="bigotimes" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⊗</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="bold italic" fontsize="70%" lpadding="0.8pt" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>,
and the operators <Math mode="inline" tex="\boldsymbol{\pi}(g)" text="pi * g" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="bold italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="A1.SS2.p5.m2.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m2.1">g</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="g\in G" text="g element-of G" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, are unitary, it suffices to
prove that the map
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\smash{\xymatrix{g\ar@{|-&gt;}[r]&amp;\boldsymbol{\pi}(g){\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{x%&#10;}}}}}" text="[\xymatrix] * g * [\ar] * @ * ket@(-) * delimited-[]@(r) * &amp; * pi * g * x" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\xymatrix</ERROR>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\ar</ERROR>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">@</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="ket"/>
                    <XMRef idref="A1.SS2.p5.m4.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m4.1">-</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="CLOSE">&gt;</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="delimited-[]"/>
                    <XMRef idref="A1.SS2.p5.m4.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m4.2">r</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">&amp;</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="bold italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="A1.SS2.p5.m4.3"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m4.3">g</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" rpadding="0.8pt" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is continuous at <Math mode="inline" tex="e" text="e" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
for every elementary vector <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{x}}={\otimes}_{n\geq 1}{x_{n}}" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="bold italic" lpadding="0.8pt" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of norm <Math mode="inline" tex="1" text="1" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\bigotimes_{n\geq 1}^{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{a}}{H_{n}}}" text="((tensor-product _ (n &gt;= 1)) ^ a)@(H _ n)" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="tensor-product" name="bigotimes" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⊗</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="bold italic" fontsize="70%" lpadding="0.8pt" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Let <Math mode="inline" tex="N\geq 1" text="N &gt;= 1" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be such that <Math mode="inline" tex="{x_{n}}={a_{n}}" text="x _ n = a _ n" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for every
<Math mode="inline" tex="n&gt;N" text="n &gt; N" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. We have for every <Math mode="inline" tex="g\in G" text="g element-of G" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>:</p>
        <equationgroup class="ltx_eqn_align" xml:id="A1.EGx13">
          <equation xml:id="A1.Ex135">
            <MathFork>
              <Math tex="\displaystyle||\boldsymbol{\pi}(g){\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{x}}-{\mskip 1.5mu %&#10;\boldsymbol{x}}||^{2}=2(1-\Re e{{\langle{\boldsymbol{\pi}(g){\mskip 1.5mu %&#10;\boldsymbol{x}}},{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{x}}\rangle}})=2\biggl{(}1-\prod_{n%&#10;\geq 1}\Re e{{\langle{\pi_{n}(g)\dfrac{x_{n}}{||{x_{n}}||}},{\dfrac{x_{n}}{||{%&#10;x_{n}}||}}\rangle}}\biggr{)}" text="(norm@(pi * g * x - x)) ^ 2 = 2 * (1 - real-part@(e) * list@(pi * g * x, x)) = 2 * (1 - (product _ (n &gt;= 1))@(real-part@(e) * list@(pi _ n * g * (x _ n / norm@(x _ n)), x _ n / norm@(x _ n))))" xml:id="A1.Ex135.m3">

                                      </XMApp>

                                        <XMWrap>

                                        </XMWrap>
                                      </XMDual>
                                      <XMApp>
                                        <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                                        <XMApp>

          <p class="ltx_intertext">since <Math mode="inline" tex="||{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{x}}||={\displaystyle}\prod_{n\geq 1}{||{x_{n}}||}" text="norm@(x) = (product _ (n &gt;= 1))@(norm@(x _ n))" xml:id="A1.Ex136.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>

                      <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="A1.Ex136.m1.1">x</XMTok>

                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post9"/>
                      <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="product" name="prod" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∏</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>

                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN">||</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="A1.Ex136.m1.2">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post11"/>

              </XMath>
            </Math>=1. Thus</p>

                              <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>

                      </XMApp>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math></td>

        <p>Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon" text="varepsilon" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be any positive number. Since the representations <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{1},\dots,\pi_{N}" text="list@(pi _ 1, dots, pi _ N)" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="A1.SS2.p5.m14.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="A1.SS2.p5.m14.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="A1.SS2.p5.m14.3"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m14.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m14.1">…</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m14.3">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> are strongly continuous, and the map
<Math mode="inline" tex="\smash{\xymatrix{g\ar@{|-&gt;}[r]&amp;\sum_{n\geq 1}|1-{{\langle{\pi_{n}(g){a_{n}}},{%&#10;a_{n}}\rangle}}|}}" text="[\xymatrix] * g * [\ar] * @ * ket@(-) * delimited-[]@(r) * &amp; * (sum _ (n &gt;= 1))@(absolute-value@(1 - list@(pi _ n * g * a _ n, a _ n)))" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\xymatrix</ERROR>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\ar</ERROR>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">@</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="ket"/>
                    <XMRef idref="A1.SS2.p5.m15.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m15.1">-</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="CLOSE">&gt;</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="delimited-[]"/>
                    <XMRef idref="A1.SS2.p5.m15.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m15.2">r</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">&amp;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∑</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                      <XMRef idref="A1.SS2.p5.m15.4"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m15.4">
                        <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                            <XMRef idref="A1.SS2.p5.m15.4.1"/>
                            <XMRef idref="A1.SS2.p5.m15.4.2"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m15.4.1">
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post6"/>
                                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMDual>
                                <XMRef idref="A1.SS2.p5.m15.3"/>
                                <XMWrap>
                                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m15.3">g</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post7"/>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m15.4.2">
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post6"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is continuous at the point <Math mode="inline" tex="e" text="e" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, the
quantity
<Math mode="inline" tex="||\boldsymbol{\pi}(g){\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{x}}-{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{x%&#10;}}||^{2}" text="(norm@(pi * g * x - x)) ^ 2" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m17">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                    <XMRef idref="A1.SS2.p5.m17.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN">||</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m17.2">
                      <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP" rpadding="0.8pt">-</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="bold italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="A1.SS2.p5.m17.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m17.1">g</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" rpadding="0.8pt" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE">||</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is less than <Math mode="inline" tex="\varepsilon^{2}" text="varepsilon ^ 2" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m18">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> if <Math mode="inline" tex="g" text="g" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m19">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
lies in a suitable neighborhood of <Math mode="inline" tex="e" text="e" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m20">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. This proves the continuity of the
map
<Math mode="inline" tex="\smash{\xymatrix{g\ar@{|-&gt;}[r]&amp;\boldsymbol{\pi}(g){\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{x}%&#10;}.}}" text="[\xymatrix] * g * [\ar] * @ * ket@(-) * delimited-[]@(r) * &amp; * pi * g * x" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m21">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="A1.SS2.p5.m21.4"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m21.4">
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <ERROR class="undefined">\xymatrix</ERROR>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                    <ERROR class="undefined">\ar</ERROR>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">@</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="ket"/>

                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>

                    </XMDual>

                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">&amp;</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="bold italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="A1.SS2.p5.m21.3"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="A1.SS2.p5.m21.3">g</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" rpadding="0.8pt" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math></p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="A1.SS2.p6">
        <p>We finish this appendix by giving a sufficient condition for an infinite
tensor product representation on a space <Math mode="inline" tex="{\bigotimes_{n\geq 1}^{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{a}}{H_{n}}}" text="((tensor-product _ (n &gt;= 1)) ^ a)@(H _ n)" xml:id="A1.SS2.p6.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="tensor-product" name="bigotimes" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⊗</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="bold italic" fontsize="70%" lpadding="0.8pt" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> to be weakly
mixing: let, for each <Math mode="inline" tex="{n\geq 1}" text="n &gt;= 1" xml:id="A1.SS2.p6.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="{H_{n}}" text="H _ n" xml:id="A1.SS2.p6.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be a separable Hilbert space, <Math mode="inline" tex="{a_{n}}" text="a _ n" xml:id="A1.SS2.p6.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> a
vector of <Math mode="inline" tex="{H_{n}}" text="H _ n" xml:id="A1.SS2.p6.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> with <Math mode="inline" tex="||{a_{n}}||=1" text="norm@(a _ n) = 1" xml:id="A1.SS2.p6.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                    <XMRef idref="A1.SS2.p6.m6.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN">||</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="A1.SS2.p6.m6.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE">||</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, and
<Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{n}" text="pi _ n" xml:id="A1.SS2.p6.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> a unitary representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="A1.SS2.p6.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{n}" text="H _ n" xml:id="A1.SS2.p6.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
We suppose that the assumptions of either Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_3.2.0"/> (when <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="A1.SS2.p6.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is locally compact) or Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_3.2"/> (in the general case) are
<!--  %**** String Line 2725 **** -->satisfied, so that <Math mode="inline" tex="\boldsymbol{\pi}={\otimes}_{n\geq 1}\pi_{n}" xml:id="A1.SS2.p6.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="bold italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a unitary
representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="A1.SS2.p6.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
on <Math mode="inline" tex="{\bigotimes_{n\geq 1}^{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{a}}{H_{n}}}" text="((tensor-product _ (n &gt;= 1)) ^ a)@(H _ n)" xml:id="A1.SS2.p6.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="tensor-product" name="bigotimes" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⊗</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="bold italic" fontsize="70%" lpadding="0.8pt" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Then</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_proposition" inlist="thm theorem:proposition" labels="LABEL:Proposition_4.3" xml:id="A1.Thmtheorem3">
        <tags>
          <tag>Proposition A.3</tag>
          <tag role="autoref">A.3</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">A.3</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Proposition A.3</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Proposition A.3</text></tag></title>
        <para xml:id="A1.Thmtheorem3.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">In the case where</text></p>
          <equation xml:id="A1.Ex139">
            <Math mode="display" tex="\underline{\lim}_{\,n\to+\infty}m(|{{\langle{\pi_{n}(\,\centerdot\,){a_{n}}},{%&#10;a_{n}}\rangle}}|^{2})=0," text="(underline@(limit)) _ (n to + infinity) * m * (absolute-value@(list@(pi _ n * centerdot * a _ n, a _ n))) ^ 2 = 0" xml:id="A1.Ex139.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="A1.Ex139.m1.2"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="A1.Ex139.m1.2">
                      <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok name="underline" role="UNDERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                            <XMTok meaning="limit" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="mid">lim</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" lpadding="1.7pt" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="A1.Ex139.m1.2.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="A1.Ex139.m1.2.1">
                              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMDual>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                                  <XMRef idref="A1.Ex139.m1.2.1.1"/>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMWrap>
                                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                                  <XMDual xml:id="A1.Ex139.m1.2.1.1">
                                    <XMApp>
                                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                                      <XMRef idref="A1.Ex139.m1.2.1.1.1"/>
                                      <XMRef idref="A1.Ex139.m1.2.1.1.2"/>
                                    </XMApp>
                                    <XMWrap>
                                      <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                                      <XMApp xml:id="A1.Ex139.m1.2.1.1.1">
                                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                        <XMApp>
                                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post6"/>
                                          <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                                        </XMApp>
                                        <XMDual>
                                          <XMRef idref="A1.Ex139.m1.1"/>
                                          <XMWrap>
                                            <XMTok role="OPEN" rpadding="1.7pt" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                            <XMTok name="centerdot" role="MULOP" rpadding="1.7pt" xml:id="A1.Ex139.m1.1">∙</XMTok>
                                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                          </XMWrap>
                                        </XMDual>
                                        <XMApp>
                                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post7"/>
                                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                                        </XMApp>
                                      </XMApp>
                                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                                      <XMApp xml:id="A1.Ex139.m1.2.1.1.2">
                                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post6"/>
                                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                                      </XMApp>
                                      <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                                    </XMWrap>
                                  </XMDual>
                                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
          </equation>
          <p><text font="italic">the representation <Math mode="inline" tex="\boldsymbol{\pi}={\otimes}_{n\geq 1}\pi_{n}" xml:id="A1.Thmtheorem3.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="bold" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is weakly mixing.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <ERROR class="undefined">{proof}</ERROR>
      <para xml:id="A1.SS2.p7">
        <p>The proof of Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_4.3"/> relies on the same idea as
that of Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:Proposition_3.2"/>: let <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{x}}={\otimes}_{n\geq 1}{x_{n}}" xml:id="A1.SS2.p7.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="bold italic" lpadding="0.8pt" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{y}}={\otimes}_{n\geq 1}{y_{n}}" xml:id="A1.SS2.p7.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="bold italic" lpadding="0.8pt" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be two elementary vectors in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\bigotimes_{n\geq 1}^{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{a}}{H_{n}}}" text="((tensor-product _ (n &gt;= 1)) ^ a)@(H _ n)" xml:id="A1.SS2.p7.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="tensor-product" name="bigotimes" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⊗</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="bold italic" fontsize="70%" lpadding="0.8pt" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> with
<Math mode="inline" tex="||{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{x}}||=||{\mskip 1.5mu \boldsymbol{y}}||=1" text="norm@(x) = norm@(y) = 1" xml:id="A1.SS2.p7.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                    <XMRef idref="A1.SS2.p7.m4.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN">||</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="A1.SS2.p7.m4.1">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE">||</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                    <XMRef idref="A1.SS2.p7.m4.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN">||</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="A1.SS2.p7.m4.2">y</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE">||</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. We have</p>
        <equationgroup class="ltx_eqn_align" xml:id="A1.EGx14">

          <p class="ltx_intertext">for every <Math mode="inline" tex="n\geq 1" text="n &gt;= 1" xml:id="A1.Ex141.m1">

                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE">||</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post9"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="210%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                        <XMTok fontsize="210%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                      <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok fontsize="210%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok fontsize="210%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post9"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                                <XMRef idref="A1.Ex142.m2.2"/>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN">||</XMTok>
                                <XMApp xml:id="A1.Ex142.m2.2">
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post10"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE">||</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post9"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="210%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                        <XMTok fontsize="210%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math></td>
              </MathBranch>
            </MathFork>
          </equation>
          <p class="ltx_intertext">Squaring and taking the mean on both sides we obtain that</p>
